Both intimate and sweeping, this work questions the price of pride and the cost of prosperity and contrasts illusions of grandeur and happiness with the pitiless truth that kills all hope and desire. As readers will learn, this is the fatal spell of Sicily—an island of loss and change—where death alone is eternal.
 
A Taste of Trinàcria

Sicilian pastry expresses the island's Baroque imagination. For generations, master bakers have molded fruit out of marzipan and knights out of sugar. This tradition continues at Villabate-Alba Pasticceria and Bakery in Bensonhurst, Brooklyn.
The Alaimo family, whose ancestral town of Villabate is the novel's main setting, still make traditional cannoli and cassata. During November, the Month of the Dead, however, they also bake ossi di morti, almond cookies resembling human bones.
In the same spirit, Guernica Editions serves you "Eternal Death." Orginally published in Feile-Festa; The Literary Arts Journal of the Mediterranean Celtic Cultural Association, this excerpt from Trinàcria introduces the ghost of the Marchesa of Scalea. "The Latest Invasion," the book's prologue, is posted in our gallery. A $25 donation buys a PDF of the entire novel.
 

Advanced Praise 

Read what critics have to say about Trinàcria:

“History,” T. S. Eliot observed, “has many cunning passages, contrived corridors.” Anthony Di Renzo’s novella Trinàcria: A Tale of Bourbon Sicily demonstrates how cunningly we all contrive to find in history only the lessons we want to. The book’s narrator, to our initial surprise, is the mummified corpse of Zita Valanguerra Spinelli, Marchesa of Scalea (1794-1882), who had adopted the nom de plume of Trinàcria, an ancient name for Sicily. But soon the voice of this long-dead wit and salonnière—arrogant, erudite, and vengeful—grows as familiar to us as the thousand little lies we tell ourselves each day. Donna Zita represents Di Renzo’s spirited rejoinder to Giuseppe Tomasi di Lampedusa’s classic novel Il Gattopardo (The Leopard), a nostalgic portrayal of old aristocratic Sicily and its privileged world, swept away by Garibaldi’s conquest. Less objective than Lampedusa’s Prince Fabrizio Corbera, Marchesa Spinelli blames the commercial and materialistic forces unleashed by Sicily’s unification with the new kingdom of Italy for ushering in a vapid culture in which the presiding deity is money. But more “things” will never make people better: “We aristocrats have plenty of things,” Donna Zita remarks, “and we are proud and vicious.”
Di Renzo’s writing is vivid and brimful of sardonic humor. He specializes in crisp evocations of outdoor scenes, such as the bustling streets of Naples or the unforgettably cruel festival of the Cuccagna; but the main attraction is the marchesa herself, a force of nature as powerful and inexorable as the Sicilian sun in July.
~Peter D'Epiro and Mary Desmond Pinkowish, authors of Sprezzatura: 50 Ways Italian Genius Shaped the World
“The past never dies,” says Zita Valanguerra Spinelli, Marchesa of Scalea, the narrator and protagonist of Trinàcria: A Tale of Bourbon Sicily. Neither does the eternal appeal of Sicily. The Italian American writer Anthony Di Renzo has breathed new life into the glorious tradition of the Sicilian historical novel.
This fascinating book dialogues with literature, cinema, and the figurative arts. Di Renzo not only evokes the history of the Bourbons and the Risorgimento but also captures Sicily’s aura as a “paper island,” an imaginative world created by Italy’s most important modern writers. His novel will remind readers of De Roberto's The Viceroys and Tomasi di Lampedusa’s The Leopard, two different and perhaps even opposite works. The first seems to have inspired Di Renzo’s love for the surreal and grotesque, the second his lyricism and elegiac melancholy.
Donna Zita is a fascinating character. She is romantic and enlightened, rebellious and ambitious, beautiful and mysterious. Her nickname Trinacrìa, one of Sicily’s most ancient names, shows her complete identification with this paradoxical island: wild but cultured, timeless but ephemeral, sparkling but bleak. For Zita, as for Sicily, the present is transient, while the past is eternal. Sicily here is simultaneously myth and reality. While the novel’s historical data is accurate and authentic, this book appeals to the eye more than the mind. From the opening scene in which a Hollywood crew prepares to shoot an epic about Garibaldi's Thousand in Palermo, the reader is carried away by a montage of beautiful images. Through sheer witchcraft, Anthony Di Renzo recreates the timeless spell of the Medusa.
~Margherita Ganeri, author of The Italian Historical Novel
Anthony Di Renzo’s Trinàcria peels away layers of 19th-century Sicilian history in a way that academic and popular studies of this period cannot. The novel provides an intimate perspective on sweeping public events. Di Renzo tells the story of Zita Valanguerra Spinelli, Marchesa of Scalea, who is a composite of two historical figures:  Antonia Vassallo, Princess of Bellaprima, and Alessandra Spadafora, Duchess of Santa Rosalia. During her long life, Donna Zita meets kings and queens, great composers, poets, and foreign entrepreneurs seeking to make their fortunes off her island's bounty.  Di Renzo’s sardonic depiction of the Marchesa's deeply felt cynicism often kicks the modern reader in the gut: the brutality of husbands toward wives; the cruelty of fathers toward children; the impact of a woman's revenge and of her unyielding, unforgiving pride; above all, the lost promise of Italy's Unification to Sicilians This finely crafted novel glitters with polished metaphors and sparking epigrams. It is a marvelous work in the tradition of Dacia Maraini's The Silent Duchess.
~John Keahey, author of Seeking Sicily
A triumph of wit and eloquence, Anthony Di Renzo’s Trinàcria: A Tale of Bourbon Sicily displays a thorough knowledge of Italian culture, weaving fascinating historical material with astute commentaries about Italian life, ancient and modern. Di Renzo creates unforgettable scenes sometimes operatic in their intensity.  His confident, beguiling style will remind readers of Giuseppe Tomasi di Lampedusa’s in The Leopard and of Salman Rushdie’s at his very best.  Like these authors, Di Renzo adroitly dips in and out of magical realism, but never lets technique interfere with fast plotting and vivid characterization.  The novel’s brilliant, bedraggled narrator, the Marchesa of Scalea (nicknamed Trinàcria, after the three-legged symbol of Sicily), is always lively, even when speaking from her tomb, full of wisdom, caustic humor and eccentric charm.  Her tragicomic story makes Trinàcria an enormously satisfying historical novel.
~Edward Hower, author of The New Life Hotel and Storms of May
What a great read this novel is, better than a trip to Sicily!  Full of shock and delight, Trinàcria forms a fascinating epic about Bourbon Palermo on the eve of disaster.  In the book's title character, the Marchesa of Scalea, Anthony Di Renzo creates a woman who demonstrates the folly and passion of living life defiantly on the brink.  Few writers are better at showing the intimate, sometimes comic connections between the past and the present, between the old world and the new. If you love drama and discovery, you will enjoy Trinàcria: A Tale of Bourbon Sicily.
~Jeanne Mackin, author of The Sweet By and By and Dreams of Empire
Trinàcria: A Tale of Bourbon Sicily is a completely original look at a long-maligned and misunderstood island—a part of and yet always apart from the modern political construct of Italy. In a work rich with history, Anthony Di Renzo takes the reader into Sicily’s pre-unification past by having the mummified dead of Palermo’s Capuchin catacombs confront a film crew from Italy’s dolce vita era. This fascinating metaphysical and psychological landscape is replete with Redshirts, petty nobility, studio hacks, and two centuries of bitter Sicilian wisdom. "We all have skeletons in the closet," says the Marchesa of Scalea, the novel’s narrator and protagonist. “If they must rattle, they may as well dance.” And dance they do in a macabre but spirited tarantella.
~Paul Paolicelli, author of Dances with Luigi and Under the Southern Sun
Most historical fiction paints the past in flattering oils. Trinàcria: A Tale of Bourbon Sicily is etched in acid. Goya could have created this novel’s caustic characters, particularly its protagonist and narrator, Zita Valanguerra Spinelli, the baleful Marchesa of Scalea, whose crest is modeled after the three-legged gorgon of Sicily. Donna Zita recounts her life from a crypt in Palermo’s Capuchin Catacombs. Outrage over lost privilege has given her a posthumous case of acid reflux. But as the Marchesa relives past violations—her land scorched to dust by the pitiless Sicilian sun; her carriage hacked to pieces by Garibaldi’s Red Shits; her crest and nom de plume Trinàcria, the ancient name of Sicily, turned into a label for cheap, mass-produced vinegar—readers learn to sympathize with this spiteful banshee.
Anthony Di Renzo’s masterful, richly textured and layered narrative never hesitates to challenge its own discourse of storytelling, to question the ways craft transforms history into fiction.  But it also poses an ethical challenge. Like the Marchesa, the author confronts our complacency and demands that we examine our own vanities, political hubris, and fragility. Will we take responsibility for our individual and collective histories or float into oblivion, thinking life was all a trick? This spellbinding narrative leaves us with no answers, only the lingering scent of broom.
~Shona Ramaya, author of Flute, Beloved Mother, Queen of Night, and Operation Monsoon

About the Author
A fugitive from advertising, Anthony Di Renzo teaches writing and Italian American history at Ithaca College and has appeared in Alimentum, Il Caffé, Cottonwood Magazine, Essays & Fictions, Feile-Festa, The Normal School, River Styx, Syracuse Scholar, and Voices in Italian Americana. His most recent book Bitter Greens: Essays on Food, Politics, and Ethnicity from the Imperial Kitchen (State University of New York Press, 2010) was praised by Gastonomica: The Journal of Food and Culture.
On a more personal note, Di Renzo on his mother's side descends from Spanish nobility, who settled in Bagheria, Sicily in the early 18th century. He now lives near the West End, Ithaca, New York's former Italian neighborhood, "an Old World man in a New Age town." Trinàcria will be his first published novel.
For more information about the author and his work, visit:

http://faculty.ithaca.edu/direnzo

Our Sponsor
This book campaign is made possible by the Italian Cultural Foundation at Casa Belevedere. A stately Italianate villa with a breathtaking view of the Verrazano Bridge, Casa Belvedere hosts Italian language, culinary, art, and music classes, as well as galas, fashion shows, wine tastings, exhibits, and symposiums focused on Italian themes.
These events open a window to the past.
Last year, the foundation capped its commemoration of the Sesquicentennial of the Risorgimento with a public debate on Italian Unification. Moderated by Cavaliere Vincenzo Marra, this lively exchange between Pino Aprile, author of Terroni (Piemme 2010), and Lorenzo del Boca, author of Polentoni (Piemme 2011) touched upon the often painful historical and political issues discussed in Trinàcria. story:
The 437th Annual Snowball Fight is a holiday children's book for 4-7 year olds. The story centers on Juniper the elf and the lessons he learns on his very first snowball fight.

  • To make this book happen we need $1100. Those funds pay the illustrator, cover copyright fees, ISBN and barcode costs, and initial print advertising. 
  • There are four reward levels. $10 or more gets you a copy of the ebook. $20 or more gets you the ebook and a limited edition bookmark. $50 or more gets you the ebook, the bookmark, and a printed copy of the book when its available next holiday season. $100 or more gets you the ebook, the bookmark, the book, and a Juniper the elf ornament for next year's Christmas tree!
  • If for some reason we don't reach our financial goal, the funds we do raise will still be used toward the project. The first priority in this crowdsourcing project is paying the illustrator and anything raised above his $600 fee will go toward the copyright and ISBN costs, etc.
  • This book is a perfect present for the little ones and we believe kids are better off reading than not reading. We're big fans of children's literature ("Where the Wild Things Are", "How the Grinch Stole Christmas") and were heavily influenced by the fundamentals illustrated in them. With previous classics in mind, we set out to make an iconic Christmas favorite of our own... with a little moral learning thrown in for good measure. 


If you're in love "The 437th Annual Snowball Fight" as much as we are, but can't donate, don't worry! If you'd like to help us by spreading the word that would be incredible. Please direct friends and family to 437snowballfight.com and know that we are grateful for your time and your efforts.

Thanks!

The 437th Annual Snowball Fight is a holiday children's book for 4-7 year olds. The story centers on Juniper the elf and the lessons he learns on his very first snowball fight.
To make this book happen we need $1100. Those funds pay the illustrator, cover copyright fees, ISBN and barcode costs, and initial print advertising. 

There are four reward levels. $10 or more gets you a copy of the ebook. $20 or more gets you the ebook and a limited edition bookmark. $50 or more gets you the ebook, the bookmark, and a printed copy of the book when its available next holiday season. $100 or more gets you the ebook, the bookmark, the book, and a Juniper the elf ornament for next year's Christmas tree!
If for some reason we don't reach our financial goal, the funds we do raise will still be used toward the project. The first priority in this crowdsourcing project is paying the illustrator and anything raised above his $600 fee will go toward the copyright and ISBN costs, etc.

This book is a perfect present for the little ones and we believe kids are better off reading than not reading. We're big fans of children's literature ("Where the Wild Things Are", "How the Grinch Stole Christmas") and were heavily influenced by the fundamentals illustrated in them. With previous classics in mind, we set out to make an iconic Christmas favorite of our own... with a little moral learning thrown in for good measure. 

If you're in love "The 437th Annual Snowball Fight" as much as we are, but can't donate, don't worry! If you'd like to help us by spreading the word that would be incredible. Please direct friends and family to 437snowballfight.com and know that we are grateful for your time and your efforts.Thanks!

story:
The Endless Table;  Recipes From Departed Loved Ones

Featuring Tom Colicchio, Ben Ford, Jasper White, Amanda Hesser, Jose Andres, Jody Adams, Michel Nischan, Naomi Duguid, Tim Ferriss, Marc Forgione, Gordon Hamersley, Kathleen Flinn, Ina Garten, Jeffrey Zurofsky, Roger Berkowitz, Steve DiFillippo, Kathy Gunst, Ellen Goodman, Michael Hebb, Roberta MacDonald, and Christopher Kimball. Photography by Annie Musselman.  Designed by Civilization. Styled by Ashley Helvey. 


We asked 20 of our country's leading chefs and food writers to send a recipe and a story.  Not your average recipe and story, but instead a very important one. 

We asked for recipes from their loved ones who are no longer with us. And we asked them to tell us a story about this person, this recipe, and about their last days - in short - the end of their life. Was it tragic, or a thoughtful departure after a long full life. These are powerful stories for us to tell and share. 


How we die in America is pretty messed up. The Conversation Project and DeathoverDinner are working to change it. We want people to know what their loved ones want. We want people to know what they personally want. We want people to be able to speak openly about end of life fears and hopes. AT THE KITCHEN TABLE, NOT IN THE ICU. This simple conversation can change the care model. It can change how we die in America. 

After inspiring thousands of people to come to the table, we wanted to have some comfort food to serve alongside this important conversation. The idea for a cookbook was born. A very unusual cookbook. A cookbook that asks us to remember the people that are no longer with us, and celebrate the food they cooked us, the food we shared. 

It will launch on Dec 15th 2014 as an e-book ($15, available on itunes, kindle, nook), and in the coming year we will expand it into a beautifully printed cookbook. We are also building an interactive website where you can post your own recipes from departed loved ones - extending the table - making it ENDLESS. 

All we need is some final funding to complete the design and production. 

We would love your help making this project a reality. Please support our modest campaign and help us bring these recipes, stories and this conversation to the world. 

Proceeds from the Endless Table e-cookbook downloads will fund our two non-profit organizations www.deathoverdinner.org and www.theconversationproject.org.  



The Endless Table


excerpt from: Jose Andres, Vegetable Paella In Memory of David Pearson

"...I don’t like funerals, but when David’s parents told me there would be a celebration of his life, I knew I had to be there. I was blown away by how many people came to remember this amazing boy. Hundreds and hundreds of loved ones gathered to share stories and feast on paella, the very same paella we made in my backyard the first time we met. I thought to myself, this is a party, and I was so happy because I knew in my heart it was how David would’ve wanted it to be. Friends and family, together, united over one meal. When I go, I want it to be like that. I will always carry David’s spirit with me. He was a selfless, passionate young man and he inspires me every single day. Every time I make this vegetable paella, I smile and remember David, and I think of how lucky the angels in heaven are to have a chef like him."


excerpt from: Christopher Kimball, Mary Alice's Creamed Summer Corn

"...When she died, I took the ancient birch and gut snowshoes; there is nothing better in deep snow. They are a reminder that Mary Alice was fond of gearing up to challenge the elements or whatever else stood in her way. She knew the secret of life, taking that first step.

Her legacy is the garden and the cornfield – this is still our family’s hallowed ground. We plant every year with the expectation of those first sweet ears, quickly boiled or creamed. Good food always makes good memories."


excerpt from; Kathleen Flinn, Blueberry Jam like my Grandad’s

"We sat quietly, eating our biscuits and jam. It made me wonder, what would I have said to my father if I had known then it was our last conversation? I’d have told him that I loved him. But he knew that. I didn’t know then to tell him that I’d miss him every day for the rest of my life. That I’d be lonely for him on every Father’s Day, and I would pretend to be happy when he wasn’t there at my graduations or the day I married.

If could have one brief conversation with him one now, I’d ask the secret to his chicken and dumplings.

I’ve been trying to make my father’s version for more than 30 years ago. The dumplings vex me. They’re always soggy or bland or both. What am I doing wrong? So irrational, but somewhere my heart believes that if I can get that recipe right, I can have him back, just for a moment. Just for one bite.

All this, from a bit of jam on a biscuit."

story:
“I saw her living a life of poetry that was communal—not that she sought readers out in the greater world…but readers were there, in the living room, in Goshen, Vermont. When you were there you felt yourself to be in the heart of the poetry family.” –Sharon Olds

WE NEED YOUR HELP TO SAVE RUTH STONE'S LEGENDARY LITERARY LANDMARK HOME, FOR FUTURE GENERATIONS OF POETS AND ARTISTS.
 

After the late poet, Ruth Stone, received the Shelley Award for poetry in the 1950's, she was able to purchase her farmhouse in Goshen, Vermont. Soon after her husband abruptly took his own life. Widowed, mother of three, Ruth made a living through poetry--endless struggle though it was. Goshen was the rock that kept everything together; a haven of poetry, art, music, and community.  The house was bought, repaired, and held up with poetry. It's no wonder that when she passed away in 2011, she left her estate in Trust, for the furthering of poetry and the arts. Paving the way for future generations to bask in the same sun.

Since before her death in 2011, Ruth Stone’s treasured home has fallen into grave disrepair. The Ruth Stone Foundation needs your help now to make critical, immediate changes to the structure in order to save it. These changes are crucial for the house, as well as the papers, books, and possessions within the house. 

In Ruth's lifetime writers came and went, slept under those old beams, wrote poems on the porches and beside the roaring fireplaces, sharing in the powerful duende of Ruth's haven. 

We want to keep that spirit alive, and the art occurring under the roof thriving. We want to rescue her house so that it might continue, as it once was, to be a poet's house, a place for great minds to come together, to collaborate and break new ground in the arts and science. 

We cannot do that without your help. Whether it's donating to our fund raiser, or simply spreading the word. 


KEEP READING FOR MORE INFORMATION!

“The intensity in this Goshen house offers little room for a middle-ground. It’s passion in the web or out you go in a passion.” –Jan Freeman


Who We Are

Hello! We’re the Ruth Stone Foundation, a nonprofit literary organization created by the trustees of Ruth Stone’s estate. Our mission is to celebrate the legacy of poet, Ruth Stone, and to foster creation of the finest contemporary poetry and art.

The Foundation is based around the restoration of Ruth Stone’s physical estate in Goshen, Vermont, which will serve as an intimate writer’s retreat, artist space, and historical landmark. Our mission also focuses on advancing women poets, providing safe, inspiring environments for them to work on their craft.

A Breakdown of The Situation 

There are two 1800's houses on the land: a main house, a very old (two-story) one room house, and well as a small chapel built by Ruth Stone's family in the 1970’s. The houses have all stood unprotected and ignored for years, and it wasn’t until after Ruth Stone’s death in 2011 that their problems began to be seriously addressed. While dedicated to the restoration of this property, we do not have the funding to go forward with saving it.

We’ve used money we raised in 2013 to work closely with professional architects to assess the amount of damage done, through detailed descriptions and "existing condition" architectural drawings. The estimates of the overall cost to make this a fully functional community space are well over 700,000 dollars. However, we’re asking for 25,000 to stabilize the house and attend to immediate needs so that it doesn’t get any worse than it already is.

We have been working tirelessly with volunteers  over the past two years to rescue the contents of the house. This is very delicate work, because so much has been damaged, and is very important to the historical literary aspect of the house. 

Where Funds from this Campaign Will Go

1. It’s very important work to get Ruth Stone possessions out of the house, to keep them safe, but also to make way for construction to begin. Part of the funds will go towards storage containers to carefully store the contents of the house, much of which has great, significant literary value

2. Fixing drainage on the house, to dry it out and keep it from further decay

3. Rewiring electricity 

4. Paying the necessary taxes and dues associated with the property 

5. Carpentry to stabilize the house to protect from further damage 


You only have to open a book of Ruth Stone’s poetry at random to see how important this house was to her writing. It was her haven, her muse. And she shared that with whomever was lucky enough to come through the front door. 

Hillery Stone beside the "little house"

Ruth Stone, her daughters Phoebe, Abigail, and Marcia, with friends and family in Goshen.


Sharon Olds & Ruth Stone

Toi Derricotte 

The brook beside the house

“I saw her living a life of poetry that was communal—not
that she sought readers out in the greater world…but readers were there, in the
living room, in Goshen, Vermont. When you were there you felt yourself to be in
the heart of the poetry family.” –Sharon Olds

WE NEED YOUR HELP TO SAVE RUTH STONE'S LEGENDARY LITERARY LANDMARK HOME, FOR FUTURE GENERATIONS OF POETS AND ARTISTS.
 


After the late poet, Ruth Stone, received the Shelley Award
for poetry in the 1950's, she was able to purchase her farmhouse in Goshen, Vermont. Soon after her husband abruptly took his own life. Widowed,
mother of three, Ruth made a living through poetry--endless struggle though it was. Goshen was the rock that kept everything together; a haven of poetry, art,
music, and community.  The house was
bought, repaired, and held up with poetry. It's no wonder that when she passed away in 2011, she left
her estate in Trust, for the furthering of poetry and the arts. Paving the way for future generations to bask in the same sun.
Since before her death in 2011, Ruth Stone’s treasured home has fallen into grave
disrepair. The Ruth Stone Foundation needs your help now to make critical,
immediate changes to the structure in order to save it. These changes are crucial for the house, as well as the papers, books, and possessions within the house. 
In Ruth's lifetime writers came and went, slept under those old beams, wrote poems on the porches and beside the roaring fireplaces, sharing in the powerful duende of Ruth's haven. 
We want to keep that spirit alive, and the art occurring under the roof thriving. We want to rescue her house so that it might continue, as it once was, to be a poet's house, a place for great minds to come together, to collaborate and break new ground in the arts and science. 
We cannot do that without your help. Whether it's donating to our fund raiser, or simply spreading the word. 

KEEP READING FOR MORE INFORMATION!

story:
"Michael, Your Father Won't Be Coming Home..."

I was 14 the night my mother told me my father was gone for good.  

All my life I'd been promised that "families are forever"--literally forever--for all eternity.  Then my mother gives me this heart breaking news about my father--he's left and he won't be coming home.

What?

What would this mean for our family?

What I witnessed over the next seven years was devastating for me and for all of us.  I watched my family get torn apart, traumatized and broken by a vicious divorce battle in which the elders in my life took sides and engaged in the battle which left all of us--my parents, my three sisters, two brothers and myself--deeply wounded.

My story begins here, as an elder brother, grieving the loss of his family, his faith and his religious community, and wondering what his mission in life will be.

My love for my family would take me on a wild journey of exploration, truth-seeking, adventure and misadventure spanning six continents and many diverse philosophies, cultures and paradigms as I learned how to be a loving, healing, reuniting presence for my family.

Along the way I developed my own body of heart-centered work that has empowered people to stand powerfully connected to their hearts in the face great challenges such as family crises.

Around the world right now, there are people who've used this work to bring sacred reunion their families and to others' families, to honor their parents and elders before they die, to be compassionate activists, and more.

I want to support these people at the next level.  I want to put a book and other resources in their hands that can empower them to masterfully use this work in their own lives and facilitate it for others.

So, I've been writing it.  And it's almost finished.


Join Me!

I wish I could go back in time and give the book I'm writing and my life's work to the 14-year-old Michael and my parents.

I can't do that, but together with your help, we can reach many who might not otherwise find the help they need, and we can reach a far larger audience than I've been able to with my workshops and retreats over the past twelve years.

Your help will help reunite families... and may even save lives.  Watch this 3-minute video as a young father and Iraq War veteran, shares about how this work saved his life and allowed him to be present for his wife and children:

The event John attended in 2007 was special, because it was the first time I'd ever gifted the entire event.  We chose 30 people who inspired us by how they were standing for a more beautiful world, and we gifted them our 5-day $2,500 per person VisionForce iStand.

Gifting this event was the most amazing experience of my life.  And you can see how it impacted those who came in the video below:


Gifting my work (rather than selling it) has given my such profound joy, that I'm transitioning my entire "business model" to a "gifting model."  In fact,

This Book Will Be A Gift...

I'm gifting the ebook version of the book I'm writing (no charge).

I'm gifting almost all of the online tools, resources and trainings it links to online (no charge).

And I'm even gifting most of the trainings, retreats and other events around the world that the book invites people to attend.  In fact, I'd love to gift you the above event (see video) and my other events as well (even if you don't contribute to this campaign).

People may simply receive.  They are welcome to gift back or "pay it forward," if they so desire, but it's not expected.  My heart says GIVE, so I'm saying YES.

Those who contribute to this campaign or to me personally, I am calling "patrons."  I see a patron as someone who believes in a certain person and their gift, and wants to see that gift EXIST in the world, benefitting humanity.

The work I am sharing will go forward no matter how much money is raised by this campaign, because it's simply my work to do.  I view this work as a sacred gift that I am here to give, and so I will.

But it's far more fun to do along with people who believe in each other, and who share a common vision.

I want partnership. How about you?  I want to share myself and my life with people who love deeply and live courageously.  I've created some fun ways to collaborate with you and give back to you, when you become a patron and help fund this project (see the perks).

I want adventure.  How about you?  I want to share beautiful adventures with others who are creating the more beautiful world our hearts know is possible.  So, I'm creating some special ways you can join me on adventures around the world as well as learning adventures online (see the perks).
   

About My VISIONARY HEART Campaign: 

Right now I'm finishing a book called, VISIONARY HEART: Bringing Down My Walls, Standing For My People.  

I need $12,000 to self-publish a book which puts my work in the hands of the facilitators, therapists and inspired change agents (like you) around the world who are helping people through my work (or want to).

This book shares the true stories of me standing for my family, my family standing for each other, and others standing for their families in times of crisis.  In the process, it introduces the reader to the concepts, methods and other resources I have to offer to support them in standing for their family.

The book links to my gifted tools and trainings online, and invite them to attend my gifted events around the world.

It's 70% completed, and with your help I can finish it straight away.  The ebook version will be a gift to all.  But what's most exciting is the book will link to my work online in the form of PDF workbooks, audios, videos and more--which are also a gift to all.

Download A Sample Chapter Here (my gift to you). This sample chapter tells of how a process I call the Honor Window was created when I was confronted one day by a great friend who was a former girlfriend. When you download it, you'll get a sample of what became a very powerful tool in my work with people.

When you download this sample chapter, you'll also get access to the linked resource: The Introductory Honor Window exercise.  You'll get to experience this tool for yourself.

Expected completion date for 1st Release as PDF:  November 15, 2013

Expected completion date for self-published soft-cover on Amazon:  December 15, 2013


Help Me Reach $12,000

To support my path of following my heart and giving big, I've gotten my cost of living down very very low.  $6 a day gets me room, electricity, hot water and wifi!  I can get really inexpensive Thai massages to mitigate long hours on the laptop.  Food is my biggest expense.  I do travel around the world but usually only switch locations when someone gifts me a flight to come offer a workshop in their town.

You can help speed up the process, make it a lot easier for me, and help the book be professionally edited and presented.

I am finishing the book and continue gifting my work, regardless of funding.  This is simply my work to do, but with your help we can reach a far larger audience than I've been able to with my workshops and retreats over the past twelve years.

The costs of independent publishing are minimal.  The level of funding I'm asking for is just for a few months of my costs to live, so I can focus on the writing and creation of the content for everyone.  

My monthly costs of living and sharing my work online are minimal, about $2,000/month.  


$12,000 gets me 3 months of writing/working time (October thru December) plus a $6,000 budget to hire professional help with book design, editing and publishing.

This is enough time to finish the book, and the downloadable tools and resources it links to, and enough of a budget to be proud about the finished product.


STRETCH Goal: $24,000 

If we reach $24,000 I'll announce the next VisionForce iStand (the event that the people in the above videos attended).  The week long intensive will be a sacred gift for Soldier of Conscience like Thad Crouch and Gerry Rhis, the two iStand alumni in the video below.


This event is the one I had to cancel for lack of funds.  I've made promises to a lot of people that this event will happen, and people have already put money towards it.  If we reach $24,000 with this campaign, then I can hold this event as a GIFT for 30 or so courageous individuals, many of whom have been jailed and humiliated for taking a stand for being true to their conscience.
 

Regardless of how much money we raise, I want you to know this campaign is REAL. 

This campaign is not just a big dream or a "nice idea."  Your support will result in making a real difference in many people's lives. 

This work is already making a difference around the world, and I have a track record of starting and finishing numerous highly creative and original projects, which are currently making a difference around the world.

Right now there are people facilitating this work on several continents.  This book and the resources it links to online will help these people improve their ability to help others.


Fun Ways I Get To Tell You "THANK YOU" (Perks for Patrons):

I have an incredible amount of freedom, a huge desire to connect with people and to share this beautiful body of transformational work.  

So an EASY and EXCITING perk for me to give you is to spend time with you.  I'm traveling the world.  Consider either coming and joining me at retreats or on adventures, or inviting me to your town to lead a beautiful retreat as a gift to your friends and family.  

You inviting me to share life with you for a while and to give my gift IS a gift to me.  

If you've got cash in abundance, then even consider our next VisionForce Africa Safari, where we go and serve with the VisionForce work!


$333  Patron Appreciation Party

(ALL PATRONS INVITED to All Patron Appreciation Parties!  It doesn't matter whether you contribute $1 or $10,000, you're invited.  Those who choose the $333 perk become a party sponsor and get to host one of these parties.)

Your contribution of $333 allows me to stay at a healing retreat center here in Thailand w/tons of yoga, meditation, healthy food and good vibes.  I get to spend a month writing and doing my work in a great atmosphere.

Your Perk: You are host or sponsor of an amazing party.  I come to your home or choice of venues with some of my close friends (and visionary artists and musicians) for an awesome appreciation party (we invite ALL the awesome people who've contributed to this campaign as our gift to them) plus any special friends or loved ones, and we have an amazing evening of authentic relating games (for adults), music, pot luck feast & celebration.  The authentic relating games are absolutely incredible.

The party must be in or near a city that I regularly travel to, unless we take up a collection to pay for my travel to your city.  Current city options:  

US:
Texas: Austin, Houston, San Antonio, Dallas
Arizona:  Sedona or Phoenix, 
California: San Francisco, Sacramento, LA, Santa Barbara
Iowa: Fairfield, Des Moines, Cedar Rapids, Iowa City

Other Countries:
Kenya, Uganda, Brazil, Argentina, Panama, Thailand

I love sharing time like this with people who are investing in creating a more beautiful world.  I've worked hard most of my life and have sacrificed a lot, but I know the value of spending time like this together.   Time to rejuvenate, co-create and celebrate.

Also includes the signed book, Audio Commentary & Backstage Pass (It will *not* be as formal as the photo below, which is from the Dinner of Honor from my Australia iStand in 2010).


$1,000  Personal Relationship Miracle

If you're familiar with my work, you know that it gives people access to bringing down their walls of judgment and separation and seeing another with their heart.   Many people have transitioned through painful separation and deeply reunited through this work.

We'll go slow and I will walk you through your Honor Window work with a challenging relationship.   We'll spend up three sessions together (up to 5 hours in person or on Skype) as I take you through the same relationship transformation process I've used to support countless people in relationship crisis.  Includes 2 digital workbooks, the audio recordings of our sessions (if by phone), plus your signed 1st edition book, Audio Commentary, Backstage Pass & Visionary Mind program.

Here's a man at one of my events sharing what it was like to be seen and honored by women practicing my work:


$2,500  Private Week w/Me

Wow!  $2,500 gives me  a full month to write and work without worrying about expenses!

Please come stay up to a week with me anywhere I am in the world (through 2015). We'll do morning rituals together, share meals, have a few hours a day of coaching/training/conversation time and just enjoy life together.  During this phase of my life I'm traveling wherever my heart calls, and wherever I and my work are desired.  I'm celebrating being alive, and any given year you can expect to find living and adventuring among several different continents: Africa, South America, Europe, North America, Asia, etc. (Airfare and expenses are your own, but you're welcome to stay with me or a friend if available.)  

Naturally I'll ship you a signed copy of the 1st edition, Audio Commentary, Backstage Pass & Visionary Mind Program.  That's me in Cambodia earlier this year:



$3,500  Gifted Weekend Retreat

With your generous $3,500 contribution, you effectively sponsor an Honor Window Weekend for a community that afford can't fly me in.  There are already several communities who desire to receive this, and thanks to you they get to receive this beautiful work as a pure gift from you.

I feel deep gratitude...  As my way of saying Thank You, I will ALSO come to *your* home and hold one of these retreats for you and your family and friends.  We usually call these weekend retreats To Honor A Loved One, and they are an incredible gift to all involved (myself included).

I will cover my own travel costs to the community you sponsor (you are welcome to attend as well, but it's not required.).  You or your people are responsible for my airfare to the retreat at your place (might be very little if we wait until I'm already nearby), and for providing me meals and lodging.  We can keep costs down, as I'm delighted to stay with someone local and share living space and meals together.

When I come to your place, I'll also include a day before and after, preparing and reviewing with a focus on you mastering this work.  

I am offering 3 of these as perks for 2014 (6 total events).



$7,500 3-Week African Safari 

PURE AWESOMENESS!  

With your $7,500 we book you on our 2014 VisionForce Africa Safari!  3-weeks in Kenya and Uganda visiting and serving the visionary social entrepreneurs friends, Morris and Andrew, at their school in Kenya.  We'll spend time with and visit the home villages of our young visionary Maasai friends, Luka and Kamnen on the Maasai Mara; our young entrepreneurs in Kenya and Uganda such as Clovis; and more.     

We go every 4 years. Africa has changed me forever, I leave in tears everytime, as most who come with us do.  Prepare to feel ALIVE and CONNECTED to your heart and the hearts of others as perhaps never before. 

We'll also go on wild safari adventures.  You'll spend a night at Tree Tops, a few nights at Lake Nakuru, time on the Maasai Mara, and more.  We'll visit the homes and villages of our dear friends, plus visit and contribute to their schools and orphanages.  

I'll get all the expenses for you except airfare, souvenirs and extras.  Of course, I'll ship also you a signed copy of the 1st edition, Audio Commentary and Backstage Pass.  It's also possible to make a deposit towards this event, and reserve your seat.  Please email me for more details.


FAQ:

How does Indiegogo work?

What if I don't have money to donate, but still want to help?

What if I have additional question?

How does Indiegogo work?

When you choose to back a creative project on Indiegogo, you become an essential element in the creative process. Your contribution is both a necessary financial support and an encouraging “YES!” to me and my vision.

Here’s how you do it…

Step 1: Choose the amount you desire to contribute, and click the "Contribute Now" button.

Step 2: Claim your perk and how you want to pay. IT’S THAT EASY!

Then…

Step 3: Let your friends know about our project! Facebook, Twitter, blog or email anyone you think may be interested.

Step 4: You can check in on our campaign progress any time to see how it's going. We will send out updates to let you know how the book is coming along.

Step 5: Get excited, because soon you will receive your perks.


What If I don't have money to donate, but I still want to help?

First, THANK YOU!

Second, here are some ideas:

1 - Of course, share this campaign with folks--IT HELPS!  

2 - Download the chapter that shares about my Honor Window work, and go through it yourself.  This will be a gift to your heart and the heart of a loved one.  You are making a difference through this act alone.

3 - Consider ASKING someone else to make a perk contribution on your behalf.  You could offer them a service of some kind in exchange for their $, or you could JUST ASK with a sincere desire (you may be surprised at the response).


What If I Have Additional Questions?

If you have questions about me, my work or this campaign, please email me personally at miskye @ gmail dot com.



A Word of Gratitude...

I was gifted an incredible amount of love and guidance from my parents, my extended family and the religious community in which I was raised.  I've been gifted an incredible amount of loving support, feedback and wisdom by so many students who've participated in this work and allies who've supported this work.  

Some of the biggest gifts I've received are when people have come to me and just let me give to them completely.  I hope you'll give me that chance to give to you through my work.  

Thank you for your time and consideration.

This event is the one I had to cancel for lack of funds.  I've made promises to a lot of people that this event will happen, and people have already put money towards it.  If we reach $24,000 with this campaign, then I can hold this event as a GIFT for 30 or so courageous individuals, many of whom have been jailed and humiliated for taking a stand for being true to their conscience. 
Regardless of how much money we raise, I want you to know this campaign is REAL. 
This campaign is not just a big dream or a "nice idea."  Your support will result in making a real difference in many people's lives. 
This work is already making a difference around the world, and I have a track record of starting and finishing numerous highly creative and original projects, which are currently making a difference around the world.
Right now there are people facilitating this work on several continents.  This book and the resources it links to online will help these people improve their ability to help others.

Fun Ways I Get To Tell You "THANK YOU" (Perks for Patrons):I have an incredible amount of freedom, a huge desire to connect with people and to share this beautiful body of transformational work.  
So an EASY and EXCITING perk for me to give you is to spend time with you.  I'm traveling the world.  Consider either coming and joining me at retreats or on adventures, or inviting me to your town to lead a beautiful retreat as a gift to your friends and family.  
You inviting me to share life with you for a while and to give my gift IS a gift to me.  

If you've got cash in abundance, then even consider our next VisionForce Africa Safari, where we go and serve with the VisionForce work!


$333  Patron Appreciation Party

(ALL PATRONS INVITED to All Patron Appreciation Parties!  It doesn't matter whether you contribute $1 or $10,000, you're invited.  Those who choose the $333 perk become a party sponsor and get to host one of these parties.)
Your contribution of $333 allows me to stay at a healing retreat center here in Thailand w/tons of yoga, meditation, healthy food and good vibes.  I get to spend a month writing and doing my work in a great atmosphere.
Your Perk: You are host or sponsor of an amazing party.  I come to your home or choice of venues with some of my close friends (and visionary artists and musicians) for an awesome appreciation party (we invite ALL the awesome people who've contributed to this campaign as our gift to them) plus any special friends or loved ones, and we have an amazing evening of authentic relating games (for adults), music, pot luck feast & celebration.  The authentic relating games are absolutely incredible.
The party must be in or near a city that I regularly travel to, unless we take up a collection to pay for my travel to your city.  Current city options:  US:Texas: Austin, Houston, San Antonio, DallasArizona:  Sedona or Phoenix, California: San Francisco, Sacramento, LA, Santa BarbaraIowa: Fairfield, Des Moines, Cedar Rapids, Iowa CityOther Countries:Kenya, Uganda, Brazil, Argentina, Panama, Thailand
I love sharing time like this with people who are investing in creating a more beautiful world.  I've worked hard most of my life and have sacrificed a lot, but I know the value of spending time like this together.   Time to rejuvenate, co-create and celebrate.
Also includes the signed book, Audio Commentary & Backstage Pass (It will *not* be as formal as the photo below, which is from the Dinner of Honor from my Australia iStand in 2010).



$1,000  Personal Relationship Miracle
If you're familiar with my work, you know that it gives people access to bringing down their walls of judgment and separation and seeing another with their heart.   Many people have transitioned through painful separation and deeply reunited through this work.
We'll go slow and I will walk you through your Honor Window work with a challenging relationship.   We'll spend up three sessions together (up to 5 hours in person or on Skype) as I take you through the same relationship transformation process I've used to support countless people in relationship crisis.  Includes 2 digital workbooks, the audio recordings of our sessions (if by phone), plus your signed 1st edition book, Audio Commentary, Backstage Pass & Visionary Mind program.

Here's a man at one of my events sharing what it was like to be seen and honored by women practicing my work:


$2,500  Private Week w/Me

Wow!  $2,500 gives me  a full month to write and work without worrying about expenses!
Please come stay up to a week with me anywhere I am in the world (through 2015). We'll do morning rituals together, share meals, have a few hours a day of coaching/training/conversation time and just enjoy life together.  During this phase of my life I'm traveling wherever my heart calls, and wherever I and my work are desired.  I'm celebrating being alive, and any given year you can expect to find living and adventuring among several different continents: Africa, South America, Europe, North America, Asia, etc. (Airfare and expenses are your own, but you're welcome to stay with me or a friend if available.)  
Naturally I'll ship you a signed copy of the 1st edition, Audio Commentary, Backstage Pass & Visionary Mind Program.  That's me in Cambodia earlier this year:






$3,500  Gifted Weekend Retreat

With your generous $3,500 contribution, you effectively sponsor an Honor Window Weekend for a community that afford can't fly me in.  There are already several communities who desire to receive this, and thanks to you they get to receive this beautiful work as a pure gift from you.
I feel deep gratitude...  As my way of saying Thank You, I will ALSO come to *your* home and hold one of these retreats for you and your family and friends.  We usually call these weekend retreats To Honor A Loved One, and they are an incredible gift to all involved (myself included).
I will cover my own travel costs to the community you sponsor (you are welcome to attend as well, but it's not required.).  You or your people are responsible for my airfare to the retreat at your place (might be very little if we wait until I'm already nearby), and for providing me meals and lodging.  We can keep costs down, as I'm delighted to stay with someone local and share living space and meals together.
When I come to your place, I'll also include a day before and after, preparing and reviewing with a focus on you mastering this work.  
I am offering 3 of these as perks for 2014 (6 total events).





$7,500 3-Week African Safari 
PURE AWESOMENESS!  
With your $7,500 we book you on our 2014 VisionForce Africa Safari!  3-weeks in Kenya and Uganda visiting and serving the visionary social entrepreneurs friends, Morris and Andrew, at their school in Kenya.  We'll spend time with and visit the home villages of our young visionary Maasai friends, Luka and Kamnen on the Maasai Mara; our young entrepreneurs in Kenya and Uganda such as Clovis; and more.     
We go every 4 years. Africa has changed me forever, I leave in tears everytime, as most who come with us do.  Prepare to feel ALIVE and CONNECTED to your heart and the hearts of others as perhaps never before. 
We'll also go on wild safari adventures.  You'll spend a night at Tree Tops, a few nights at Lake Nakuru, time on the Maasai Mara, and more.  We'll visit the homes and villages of our dear friends, plus visit and contribute to their schools and orphanages.  
I'll get all the expenses for you except airfare, souvenirs and extras.  Of course, I'll ship also you a signed copy of the 1st edition, Audio Commentary and Backstage Pass.  It's also possible to make a deposit towards this event, and reserve your seat.  Please email me for more details.

How does Indiegogo work?
What if I don't have money to donate, but still want to help?
What if I have additional question?
How does Indiegogo work?
When you choose to back a creative project on Indiegogo, you become an essential element in the creative process. Your contribution is both a necessary financial support and an encouraging “YES!” to me and my vision.
Here’s how you do it…
Step 1: Choose the amount you desire to contribute, and click the "Contribute Now" button.
Step 2: Claim your perk and how you want to pay. IT’S THAT EASY!
Then…
Step 3: Let your friends know about our project! Facebook, Twitter, blog or email anyone you think may be interested.
Step 4: You can check in on our campaign progress any time to see how it's going. We will send out updates to let you know how the book is coming along.
Step 5: Get excited, because soon you will receive your perks.


What If I don't have money to donate, but I still want to help?
First, THANK YOU!
Second, here are some ideas:
1 - Of course, share this campaign with folks--IT HELPS!  
2 - Download the chapter that shares about my Honor Window work, and go through it yourself.  This will be a gift to your heart and the heart of a loved one.  You are making a difference through this act alone.
3 - Consider ASKING someone else to make a perk contribution on your behalf.  You could offer them a service of some kind in exchange for their $, or you could JUST ASK with a sincere desire (you may be surprised at the response).


What If I Have Additional Questions?
If you have questions about me, my work or this campaign, please email me personally at miskye @ gmail dot com.
A Word of Gratitude...
I was gifted an incredible amount of love and guidance from my parents, my extended family and the religious community in which I was raised.  I've been gifted an incredible amount of loving support, feedback and wisdom by so many students who've participated in this work and allies who've supported this work.  
Some of the biggest gifts I've received are when people have come to me and just let me give to them completely.  I hope you'll give me that chance to give to you through my work.  
Thank you for your time and consideration.

story:
Riddle: An Animated Story is an unofficial extension of the Harry Potter story. It tells the tale about the boy who made all the wrong choices, who eventually became the most powerful Dark Wizard of all time.

This animated series will center completely in Tom Marvolo Riddle, aka Lord Voldemort, since his early days in Wool´s Orphanage, to his brilliance way trough and eventual graduation from Hogwarts. This series will also tell the story of the creation of the first horcrux, and his thoughts following his rejection for the position of Defense Against the Dark Arts

Dean J.

Hello, I’m Dean Jewell, for the past 4 years I´ve been uploading videos to my YouTube channel Harry Potter Folklore, gathering tens of millions of views and almost half a million subscribers. This Project was born with the idea of giving back something to the fans.

I want to tell this story in professionally animated form. From voice actors, to re-creating some big characters in animated form, to creating exciting backgrounds, I feel my vision can become a reality. Over 10 years after the Harry Potter books and movies ended, the wizarding world still has one of the biggest fan bases in the world. I've always been that fan who wanted more.

Ed’Studios

All the way from Mexico, this studio formed by incredible talent of young people, not only they animate, they are in charge of the music, sound design, storyboards and  illustrations. 

They do everything with passion and it shows in the results. 

 

The animation itself! 

Animation and all the process behind it cost a good amount of money. For the quality that is needed to do this series justice, i'm attempting to raise $12,000 for the first 2, 4-5 min episodes. This is creating a new world in terms of creating places and characters that have never come to the big screen, especially Tom's father, his grandparents, Hepzibah Smith and we will recreate the moment Tom splits his soul for the first time.

In animation, detail is everything.

Over the last seven months, I have with a group of talented animators and artists, created a trailer of my vision of the tales I want to tell. You can watch the amazing trailer to see what are we creating.

 

 

Why am I doing this? That's an easy question. Harry Potter saved me, it made me feel like I wasn't alone, that it was ok to feel different and to stand out, even if that meant i could escape every now and then. I love this franchise so much and i just want to give something back to the fans of the wizarding world. I love Tom Riddle's story. I want it to become a visual reality in animated form, something we can all enjoy. I want also that fans could be part of this journey.

 

 

This will be a long and detailed process in terms of having the project completed, but the most important thing is IT WILL BE COMPLETED. I put my own money into making the trailer so you could see the amazing talent working in this, the trailer which took 6 months or planning and prep, including the work and release but it was an incredible journey. I want to continue this. Come join me.

 

If you can't contribute, that is completely fine. All I ask if that, if you believe in this project then please share it with other Harry Potter fans out there!

 

 

If you believe in this project, we will believe in you! So we try to give something back, something meaningful for all the fans who wish to contribute. 

You would like to see this project done, so we would like to thank you for making this a reality at the end of each episode in the credits! 

Review our memories! With this perk, receibe an eary access to the episode, so you can enjoy before anyone else! 

See what other people can't! See beyond the series, to see development, skecthes, process and more in this perk. Keep in touch with the production of the series. 

Where it began... receive a quality image of the place where Tom was born. Only 100 for grabs! 

One of the characters would talk in YOUR voice! Lend us your voice to be more involved in this project! 

Be a part of the class of 1938! Aappear in the series as a background character, you can even choose you house and robes! 

This is only for the ones who really want this project to be done, receive all the other perks, and also receive the signed soundtrack of the series besides an exclusive poster!

story:
TELL ME MORE ABOUT THE BOOK

We all are quanta, we breathe, drink and eat quanta. The whole universe is quanta and the quanta are those who connect everything and everybody.

Most people see quanta as a kind of an abstract something physicists deal with. Quanta seem to be bizarre particles or waves, which behave in a spooky way.

Are the quanta just the small particles like the photons, electrons, quarks, Higgs bosons, protons or are they more? How do quanta influence life, science, the development of the universe? 

Who are quanta? How and where do quanta act? How does gravity quantum look like? 

What happened behind the last visible curtain, the CMB-radiation; the oldest light in the universe with a glow which is very nearly uniform in all directions? Big Bang or Cool Firework? Did the physical universe start with the Total-energy-SINGULARITY or with the pre-physical energy and physical NOTHING? 

What was at the very beginning? Infinite temperature or 0K? Singularity or no space and no time? Superforce or no force? Protons, neutrons and electrons or no matter? 

According to the Cool Firework Theory, at the beginning of the physical universe there was no matter, no time, no space and the temperature was at absolute zero. With the Cool Firework Theory the time continuum, gravitation, gravity quantum, speed of light c, the homogenous CBM-radiation, superconductivity, the basic pattern of dark energy, dark matter and black holes can be defined, explained and / or understood. 

Entanglement and Double Slit Experiments are the two classic experiments in quantum physics.

 www.youtube.com/watch?v=rWTo2Gk5iU0 

However, they are not understood by classical science. Understanding quanta with their properties and capabilities in entanglement and double slit experiments enables us to better understand life, chemical and enzymatic reactions, the development of the physical universe, black holes and many not yet understood phenomena. What is the fundamental principle of these two experiments? 

Why is the speed of light the maximum speed in space and why is a much higher speed in black holes possible? 

How do enzymes work? Why do enzymes accelerate very specific reactions at highest speed into the right direction? Do Carbonic Anhydrases accelerate the chemical reactions by a factor of up to 10'000'000 or up to 1'000'000 reactions synchronously by a factor 10?

How do animals navigate, often over distances of several thousands of kilometers across the oceans? How do pigeons, cats, dogs and others find their homes leaving from unknown places? How do salmons, penguins, albatross, Monarch butterflies (each 4th generation) and many other animals find their place of birth? 

Some savants have access to an incredible amount of specific information (music, books, numbers, days connected to dates, city views and others). How does this work? What do quanta have to do with this phenomenon? 

These are the main topics and questions “The Great Mysteries of Quanta” investigates and gives answers to. 

IS "THE GREAT MYSTERIES OF QUANTA" SOMETHING FOR ME? 

During the last few weeks, while finishing my book, I had the chance to have many very interesting talks with some old friends, family members and many new people who crossed “by accident” my way: therapists, clock maker, taxi drivers, artists, butcher, biologist, fire fighter, pilot, teachers, shop owner, students, physicist, film makers, musicians, engineers, old and young people literally from all over the world with different life experience. 

It always started with the simple question: “What are you doing?”. When I said that I am writing about quanta, people were immediately divided into two groups. The “Quanta?, too complicated, I have no idea what they are!!!”-group, which was by far the smaller one and all the other people who asked questions, started to share their knowledge and experience with quanta. And just few minutes after we began to talk, it would be difficult, to find out, who belonged to which group before.

What I was lucky to perceive in these wonderful moments, was, that the interest in quanta, whichever name they have been given (spirit, “by accident”, god, universe, quanta, …), in their properties and capabilities is enormous; to know how the universe works, how does it come that our bodies, the trees, the nature develop the way they do, how do animals navigate, intuition, telepathy, synergy are just few of these topics. 

It was my intention to be as much scientific as well as open to new perceptions as most interested people, non-scientists, professional and non-professional scientists can accept and digest. I did my best to keep the chapters clear and short. The Great Mysteries of Quanta is now little bit more than one hundred pages long.

story:
Feminisme: een nieuw begin

Dit boek biedt een degelijke, hedendaagse inleiding tot feminisme en een stevige analyse van de thema's die vandaag belangrijk zijn. Het combineert inzichten uit het verleden van feminisme met de visies van vandaag. De bedoeling is zowel een inleiding te bieden voor beginners als nieuwe oplossingen aan te reiken voor de impasse van de hedendaagse beweging.

Het boek is geschreven door Evie Embrechts, met design en layout door Little Shiva. Ida Dequeecker schrijft een voorwoord en een extra hoofdstuk.

Er is enorm veel vraag naar een goede Nederlandstalige inleiding maar die ontbreekt momenteel gewoon. Wij zijn gepassioneerd om van dit project een realiteit te maken.

Wat we nodig hebben en wat jij krijgt

De minimumhoeveelheid die we willen bij elkaar krijgen is 1200 euro. Dat geld gaat volledig naar de drukkosten en de cover. Meer geld dat we bij elkaar krijgen gaat naar een betere layout, kwaliteit van drukken, een website met extra artikels, misschien zelfs een nieuw boek.

De prijs /bijdrage is al inclusief verzendingskosten. Dit crowdfunding project maakt het boek mogelijk en dient tegelijk om op voorhand te bestellen.

Impact

Er is al lang geen goed stevig feministisch boek meer verschenen in het Nederlands, en al helemaal niet in België. De schrijfster, Evie Embrechts, is een feministisch activiste met meer dan 15 jaar ervaring met actievoeren en artikels schrijven. Dit boek is eenvoudigweg het verderzetten van dat activisme om een stevig feminisme op de rails te zetten.

Andere manieren om te helpen

Deze crowdfunding staat of valt met jouw bijdrage. je kan ons enorm helpen door dit project te delen op Facebook of Twitter en je vrienden en kennissen een email te sturen.

Samen maken we van dit boek een realiteit!

story:
Story of My Book

Sincerity - The Recipe for Living Your Best Personal and Professional Life is about the intersection between the philosophies people often discuss as it relates to Networking (Paying It Forward, Being A Giver, Making Sure You Network) with the actual consistent behaviors that the most successful people do each and every day to maintain success and build additional sincere relationships.

My name is Aaron Brooks and I am the author of Sincerity - The Recipe for Living Your Best Personal and Professional Life. I wrote this book because of the impact sincere relationships have had on my entire life going back to watching the way my father built his business over the past 50 years - one relationship at a time.

As I moved through my own professional career, I realized the impact his example had on the way I have built and maintained amazing relationships over the course of my life and career. I have also personally witnessed sincerity having an amazing impact on the lives of so many people I met over the years. However, I have found it interesting that sometimes these people worked for companies where sincere relationships were not necessarily understood or encouraged. I am lucky enough to have developed many truly sincere relationships over the course of my life (many of which started through business) and I wanted to explore what was unique about these relationships and the way they developed over time. Further – I wanted to share these incredibly inspirational stories so they could be helpful to others. 

My hope for this book is that the reader steps out of their comfort zone. Readers will learn about specific steps they can deploy to begin to deepen current relationships and identify new, sincere relationships with others that can grow over time. I hope to instill the same sort of passion and excitement I have for developing and nurturing sincere, 360-degree relationships. If I am successful in helping just a few people to make their lives a bit easier and more fulfilled in this regard through great relationships – much like my own life has been – I will consider the book to be a huge success!

In this book, you'll learn about how to create sincere and authentic relationships and why they matter. You'll read incredibly inspirational stories such as:

  • My personal story of growing up going to work with my father, seeing how he developed his business literally one sincere relationship at a time. This has led into the way I have done business throughout my professional career that has spanned high level, client facing roles in large staffing and consulting firms - and now working in the marketing space. 
  • You will hear about the sincere and authentic business models of Rock and Roll bands that decided that the music belonged to the fans - specifically the story of The Grateful Dead and on a local Chicago level - a band that has developed a huge national following - Mr Blotto. Rather than selling their music the traditional way - these bands allowed their fans to record their shows. They trusted their fans to share tapes with one another (this was before the internet and digital music sharing), spread their music virally, and buy tickets to shows. 
  • You will read about the story of Mario Armstrong - who is one of the most sincere and passionate people you will experience. You’ve probably seen Mario on TV as a two-time Emmy Award–winning talk show host and Digital Lifestyle Expert® on NBC’s TODAY Show, CNN, NPR, and more. I tell the story of how Mario developed his career one relationship at a time. This is a tremendous story and a perfect example of achieving true success through building and appreciating relationships. 
You will love this book if you are looking for ideas as to how to differentiate yourself personally and professionally and if you are smart, genuine and authentic and you are looking to meet like-minded individuals. This book is for readers that feel they have great ideas – but have been unheard and need to build more sincere personal and professional relationships. It is for those that would sincerely like to build their personal and professional network with real relationships but are not sure where to start. This book will help you shorten the time establishing trusting and sincere relationships through practical steps. 

Sincerity - The Recipe For Living Your Best Personal and Professional Life is a nonfiction book that speaks to people at all points of their lives that want to more intentionally develop deeper, more sincere personal and professional relationships that can change their lives.
 

The Book

The book is written in 2 parts.

The first part of the book is written in six chapters that covers the way most people typically approach business and life, stories about some of the most successful and fulfilled people I have known throughout my career, a couple of examples of businesses and rock and roll bands that have found amazing success through a sincere and authentic business model. It will convince you of the importance of developing as many sincere relationships as you can throughout your life.

The second part of the book is written in one chapter that is split into three sections - it delves into a framework as to how you can intentionally accomplish the goal of identifying and nurturing more of these long term relationships over time. It covers specific ideas for people at the beginning of their career, at the middle of their career, and approaching the end of their career. These steps will take the reader a long way toward developing the sincere relationships that will begin to change their lives.
 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in April, 2021.
  • The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this Spring of 2021.


When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will be able to publish a paperback and ebook.

When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also be able to publish a hardcover edition.

When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will also be able to publish a hardcover edition and an audiobook.


I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.
  • You will receive early access to the Introduction and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review them and give me early feedback.

You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.

You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.

And much more!

 

About the Author

Aaron Brooks is Vice President of Strategic Accounts for Compass Marketing in Annapolis, Maryland. He lives outside of Chicago, Illinois. His role is to work with clients of all sizes to help them grow their revenue through digital as well as traditional bricks and mortar channels. In this role, Aaron spends more of his time working with C-level executives, helping them to accomplish their strategic goals.

Aaron was inspired to write this book due to the impact sincere relationships have had on his entire life which goes back to watching the way his father built his business over 50 years - one relationship at a time. 

As he moved through his professional career, Aaron realized the impact his father’s example had on the way he built and maintained relationships with the clients that he worked with. Many of these people became personal friends which made Aaron wonder what was unique about his approach to relationships. Aaron decided to write this book to provide a recipe for those that are looking to develop more of the relationships that - over time - will truly change their life.

In Aaron’s free time, he likes to spend as much time as possible with his wife, three kids and two Golden Retrievers. Aaron is also a huge music fan. He has attended dozens of Grateful Dead concerts and well over 100 live music events each year. He is also an amateur photographer and videographer. You can view his work on Instagram at @aaronbrooksphotography. 

For more information, you can connect with Aaron at aaronbrooks564@gmail.com, or on Facebook, Instagram and Twitter at @skoorb22. 
 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier. 

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.
 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #sincerityrecipe and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so that we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my pre-sale campaign via Indiegogo at the top of the page.

Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,

Aaron
