story:
THE STORY

A Little Rees Specht Cultivates Kindness follows the adventures of a young farmer named Little Rees Specht who discovers that kindness, like a seed, will only grow and spread if one takes the time to cultivate it.  Little Rees Specht is a thoughtful and generous young boy who takes the time to help out a friend in need. Unbeknownst to Little Rees Specht, his kind act plants a “seed of kindness”, that keeps growing as more and more kind acts are performed by other children. 

A Little Rees Specht Cultivates Kindness is a sweet book with an important message for young children who are learning to look beyond themselves and develop empathy for others. Join the adventure of Little Rees Specht and his friends as they discover how kindness grows in the good deeds we do for each other. In the end, we learn that all it takes to cultivate kindness is a little Rees Specht.

 

ABOUT the ReesSpecht Life Foundation:

ReesSpecht Life is a foundation dedicated to paying forward the acts of kindness received in the wake of a terrible tragedy. Our goal is to try to make the world a better place, one piece at a time. After losing their 22 month old son, Richard Edwin-Ehmer Specht (Rees), Rich and Sam Specht started printing ReesSpecht Life “Pay it Forward” cards and before they knew it over 57,500 cards were (and continue to be) distributed. ReesSpecht Life started as a small movement last spring that has since grown into a movement that has reported “Rees’ Pieces” performing acts of kindness on every continent on Earth, with the exception of Antarctica (Though they are working on it!).

The foundation currently offers scholarships rewarding students who demonstrate a commitment to community, compassion and respect,  with a goal of funding scholarships all over the US. It is our dream to self publish and release our children’s book titled, “A Little Rees Specht Cultivates Kindness” which follows the adventures of a young farmer named Little Rees Specht who discovers that kindness, like a seed, will only grow and spread if one takes the time to cultivate it in others.

 

FIVE SUPER REASONS TO SUPPORT OUR PUBLISHING DREAM AND THE REESSPECHT LIFE FOUNDATION:

♥  You will help support a cause forged in the wake of a tragedy that is looking to make this world a little kinder, one Rees' piece at a time.

♥ You will help us in our goal of reminding both parents and children of the SUPER power of kindness - and what its tangible effect on all of us.

♥  Your support will allow us to produce (including printing and distribution) every part of A Little Rees Specht Cultivates Kindness.

♥ You'll help spread the very seeds of kindness (in the form of our ReesSpecht Life Pay it Forward Cards) that Little Rees Specht is trying to spread in the book.

♥  Through your support and the successful publishing of our book, we will be able to fund our scholarship that rewards High School Seniors who have demonstrated a commitment to Community, Compassion and Respect.

 

 

HOW IT WORKS

Your support will allow us to print our initial run of books that we will sell through our foundation.  ALL proceeds from the book will go to the ReesSpecht Life Foundation, Inc.  We are currently in the approval process from the IRS for our 501(c)3 non-profit status.  The money raised from our book sales will support our High School Scholarship program as well as the funding of our Pay it Forward Card distribution and character education programs we will be offering in the 2014-2015 school year.

$ 20,000 IS A LARGE SUM, WHY SO MUCH?

Short answer: Creating a quality product with top-notch illustration, design and layout is EXPENSIVE... exceptionally so for a volunteer organization.

Long answer: Our goal since the passing of our little boy has been to try and make this world a little kinder, one Rees' piece at a time.  To date our foundation has distributed over 57,500 ReesSpecht Life "Pay it Forward" cards to help spread the kindness.  We have already awarded two scholarships to Graduating High School Seniors, but we wish to do so much more.  It is our goal to fund scholarships all over the United States to reward students for their dedication to something that we should all be doing in everyday life, but we often lose sight of.  

We realized early on that the best way to ensure the sustainability of these ideals is through education (Both my wife, Samantha and I are educators after all).  I have always been a story teller, and I believe that the loss of my little Rees was not the end of his story:  It was merely the beginning of a new chapter.  I immediately had the idea of a story we could tell that would inspire children to perform random acts of kindness.  Since Rees' favorite thing in his short, 22 month life, was Tractors, the basics of the story had already been sown and I wrote the story.  The only problem is I can't draw.

This is where I realized the cost of producing a children's book is prohibitive.  It was clear we needed to hire an illustrator, publisher etc.  All of this was very expensive and we know we just can't do it on our own.  That is where your support comes in.  

Here's the truth:  We had no idea of what we were getting into.  Hiring our illustrator, designing the layout, getting published - it was all something we tried to figure out on the fly.  We thought we had everything figured out when a small publishing company offered to print and distribute our book, but it turns out they could not print the book in the format we envisioned.  You are looking at our solution:  We are going to self publish and pay for every aspect of the design, printing, marketing and distribution of the book through this Indiegogo campaign.

At This time YOU'RE ALL WE'VE GOT to make this happen and, although we had our setbacks, I am confident this book will be a reality because of the support of people like you.

OUR TRACK RECORD

From the moment we lost our son, we decided that we were not going to let this tragedy bring us down.  Our determination to make this world a kinder place is rooted in our belief that love and kindness heal the greatest of wounds.  We set out to create a movement that would inspire people to stop for a moment and think about how even the smallest act of kindness can have a ripple effect that can touch countless others.  57,500 "Pay it Forward" cards later, we can truly say we are on our way.  We believe in our hearts in what we are doing, and that passion comes through in our book.  The book is our next step in achieving our dream.  Our foundation has never failed to achieve any of the goals we have set in our short existence, and I know we will not fail with this.  With your support, our dream will come closer to realization...  

♥PLEASE help us Plant the seeds of Kindness and help Little Rees Specht Cultivate Kindness in children everywhere ♥

♥ YOUR SUPPORT WILL HELP GERMINATE THE SEED OF KINDNESS♥


♥  Pick a perk and help plant the seed that will grow into A Little Rees Specht Cultivates Kindness ♥

story:
My Wanderlust 2014

My name is Kelly and I'm twenty-one, and totally stir-crazy in this small town I live in. I was born with gypsy blood, thirsting to get out and explore mother Earth. I plan on doing all my traveling while I'm still young and single, so I have no one depending on me besides myself. This trip is really a trip of self discovery and to find my true home. It also is to begin my writing career. I'm really into creative writing and have a lot of fiction stories started, I'm just missing the experience of new people to inspire me to continue. And along with that I also want to write about my travels. It will be a really amazing experience that a lot of people will want to read about.

There is no way to express the gratitude I will have for any amount of donation. You will literally be changing the course of my life and I thank you with all my heart.

What I Need & What You Get

Now, the funding may seem like a lot, but I plan to stretch this money over the course of eight months to a year, which is definitely less than the average cost of living. Considering I will be living in my vehicle, this money will be going strictly to gas, food, and camping sites. I don't need much, just the sights I will be seeing and a way to get to where I'm going.

Now, considering I'm asking for donations, I don't have much to offer. But what I can give it letters and email updates on where I am, how your donation is helping me live my dream, and the promise that when my work gets published, you will get signed copies for no charge.

If I do not reach my goal, the money will be used sparingly along my trip, and I will definitely be bartering for food (I have faith there are still hippies and gypsy souls out there!). But if I do, and I have money left over, which I'm sure I will, the funding will go towards my backpacking trip to Europe coming in 2016.

The Impact

I wish I had words to explain how much this trip will change my life. It will determine where I decide to live, how my writing career kicks off, and what salon I will be working in. Not to mention the fact that I will be volunteering along the way, so it will be helping others as well. I just want to find something bigger than myself and I feel this is the best way to do it.

Other Ways You Can Help

Now, I totally understand if you can't help me financially, but there are other ways to support my cause! If you know of any amazing places I need to see, let me know! I also need fun and creative people to surround myself with, so if you're interested please come find me!

And also please share this with people you feel will support my dreams and goals!

Thank you so much!
story_txt: My Wanderlust 2014My name is Kelly and I'm twenty-one, and totally stir-crazy in this small town I live in. I was born with gypsy blood, thirsting to get out and explore mother Earth. I plan on doing all my traveling while I'm still young and single, so I have no one depending on me besides myself. This trip is really a trip of self discovery and to find my true home. It also is to begin my writing career. I'm really into creative writing and have a lot of fiction stories started, I'm just missing the experience of new people to inspire me to continue. And along with that I also want to write about my travels. It will be a really amazing experience that a lot of people will want to read about.There is no way to express the gratitude I will have for any amount of donation. You will literally be changing the course of my life and I thank you with all my heart.What I Need & What You GetNow, the funding may seem like a lot, but I plan to stretch this money over the course of eight months to a year, which is definitely less than the average cost of living. Considering I will be living in my vehicle, this money will be going strictly to gas, food, and camping sites. I don't need much, just the sights I will be seeing and a way to get to where I'm going.Now, considering I'm asking for donations, I don't have much to offer. But what I can give it letters and email updates on where I am, how your donation is helping me live my dream, and the promise that when my work gets published, you will get signed copies for no charge.If I do not reach my goal, the money will be used sparingly along my trip, and I will definitely be bartering for food (I have faith there are still hippies and gypsy souls out there!). But if I do, and I have money left over, which I'm sure I will, the funding will go towards my backpacking trip to Europe coming in 2016.The ImpactI wish I had words to explain how much this trip will change my life. It will determine where I decide to live, how my writing career kicks off, and what salon I will be working in. Not to mention the fact that I will be volunteering along the way, so it will be helping others as well. I just want to find something bigger than myself and I feel this is the best way to do it.Other Ways You Can HelpNow, I totally understand if you can't help me financially, but there are other ways to support my cause! If you know of any amazing places I need to see, let me know! I also need fun and creative people to surround myself with, so if you're interested please come find me!And also please share this with people you feel will support my dreams and goals!Thank you so much!

story:
I've always been in love with the stage, but as a spectator, not a performer.  Burlesque is a love of mine, and so are pinup girls. Now I want to share that with you in a gorgeous, tantalizing burlesque book that will appeal to the food lover in you.

I've been writing the recipes and have done the first shoot, but this project is not cheap. From whipping up luscious cakes to paying for photography, I need help getting this project off the ground. Can you help?

Hi, I'm Dakota, and I'm a freelance journalist and grad student living in New York. Thanks for coming to my Indiegogo page.

I've written about arts, news and style in New York for seven years or so, and I finally decided, after being encouraged by a friend, to take the plunge into working on a book. It's really hard and a lot of work, but I'm really excited so far and still loving it.

Self-publishing is always expensive in color, and this cookbook demands it because of the gorgeous subjects, performers and food included. Venues, lights, photography, food, styling of food and makeup and fashion are also very expensive. I'm doing what I can to have friends help out with styling and venues, but I need your help!

If you can help me get my project off the ground, a beautiful new cookbook documenting some of New York's favorite burlesque gals will soon be a reality, and we'll get to see a more personal side of them than just the stage persona.
 
The perks are pretty awesome! Gorgeous photos to put in your room by your mirror, copies of the cookbook in all its food-and-femininity-obsessed glory, or a personal night of being guided to meet the best of New York's burlesque shows by yours truly!
 
If you can't contribute but you can help me spread the word by emailing or sharing this Indiegogo page on Twitter or Facebook, snapping a shot for Instagram, posting it anywhere, I'll be eternally grateful!
 
And PS, Indiegogo lets me keep most of what I raise here -- instead of returning contributions if I don't meet my goal -- just another reason I love this site!
 
Thanks!
Dakota

story:
WOLVES: Short Summary

by Martin De Biasi

Needle in the Hay was founded in 2012 with the aim of providing access to regular short story prizes and feedback for the broader grassroots writing community. Over the past few years we've broadened our scope to publishing, with a focus on collaborative publications. 

Wolves is our second fully published collaboration. It brings together some of our best and brightest authors under a decidely wolfish banner, with stories that span the gamut of human experience and emotion.

When individuals commit to a common goal, we form a pack. The WOLVES pack has worked hard on this collection, and that's why it's essential we get behind them and support this project.

As a contributor, you're showing writers around the world that authors (and artists) can come together and produce great work, and be supported by their community. 

What We Need & What You Get

What we need is to make as big a splash as possible. The more backers we get for this campaign, the more encouraged our authors will be to publish even better works, and the more we're able to build the profile of all the writers involved in Needle In The Hay. 

Our funding model is simple:

  • This campaign gives you the opportunity to get a physical copy of the book at cost price
  • We'll mail the book to you.
  • You can also buy multiple copies :)

The Impact

Your contribution makes a big difference. Even if you don't want a book, a few dollars will get you a digital copy and still demonstrate to our authors and other up and coming writers that there is an interest in grassroots publications and a demand for a more intimate relationship between authors and readers. 

Every author on Wolves is in the early stages of their career. Some have been toiling away for a few years, others are a bit newer to the game. Either way, your support helps build their profiles and confidence for bigger challenges ahead. 

Risks & Challenges

There's really nothing to lose here. Even if we don't make our goal we can still send you the book. This campaign is about awareness and support. The more, the better!

Other Ways You Can Help

We get it, sometimes you're just not in the position right now to support us. Never fear, if you can't back Wolves right now, there are other ways you can help:

  • Repost, reblog and share this page with as many people as you can. That helps build awareness. Indiegogo provides sharing tools right here on the campaign page, so use em!
  • Go check out Needle In The Hay, follow us on Facebook, and try your hand at a story comp.
  • Volunteer at Needle: We're always looking for volunteers to help judge one awards, create new awards and give feedback. 
  • Read our shortlists! 

And that's all there is to it. WOLVES is an awesome collaboration, I hope you love it.

story:
About Heritage Salon Magazine

Heritage Salon Magazine is a new and innovative way to expose African-American Museums, Cultural Institutions & Historic Homes & Sites. This all began from a vision from me, Jada Wright-Greene. I have a strong passion for the African-American Museum Culture and believe it is my duty to expose these institutions.  I began this journey with a blog in 2009 after I discovered I was the first African-American to graduate from the Museum Studies Program at Michigan State University.  I have worked in several museums, historic homes and earned a Master’s Degree in Urban & Regional Planning/Museum Studies. Since my discovery of the museum studies field, I have not stopped emailing, calling and reaching out to museums in order to make a change. I have the passion, persistence and determination to make the change in this field. I consider myself to be an activist for the change in museums.  

There is a need to have more audience participation at African-American focused institutions in order to gain more attention and possible funding to these entities. Another need is for more African-Americans to be enrolled and completing Museum Studies programs in order to gain the proper knowledge to operate and sustain these institutions. 

At this juncture Heritage Salon Magazine is in the beginning stages of acquiring 501 (c) (3) status.   Once this status is acquired, funds will be solicted with the (assistance of the production of a preview issue) from foundations, corporations and donors.  Heritage Salon Magazine will be FREE of cost to everyone once full issues are published in 2013! 

At this time, there are no other publications dedicated to the African-American Museum Culture. It is imperative that this one of a kind magazine is published in order to change the face of the Museum Field. 

What Heritage Salon Magazine Needs

Heritage Salon Magazine needs $1,800 to publish, print and mail out over 350 preview issues throughout the United States to African-American focused institutions, schools, universities and individuals that can assist in the efforts of the full publication of 4 issues a year.  The funds will go to publishing, printing, production of mailing materials and postage for over 350 copies of the preview issue as well as Indiegogo fees.  

If you contribute to the preview issue you will be contributing to the impact of changing the way people view African-American museums and cultural institutions.  If I am not able to raise all of the funds, I will still produce some issues to go to a pivotal list of institutions and individuals.  Heritage Salon Magazine is offering the following incentives for your assistance in our efforts

  • A copy of the preview issue 
  • A copy of the first full issue
  • Handwritten note from the Editor
  • Acknowledgement in the preview issue of the magazine
  • Advertisement space in the first full issue of the magazine
  • Ticket to the launch party of Heritage Salon Magazine

Disclaimer: Heritage Salon Magazine reserves the right to not print vulgar or offensive advertisement in the issue. 

 

Heritage Salon Needs You!

Your contribution to the preview issue will impact not only the African-American Museum Culture, but the museum field as a whole. This preview issue that you donate to will help began the transformation of change that is urgently needed for exposing and saving these institutions.  I currently operate a blog (since 2009) and have began exposing these institutions and your support of the beginnings of the magazine will bring even more exposure and assistance in sustaining these fascinating institutions.

 How else can you help Heritage Salon Magazine?

If you cannot contribute to the preview issue please do consider doing one or more of the following ways:

  • Tell your family, friends, co-workers and anyone you believe can assist in our efforts
  • Donate your time and writing skills to future issues
  • Share our campaign on your social media sites and with everyone you know!
  • Follow us on Twitter @HeritageSalon

Your support will be much appreciated and will encourage my efforts in the support of African-American Museums, Cultural Institutions and Historic Sites & Homes.

story:
Equality Wins!

From August 15 to September 8, you can head to our campaign site EqualityFTW.org to donate and receive some delightfully nerdy and awesome perks for supporting Equality FTW. During these three weeks, be on the lookout for videos from favorite vloggers and wizards alike. We’re going to be teaming up with some awesome people to help us reach our $50,000 goal and we’re counting on you to be one of them!  

Just like Harry and Dumbledore fought for equality amongst magic users and muggles, we  too are fighting for immigration reform, LGBTQ rights and equal access to education.  Our Equality for the Win fundraiser is a drive to raise $50,000 so that we can strengthen our fight to equal the playing field. With your donation and your help we can launch a year of equality based campaigns to fight the dark arts of inequality.

We are Wizards. We are the Equality Generation.

So what is the Harry Potter Alliance anyway?


The Harry Potter Alliance or HPA is a non-profit organization that uses parallels from the Harry Potter novels to inspire fans to act as heroes in our world. The HPA is run almost entirely by more than 60 volunteer staff and 85 worldwide community and school chapters. Using social media and our partner networks, we have a reach of more than one million people. These vast connections allow us to act as a Dumbledore’s Army for the real world, reaching to fans across the globe to enact real change in our communities and our world.
For more information on our previous work, check out these success stories: http://thehpalliance.org/action/campaigns/

Where will my money go?

We hold these truths to be self evident that all men (and women, and undocumented Americans, and children, and...) are created equal. Regardless of where you’re from, who you love, or how much money you have, we believe that we all deserve the same rights and opportunities. Over the past 7 years we have rallied for equality, donating over 90,000 books to communities across the world, breaking phone banking records with Massachusetts equality and took the world by storm with Julian’s Muggleborn American video, getting over 10,000 views in one day.

But we’re not done yet, witches! What if we could:

  • Build a network of Imagine Better Libraries connecting students across the world with the magic of books and launch a new curriculum of myth-based education.
  • Educate members and the public about immigration reform, standing with undocumented Americans around the country.
  • Expand the fight for Marriage equality into three new states - Maine, Maryland and Minnesota.
  • Help our chapters bring the fight for equality into their hometowns and states by building our chapters network and providing the resources they need to bring the fight home

We can do it, but we need your help! With $50,000 we can change the face of equality across the world. Join us by making a donation today!

 

 

Anything else I should know?

Please stay tuned for more exciting announcements! We are really honored to work with the many leaders of our community who have stepped up to partner with us in this most important effort, amongst them, John Green. Here is a full description of the perk which he has generously donated, available above.

The first section of John Green's unfinished, abandoned novel THE SEQUEL, which is a sequel to a novel that doesn't exist called THE ODD AT SEA. About the story, John says "THE SEQUEL contains a lot of the ideas that ended up in THE FAULT IN OUR STARS, although it's a very different kind of story. I worked on THE SEQUEL between 2008 and 2010 before finally putting it aside. There is of course a REASON why I abandoned it: It isn't very good. But it has some moments I still like, and I'm hoping seeing a draft like this will provide a window into one writer's process. And of course I want to raise some money for the HPA!"

THE SEQUEL is the story of a young woman named Hannah al-Hajji who finds herself alone in the world after the novel in which she is a character ends. Everyone else in the novel disappears, but she for some reason is left with us. The story costars a young student chaplain, recently graduated from college, who happens to have read the novel that Hannah was a minor character in. The selection is 6,437 words long.

 

Another partner who has been overwhelmingly generous is Evanna Lynch. Below, we are excited to bring you a preview of the Phoenix handcrafted by Evanna herself!

story:
Short Summary

My name is Anthony Wong and I am the author of A Shape and a Run!

A Shape and a Run is a collection of short stories centered around the concept of isolation: its origins, manifestations and effects on people. Through the lens of the surreal and the mundane, this book explores what it means to be alone — and in the process, what it means to change.

I wrote this book in an attempt to explore the demoralizing feelings that I think a lot of people are having or have had at some point throughout the COVID-19 pandemic — these feelings of apathy and grief and aimlessness that have gained a hold on the public consciousness. Many people are forced to be apart right now, and that shared state of loneliness is something that taps into an entire fountainhead of emotions sprung from different circumstances and life experiences.

I hope people will find something in this collection that resonates with them. The stories span a range of genres and tend to blend varying levels of light and dark elements within each of them.  As you read these stories, you might find some of them have a few twists you weren’t expecting, with a level of unpredictability that will keep you, the reader, entertained and on your toes.

In this book, you'll encounter a host of characters that inhabit a variety of settings. The theme of isolation runs through narratives like:

  • Two men stuck in a dystopian, abandoned coastal town of Maine, with one’s murderous goals restrained only by the fear of being the last remaining survivor.
  • A hermetic music composer who struggles to reconcile his work with the pain of being newly alone.


Most importantly though, especially in this turbulent world that we’re in, this book strives to reaffirm a sense of agency that the current times seem to have taken away. Even if you are alone, or feeling alone, you can find solace in the things in your life that still make it worth living. I hope my stories communicate the idea that despite the pain and adversity one might face, life isn’t over until it actually is, and the world doesn’t end until it actually does.

I look forward to exploring the themes of isolation, hope, and change in these stories and with readers.

 

What I Need & What You Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in April 2021.
  • The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!).
  • The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this April.


When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook.


I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish plus an Instagram shoutout!
  • You will receive original art stickers made for my book!
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.
  • You will receive early access to the Author’s Note and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.

And much more!

 

About the Author

Anthony Wong is a fourth-year undergraduate at UCLA, studying Biology and Cognitive Science.  He wrote this book for fun and hopes to use it as an opportunity for reflection on the feelings of isolation, discontentment, and uncertainty that have been worsened by the coronavirus pandemic.  In his free time, Anthony enjoys reading, hiking, and binging Netflix.

For more information, you can connect with Anthony through email (anthwong@g.ucla.edu) and by Instagram (@a_shape_and_a_run).
 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #shapeandarun and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page.

Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Anthony Wong
story_txt:
Short Summary
My name is Anthony Wong and I am the author of A Shape and a Run!A Shape and a Run is a collection of short stories centered around the concept of isolation: its origins, manifestations and effects on people. Through the lens of the surreal and the mundane, this book explores what it means to be alone — and in the process, what it means to change.I wrote this book in an attempt to explore the demoralizing feelings that I think a lot of people are having or have had at some point throughout the COVID-19 pandemic — these feelings of apathy and grief and aimlessness that have gained a hold on the public consciousness. Many people are forced to be apart right now, and that shared state of loneliness is something that taps into an entire fountainhead of emotions sprung from different circumstances and life experiences.I hope people will find something in this collection that resonates with them. The stories span a range of genres and tend to blend varying levels of light and dark elements within each of them.  As you read these stories, you might find some of them have a few twists you weren’t expecting, with a level of unpredictability that will keep you, the reader, entertained and on your toes.In this book, you'll encounter a host of characters that inhabit a variety of settings. The theme of isolation runs through narratives like:

Two men stuck in a dystopian, abandoned coastal town of Maine, with one’s murderous goals restrained only by the fear of being the last remaining survivor.
A hermetic music composer who struggles to reconcile his work with the pain of being newly alone.

Most importantly though, especially in this turbulent world that we’re in, this book strives to reaffirm a sense of agency that the current times seem to have taken away. Even if you are alone, or feeling alone, you can find solace in the things in your life that still make it worth living. I hope my stories communicate the idea that despite the pain and adversity one might face, life isn’t over until it actually is, and the world doesn’t end until it actually does.I look forward to exploring the themes of isolation, hope, and change in these stories and with readers.
 

What I Need & What You Get
This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in April 2021.
The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!).
The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this April.

When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook.I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish plus an Instagram shoutout!
You will receive original art stickers made for my book!
Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.
You will receive early access to the Author’s Note and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.
You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.

And much more!
 
About the Author
Anthony Wong is a fourth-year undergraduate at UCLA, studying Biology and Cognitive Science.  He wrote this book for fun and hopes to use it as an opportunity for reflection on the feelings of isolation, discontentment, and uncertainty that have been worsened by the coronavirus pandemic.  In his free time, Anthony enjoys reading, hiking, and binging Netflix.For more information, you can connect with Anthony through email (anthwong@g.ucla.edu) and by Instagram (@a_shape_and_a_run). 

Risks & Challenges
The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier.The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

story:
Support the Voices of Writers of Color by Supporting VONA/Voices

For fourteen years, we have provided workshops for writers of color and have helped to change the literary landscape. When writers-of-color come fo the VONA/Voices Workshop they find community, support and a place where their writing can evolve.

Allow us to continue our work with a contribution that will

  • Provide more scholarship opportunities, giving access to writers who would never get to attend a writing workshop
  • Support us in our important mission by grounding VONA's adminsitrative team
  • Allow us to continue to establish regional VONA/Voices workshops similar to  our workshop at the University of Miami-giving access to more writers of color
  • Help us complete our journey to becoming an independent 501 C 3

We need your support to keep this important workshop alive and provide more opportunties that will turn our writers whose voices may not ever be heard.

Please contribute


Any amount will do:

You can give the price of a book ($25)

or tuition for a participant ($800 or more)

or cover faculty travel and expenses

or assist in our operating costs

No amount is too small and no amount is too large

While supplies last contributors receive a book bonus from VONA Faculty, Staff and Alum Writers:

Works by Junot Diaz, Chitra Divakaruni, Mat Johnson, Andrew X Pham, Minal Hagratwala, Tananarive Due, Maaza Mengiste, Marita Golden, Tayari Jones, Elmaz Abinader, Diem Jones

 

Be a patron-of-the arts and a literary change agent: Be VONA

story:
NOTE:
If you don't CLICK a perk from the RIGHT SIDE BAR before clicking "Contribute now" it won't let me send you the perk. So please be sure to do this to ensure you get your item! 


     "My name’s Alice Green. It’s not my real name, but if you knew what was going on,
you’d understand why I need to be careful. Adults warn you your body will start going through “changes” when you get older.
     Yeah. That happened—a while ago.
     This is different.
     I’ve been infected with something I can’t fully explain—bio-luminescence—
fluorescent energy. I can’t control when it appears. It’s volatile, and that’s what scares me the most.
     I hope, for your sake, this never happens to you or to anyone you care about.
     I hope you will never wake to discover this fire burning beneath your skin—this spark of living, breathing color crackling through your veins."


Fluorescence is an upcoming 4-part YA book series about a group of teenagers who are Implanted with glowing alien DNA which grants each of them unique and powerful abilities, but may also jeopardize the future of the human race. 





For art to thrive, it needs to be seen. Read. Touched. It’s about getting it into people’s hands.



But without a massive publishing house and a limitless budget, that's tough!

YOU can change that!




This series is UNIQUE and offers growth potential in a stagnant marketplace.


With a plot stemming from a unique and original sci-fi core, there's nothing quite like it on the YA market today. It fills a niche that hasn't yet been conquered in YA - sci-fi.

Each volume in the series is narrated by a different character, driving the story forward in a new and exciting way for readers. 

Fluorescence evolves from a quiet beginning into a gritty and unabashed look at real-life limitations and struggles these teenagers face while coping with a life-changing secret.


Q.  So if Fluorescence is so groundbreaking, why does it need funding?


A.   Good question! The answer to that is simple - funding = marketing. Marketing = the ability to build a fan-base and gain an audience, which in turn, can = success. Think about it: how many books/movies/TV Shows, etc. would you have found out about or purchased if you'd never seen a commercial/flyer/or other promotional blurb about it? Probably few to none.

No matter how good something is, if no one knows it exists, it can't make an impact. This doesn't mean it's not a good product, it often only means the marketing failed.


The success of this book, upcoming installments and myself as an author, relies solely on getting

Fluorescence in front of people!




NOTE:  $25/$35 gets a signed book!
BUT If you don't actually SELECT/CHOOSE a perk from the RIGHT SIDE BAR before clicking "Contribute now" it won't let me send you the perk/book/etc.


  • Perks are guaranteed! You can get great things like eBooks, gorgeous high-gloss 11"x17" Posters, signed books, and LTD art prints, to YOUR NAME in the actual book! Every $ COUNTS!

  • The cover art illustrations were created by world-renown artist Fernanda Suarez! Her art has been featured in magazines, boardgames, books and websites all over the world! Some of her past work has been with Paizo Publishing and Plaid Hat Games!
 



I'm P. Anastasia. I’ve been a writer for as long as I’ve been able to write. Most of all, I’ve been a storyteller. After a long mid-life struggle with debilitating, art-killing, writer's block inducing depression, I decided to turn my life around.

Last year, I made the decision to move away from the tedious, unsatisfying and under-appreciated work I was doing for a living and finally take the plunge into what I’m here to do – tell stories that have never been told before. Stories that excite and inspire others.

The very basics required to produce a quality, polished novel are expensive.  Editors. Illustrators. ISBNs. Proof copies. Web hosting. Social networking. Promo materials... not to mention countless hours writing, re-writing, editing, researching, advertising, web design work, and hiring and interviewing editors and artists. I've had to invest nearly $5,000.00 of my own hard-earned savings just to get this project off it's feet.


With so much media bombarding us every day, getting books into people's hands is tough and yet CRITICAL for success! This is ESPECIALLY true for newly published authors. I need to be able to show people what a great idea I have. I want you to be able to pick up a copy of my book, say HI to me, and get a first hand look at how much work really went into this awesome story. This isn't something I can accomplish by sitting at home!

The following are a list of a few of the conventions I will attend if I meet my goal (So people will actually SEE my books!):

This is ONLY table/booth rate + hotel accommodations.

  • Lexington ComicCon 2015 ($150)
  • FandomFest 2015  ($150 + hotel = $400)
  • WizardWorld ComicCon 2015 ($325 + hotel = $575)
  • DragonCon 2015 (THE BIG ONE!) (Booth $550 + Hotel ($600) = $1,150)

    Extra costs:

Convention preparation and necessities:

  • Booth/table banner and signage ($150),
  • Shelving ($125)
  • Tablecloth ($50)
  • Gas ($30+per con)
  • Food
  • Paperback stock for conventions ($550)
  • Promotional items ($300+) to give away! (Bookmarks, postcards, biz cards)

Additional MARKETING (If funds allow):

  • Newspaper and magazine ads. ($35-$400 - depending upon distribution/market)
  • Convention programs ads. ($30-$250)
  • Facebook marketing and social media advertisements to promote the series. ($100/Month+ Targeted Ads)

The Impact

I'm taking a plunge. Following my dreams. As an entrepreneur with over 14 years of experience in freelancing, sales, and writing, I've stepped up to challenges and been successful in the past. I'm not one to back down simply because things get tough. I'll see this through as I've seen through all the previous challenges I've met!

 



Yes. There are risks. The main one being: If I am unable to get my book out there, it likely won't be successful. That's the bottom line. One of the biggest mistakes (besides not hiring the professional help of artists and editors) many authors make, is they fail to market their books effectively!

  • I'm going to attempt to sign up for a vendor table at DragonCon, but if for some reason, I don't get one (they sell out) , all related expenses will be put toward marketing and promotional materials, as well as additional stock to be submitted to various review websites and possibly an ad in the DragonCon program. This will STILL get these books noticed and into people's hands. FB ads, Google ad words, buttons, promotional flyers and other items. The possibilities are endless.

  • If I don't reach my goal, I may have to forfeit two smaller conventions or forgo DragonCon (it will depend upon scheduling), but hopefully, that won't be the case. It's one of the largest conventions on this side of the country!

  • If I can afford to attend these conventions without having to move into a cardboard box, I'll not only get noticed, I'll be able to get a better feel for my market. What people want to see more of in the FUTURE. I'll be able to produce better merchandise, posters, and other items YOU want to buy! Things that will allow you to stay immersed in the universe I've created in this series.



If you can't donate MONEY, donate just a little bit of your time.
I'd be SO thankful!

VISIT THE OFFICIAL SITE! Sign up for the newsletter!

Read and share the teaser chapter!

  • LIKE and FOLLOW Fluorescence on Facebook at: http://www.Facebook.com/FluorescenceBooks
  • Use the IndieGoGo SHARE tools to share the campaign with friends and family!
  • Tell anyone you know who might be interested in science fiction or YA Sci-Fi!

story:
The Last Hour

From the bestselling author of Just Remember to Breathe 

Twenty-seven year old Carrie Thompson-Sherman has the life she always wanted: her PhD, a prestigious fellowship, and an amazing husband.

Her charmed life begins to unravel as a jealous colleague puts her fellowship in jeopardy and a hideous secret Ray carried home from Afghanistan comes to light. Hanging on by a single thread, a disastrous accident puts both her husband and her sister's lives at risk. Heartbroken, Carrie will be faced with the most devastating choice of her life.

A choice that will change everything. 

I recently released my third Thompson Sisters novel, The Last Hour, which has been receiving rave reviews and reasonably decent sales. I’m now hard at work on a new project, and more importantly, for the first time, writing full time! It’s exciting, but a little bit scary, because living off primarily ebook sales can be a real challenge.

Why am I asking for money for this project?
The Thompson Sisters is now a well established series of novels. But the cost of narrating, editing and producing an audiobook is a lot of money. Thousands of dollars.  As a brand new full time writer with bills to pay and kids to feed, it’s a lot of money to risk on a venture which may or may not earn back those thousands of dollars.  That’s where you come in. By running this campaign, the risk is spread, the book can be produced, and readers will get their copies. Your money will go into the production of the audiobook.

What Will This Project Produce?

The project will produce an unabridged audiobook version of The Last Hour.  This is a long book, and I anticipate the final version will be close to fifteen hours.

Who Will Be Narrating the Audiobook?

The audiobook will be professionally narrated by two outstanding voice actors: Jack Wallen and Alana Rader.  Jack and Alana also narrated A Song for Julia, which was just released on Audible.com this week.

Rewards

The rewards for participating in this campaign start with a digital copy of the audiobook and ebook.  Note that some of the rewards (for the ebook) will ship immediately; others (the completed audiobook) won’t go out until the recording is complete.

Stretch Goals:

The goal for this campaign is $4,000. However, I’m putting in some stretch goals for specific amounts, they are:

  • First, if the campaign makes $6,000, I’ll publish an exclusive Julia and Crank novella this fall, and everyone who participated in the campaign will a free e-copy of the book.
  • If the campaign makes more than $6,000 I’ll come up with some other awesome stretch goals.

FAQ

Will rewards ship outside the USA or Canada?

Yes! For rewards that require physical shipping, I’ll send them anywhere. Assuming you have postal services.

What format will the audiobooks be released in?

The audiobook will be released on Audible, iTunes and Amazon in Audible.com’s format. However, for those of you who pledge at the $25 or higher level, you’ll get a digital download of the completed audiobook in MP3 format with no DRM.

What format will ebooks be in?

Ebooks will be included in mobi or epub format (your preference) with no DRM, or via Amazon or Nook gift.

My prize level includes an ebook. Can I request any title I want?

You can pick any of my ebook titles with the exception of the boxed set.  I’ll send those via Amazon or Nook, or if you prefer in non-DRM epub or mobi.

When will I get my rewards?

I’ll send out rewards on a weekly basis for those which are available now (ebook and print books).  The audiobook will be made available as soon as production is complete (scheduled for the end of august)

I want to help, but can’t contribute:

If you can’t contribute financially, there are other things you can do to help! Consider these:

  • Tell your friends or family
  • Share this campaign on Facebook, Twitter, Google+ or on your blog\
  • If you are a regular on Goodreads, let readers know about it!
  • Share it in any book related groups on Facebook or other social networking sites.

Thanks so much!

story:
Introduction

I am beginning a whole new franchise that is both the start of something new and also founded on a century old character from the public domain. The central character of this franchise of movies, books, audio-programs and other products to come is the character of Mr. H.M. Wogglebug T.E.. Mr. Wogglebug started out as a tiny ordinary bug and after spending years in a one-room schoolhouse, secretly learning from the wise professor and the students, he was found and projected onto a magnifying screen to the size of an adult human. The moment he had the chance, he escaped from the magnifying screen and left the schoolhouse to venture out into the world and see it from the perspective humans see it but insects cannot, and also to interact with the human world on a level no insect of any normal standards ever could. He believed himself to be worthy of admiration and capable of being a strong role model for young children. A steadfast hero for the importance of education, knowledge, and learning. As well as a staunch hero for the world of the fantasy genre at large. Which people of all ages in this day and age delight in with all forms of entertainment and art.  

Mr. Wogglebug is to be the center of influence of, as well as to help children view the great picture of the journey called life. He is a positive hero toward the benefiting of the education, entertainment, and overall fulfilling enjoyment of the children of new generations. My movies and picture books portray him from beginning to end as always courteous, optimistic, and skillfully intelligent in the face of any and all situations.

My movies involve the Wogglebug having the same origins he had in Oz but except they take place in a Land called Genoma. There he befriends a six-year-old girl from our world and from there on he starts on a journey that intertwines with hers. They have an adventure rescuing the Enchanted Forest from being overruled by darkness as the Wogglebug with a bit of help from Sylvie passes the tests of demonstrating the Seven Living Values of Intelligence (Honesty, Courage, Perseverance, Courtesy, Kindness, Loyalty, and Humility) while he succeeds at teaching her to believe in herself. This movie also contains messages about how nature grows and flourishes and how we can help it to survive as a whole environment.
Next the Wogglebug retraces his origins and rescues his old schoolteacher, Professor Nowitall from imprisonment by a demented magician, and with the aid of a couple of gentle troll wizards he also finds the Four Keys of All Wisdom. The four keys to wisdom are: intelligence through honesty and good intentions, deep unconditional love, optimism in the joy of living, and all-natural growth. These he uses to succeed at every obstacle in his journeys to come when he and Sylvie next go on a quest to find magical artifacts through the skies via airship, on the ocean via a sailing ship, and on land in various ways, and encounter many places and creatures in many twists and turns of their own journeys.

The next movie starring the Wogglebug is a "stranger in a strange land" type of film in which he is transported into New York, and in the spirit of all the best Family Films, he changes the reality of a group of humans for the better before he leaves their dimension for his own again. He himself discovers along the way the very meaning of what true love always is no matter what kind it is, or how it is given or received. 
He grows in his perspective and his status in Genoma at the same rate as Sylvie grows up in her world and gains deeper education through the wisdom he teaches her which enables her to ease through her personal problems that arise over the years. In the end of the film series he makes a triumphant return to the real world when Sylvie, Tasha, and Eleanor are young adults and he helps a gentle space creature to get his message to the people of Earth, restore the galaxy's colors, and thus prevent any war among the cosmos from ever starting.

What We Need & What You Get

The target goal I've set is $500 with flexible funding.

The perks I have come up with, along with the aid of Richard Poshard  as the voice of the Wogglebug, are to give all contributors a general idea of what the overall franchise of WogglebugLove Productions is about at this point.

Donators of $1.00 receive my gratitude in that they support this franchise. The higher donations receive this and  more. As listed:

Donators of $10 receive the DVD of the first movie "The Wogglebug's First Adventure with Sylvie: Rescue of the Enchanted Forest." In which the Wogglebug and Sylvie have their first adventure discovering things about each other while going on a quest to save the environment of the land of Genoma from destruction by connecting the elements of the greater picture in the forest.


Donators of $25.00 receive the above and also the picture book version of the movie as illustrated by Richard Walsh.

Donators of $35.00 receive all the above and a DVD of the second movie "The Wogglebug's Adventure in New York" in which he is transported to the real world via a science experiment linked in two dimensions and when he enters the lives of the family of the scientist who brought him in he brightens and renews their happiness in being together.


Donators of $50 receive the above and also can choose one of these 7 images from either the picture books designed by Richard Walsh or from the actual movies filmed by me.

          





Donators of $75 receive a specialized custom-made calendar with pages above the monthly charts that are from either Richard Walsh's pictures, or stills from short films done by me.


Donators of $100 receive  a "12 inch tall Wogglebug plushie that is in the design of Richard Walsh's illustrations and also from how he looks in my movies. He is custom made by a renowned toy maker and very cuddly and highly prized.


Donators of $150 receive  paperback copies of 7 picture books about the Wogglebug's new  life in Genoma, as illustrated by Richard Walsh. 

1. The Wogglebug and Sylvie's Rescue of the Enchanted Forest
2. The Wogglebug and the Four Keys of Wisdom
3. How the Wogglebug met the Frogman
4. How the Wogglebug Saved the Tailor
5. The Wogglebug's  Book of Manners 
6. The Wogglebug's Fun With Seasons and Holidays
7. The Wogglebug's Methods to Finding Lost Things


Just as these books are excellent for beginning readers, Walsh's illustrations of the Wogglebug have the authentic look and feel of a cuddly creature any child or adult could feel the urge to hug.

Donators of $175 receive the above and also another picture book that contains the first of the "What did the Wogglebug Say?"  endings. This is something children will be invited to figure out for a secret prize before it is revealed in the short film based off of it at the Wogglebug  Productions Website.  The Secret Prize will be told of during an episode of the Wogglebug's Visual  Podcast.  

Donators of $200 receive  audiobook downloads  of the aforementioned picture books via Audible.com. As narrated by Richard Poshard, the audio versions of these books bring the Wogglebug's image and  personality within the book amazingly to life.

Donators of $250 receive  paperback copies of the novelizations of  the movies listed. These novelizations help enable readers of all ages to have the insights that I put into these films and the ones to come.

Donators of $275  receive  an exclusive "Choose Your Own Adventure" storybook by Cynthia Hanson. The Wogglebug's First  Interactive Adventure which features adventures in many various ways, places, and with many outcomes.
Donators of $300 receive a customized picture book and mini-movie of 10 - 15 minutes to be dedicated to a specific child you either have or know of to give them a happy birthday gift. The maximum available for these is limited to five individuals. Only up to 5 individual donators are eligible for this per year.


After the campaign closes they must email me this basic information: The child's name, birth date, gender, geographical location, pet, favorite activity, favorite color. How they would like to meet with Mr. Wogglebug, the first place in the video they would like to visit, their dream for their future; and any special important message you want to give them. All these are what will make the individual films unique to the individually unique children receiving them. They will be digitally delivered at around the due date of the child's birthday. They also will be shown exclusively on the WogglebugLove Productions website's video page.

 The funds are needed by me for the following purposes in order of importance:

1. For the label and trademark name and branding to become official and under the legal copyright ownership of me and my custom publishing brand. A deposit must be made up front to the trademark lawyers she has consulted with. This is to be the most expensive task for her. Also the most important as it will protect and secure the overall trademark and copyright she wishes for.


2. My payments to Richard Poshard, who voices the Wogglebug as a professional voice actor. He requires payments for any work he lends his talents to that involves profits. Which is involved in self-publishing books and DVDs and audio-books.


3. My payments to the picture book artist Richard Walsh for illustrations of her Wogglebug based picture books. These will present the Wogglebug teaching subjects in simple and specific ways which often prove to be very good for early education. 


4. Last but not least, any remaining funds can go to have the 3D animation starter movies I make starring the Wogglebug entered into film festivals around the country. Either before or after they are released to DVD, depending on the requirements of the film festivals. 

The Impact:

All of this is to be the start of a small franchise for the Wogglebug's rise to fame which will lead into a much larger franchise in the next ten to twenty years from now which I wish to do my best to work towards with the aid of supporters. 

I'm one who supports The Richard Dawkins Foundation for Reason and Science. I fully intend to have the Wogglebug rise to fame in being a positive role model for children in learning how to develop the value of learning to use logic and reasoning skills to find out the right answers, and to think for themselves in the face of adversary. It is my belief his franchise can help progress the new secular humanist movement in America. Since it had been the belief in, and holding to false concepts held by the majority that had been stalling the Wogglebug from being favored for so long. My wish is to use him as an iconic hero for finding out the truth through critical thinking and thus being ridden of the enemies of reason. 

The Wogglebug is even more than this. He is an ideal role model for today's children to be able to gain the ability to believe in themselves when they seem or feel different from all others around them. Such as children on the autism spectrum which I myself had been at least during my childhood, and thus I really believe a character just like Mr. Wogglebug would have made a world of a positive difference for me then. And so I now wish to express these deep feelings to the children of new generations so we can help to make the future brighter for them and the rest of the world, as the children of this generation are the citizens of the next one.

In conclusion, making a donation of any amount to my campaign is to help bring rise to the start of the Wogglebug's franchise and fame. Thus to also support every cause he is involved with. All meant to help make a brighter future for our next generation.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you believe in giving second chances and in making a difference for the children of today and the future by all means be a supporter of the Wogglebug's franchise. In the event you want to help the campaign but are just not able to donate anything, all I ask is you do all you can to legitimately spread the word of this campaign. Share the link to it at any appropriate place. Use the Indiegogo sharing tools to post about this on your Facebook, Twitter, Spread the word.

story:
Short Summary

I am currently a full-time student, who uses reading to reach out to the community around me. I read anywhere between three and ten chapters of any given book a day. I am currently reading the "A Song of Ice and Fire" series and have about 15 books out on lone. As I lone out books frequently, I have found that hardcover or library bound books are best. Soft cover books do not hold up the same way. Because of this, books are slightly more expensive. I want to grow my collection of books so that I can share them with those around me easily. I am constantly having individuals ask me what book I am currently reading and when I will be done so that they can pick up another. I need to help bring back reading! My eventual goal is to have a library with thousands (or better, millions!) of books to share, loan, and take care of. All books need love, and love to a book is reading! 

What We Need & What You Get

Here are the things that I would need:

  • I need to buy more books. I currently have about 50 cycling in and out and would like to build toward a library. I am hoping that $6,500 is enough money to get this started. 
  • I have t-shirts that show two different images of reading and the possibilities through reading. With donations of 100 dollars you will receive one of these t-shirts. Donations 175 dollars will receive both t-shirts. 
  • All funds will go towards the purchasing of more books regardless of if the goal is reached or not. 

The Impact

Your contribution will help open the minds of many:

  • It is said that the act of reading helps with grammar, spelling, and overall analytical abilities. 
  • I want to help open the minds of others and inspire them to share a book. 
  • Reading has gone down because of the influx of video games, the invention of the tablet, and the influx of more and more technology. Reading is an age old art that I want to help save. 

Risks & Challenges

Obstacles that I face and risks that I run into are:

  • Sharing reading will help to not only educate but also encourage creativity and inspire the minds of all who pick up a book.
  • Running out of books to share is always something that I struggle with. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot contribute I completely understand:

  • If you cannot contribute but would like to help, share this project!
  • As always you can pick up a new book and read!
  • And share! Share! Share! 

Thank You! You truly will help bring my library to life!

story:
What's happening?

Hi, I’m Lisa Tallin. I gave up a good social work job in Boston to follow my dream of becoming a writer. I began by moving to Alabama to study creative writing. During my studies, I finished a novel and poetry manuscript. I graduated with an MFA in May 2013 and during this last year I’ve worked on smaller pieces of prose and poetry as well as the first draft of my second novel. In June, my chapbook (small poetry book) was a winner in Furniture Press’ 4x4 Chapbook Awards!

I was very honored to be offered a residency this fall at Vermont Studio Center (http://www.vermontstudiocenter.org/) where thousands of artists apply every year. I applied for a full fellowship and was given a partial grant. I decided to take the offer because I didn't want to pass up this prestigious opportunity and because I desperately need this time to write. While at the center, I’ll benefit from the time, space, and solitude needed to complete the editing of my young adult novel, Year of the Buried Elephant (pictured above). Here is an excerpt from the draft of the first chapter to give you an idea of what I am writing: http://lisatallin.tumblr.com/post/95241676476/another-draft-of-the-first-chapter-of-the-buried.

Why is this important?

My goal for the month is to complete the editing of Year of the Buried Elephant, a young adult fantasy that features Nahanni, a female protagonist of color, and her brother Mazen. There is an abysmal lack of protagonists of color in  young adult or fantasy. This novel will also feature characters with a variety of diverse life situations and it will span the globe. We live in a multicultural, multi-ethnic, multilingual, multi-abled world and I want to create a world on the page that reflects this modern reality. Growing up, I was a voracious reader, but I was always searching for that special book that I never found. I am now writing the book I wanted to read. I’m writing it for all the readers who don’t see themselves in stories. See the link above to read a draft of the first chapter.

It's also important because knowing that I have an army of supporters behind me is extremely gratifying and motivating. Slacking off in the studio will mean letting down all those people who believed in me. I won't let that happen.

Your help is important because it means that I won’t have to get into debt to attend this residency. Once I found out about the cost, I realized that I would also have to cover the lost income while I am away for the residency and the travel time. I am currently selling some things. I took an online teaching job for the summer in addition to my regular job (which currently covers my month to month bills).

I was worried about going into debt to pay for this artistic opportunity, so after learning that other residents have gone the fundraising route and after listening to the encouragement of my artist friends, here I am. Asking for help.

What's the money for?

I am requesting $3200 to cover the tuition (VSC generously gave me a partial grant, leaving me with a $2750 balance), travel costs and Indiegogo fee. 

What do you get out of the deal?

My friends, I offer you many goodies to the right: postcards, stickers, sneak previews, etc., depending on the contribution level that suits you. Don't feel limited by these options, you can donate whatever you want or donate without receiving a perk by clicking on the big pink CONTRIBUTE NOW button up at the top. Everyone gets my undying gratitude for helping bring Year of the Buried Elephant to life.

Other ways you can help

I totally understand that some people can’t contribute financially, but you can help out by promoting my campaign and spreading the word on social media or with your networks of folks who support creativity and the arts. Thank you!

multilingual, multi-abled world and I want to create a world on the page that
reflects this modern reality. Growing up, I was a voracious reader, but I was
always searching for that special book that I never found. I am now writing the
book I wanted to read. I’m writing it for all the readers who don’t see
themselves in stories. See the link above to read a draft of the first chapter.It's also important because knowing that I have an army of supporters behind me is extremely gratifying and motivating. Slacking off in the studio will mean letting down all those people who believed in me. I won't let that happen.Your help is important because it
means that I won’t have to get into debt to attend this residency. Once I found out about the cost, I realized that I would also have to cover the lost income while I am away for the residency and the travel time. I am currently selling some things. I took an online teaching job for the summer in addition to my regular job (which currently covers my month to month bills). I was worried about going into debt to pay for this artistic opportunity, so after learning that other residents have gone the fundraising route and after listening to the encouragement of my artist friends, here I am. Asking for help.What's the money for?
I am requesting $3200 to cover the tuition
(VSC generously gave me a partial grant, leaving me with a $2750 balance), travel costs and Indiegogo fee. What do you get out of the deal?


My friends, I offer you many goodies to
the right: postcards, stickers, sneak previews, etc., depending on the contribution level that suits you. Don't feel limited by these options, you can donate whatever you want or donate without receiving a perk by clicking on the big pink CONTRIBUTE NOW button up at the top. Everyone gets my undying
gratitude for helping bring Year of the Buried Elephant to life.Other ways you can help

I totally understand that some people can’t contribute
financially, but you can help out by promoting my campaign and spreading the
word on social media or with your networks of folks who support creativity and
the arts. Thank you!

story:
Wait, MORE money?

In March this year, Wings Over Scotland ran a breathtakingly successful fundraiser. We asked for £50,000 in a month and achieved it in eight hours, going on to raise over £110,000 in total. 

The money has been used for various projects - we've already spent many thousands of pounds on running costs, conducting opinion polls, taking out media adverts and distributing hundreds of thousands of leaflets and posters and postcards and badges.

But the main thing we wanted to fund was The Wee Blue Book - a pocket-sized guide to independence, fully-sourced and referenced and covering every important aspect of the debate, but which can be read in about an hour. We budgeted £15,000 for it, with the intention of producing perhaps 20,000 copies. But we've got four million voters to reach, and we need to scale that up a bit.

A Runaway Success

The digital edition of the book is already available. It's been an astonishing success - almost 250,000 copies have already been downloaded, and the critical response has been extremely positive. But to really get the word out we have to print physical copies on paper for all the people who don't use the internet or wouldn't come to a politics website. 

So we want to make and distribute at least 10 times as many copies as our original plan - that's 200,000. 

Fortunately we've got a very good deal on printing costs, so that won't cost 10 times as much money. But it'll take more than we've got left in the kitty, so we're asking you to dip into your pockets one last time to help us top up the coffers.

That's about it, really

You're busy people. You get the idea.

Oh, just one more thing

Sorry to pull a Columbo on you, but due to Electoral Commission rules we now have to point out that we can only accept any donations of £500 or over if they're from "permissible donors". That means that if you want to give us more than £499, you'll have to be at least one of the following:

• An individual registered on a UK electoral register, (including overseas electors and those leaving bequests)

• A UK-registered companies 

• A UK-registered trade union 

• A UK-registered building society 

• A UK-registered limited liability partnership (LLP) that does business in the UK 

• A UK-registered friendly society 

• A UK-based unincorporated association that carries on business or other activities in the UK

Also, in the unlikely event that you want to give over £7,500 your name will have to be declared to the Electoral Commission and published on their list of large donors.

To donate £499 or under, you can be absolutely anyone.

story:
Short Summary

The Fine Print is a quarterly magazine based in Gainesville, Fla., that publishes locally focused, socially conscious journalism. We are run entirely by a small group of student volunteers with a passion for social justice, the arts and the city of Gainesville.



Each copy is free; we don't make money from what we do. In order to stay running, we rely on a yearly grant from Generation Progress, a D.C.-based non-profit. We also fundraise with twice-a-year benefit shows. In the past we have received $5,000, which covered printing costs and rent for our office. This year, however, Generation Progress’ budget was reduced, cutting our grant down to $700 for the entire year.

When sending one issue to print costs $1,084, we now have no way to pay for even one print edition.



Since 2008, The Fine Print has published everything from an exploration of Tent City , a homeless encampment hidden in the brush of the Hawthorne Trail, to a profile of a Nigerian rapper  who decided to make Gainesville his home, to a step-by-step on how to ferment wild mulberries . We select each story fastidiously, always with our mission in mind: to serve the Gainesville community by providing thoughtful, thorough coverage of a city that we love.


We want to stick around in print, where we exist happily in stacks in coffee shops and restaurants around town, or filling the black boxes around campus. We want to press a copy into your hands when you see us tabling. We love seeing people pick up an issue for the first time and linger on the pages, then flipping to the front and reading it again.

And with your help, we can make up the lost funds and continue putting out seasonal issues that you can hold in your hands, hot off the press.


What We Need & What You Get

  • With $700 from Generation Progress, we need $4,300 to get back to our usual financial place. Printing costs about $1,084 a pop, and we come out four times a year. Rent costs $240 a month, which we use 9 months in the year.

  • We want to thank you in any way we can for your donations! We’ve pooled together our talents, resources and connections in the Gainesville community to offer perks for your money. All are locally based and are meant to give you a good flavor of us as a publication and Gainesville as a city. And everything comes with a hearty dose of our most sincere gratitude.

  • Although we have packages of merchandise, if you would like to purchase individual pieces, check out our online shop here . There you can also find our exclusive Indiegogo campaign poster, made by the lovely Emma Roulette.

  • Every dollar you donate will help us send to print, even if we don’t reach our entire goal. As a volunteer-run publication, anything helps!


The Impact

Your money will keep The Fine Print running and publishing physical copies of the magazine, as well as our yearly writing and arts journal, Prairie. While we could make the switch to publishing online-only, we believe strongly that both publications are made to be read in print. Here's why:

  • Among the serious, socially conscious articles we like to sprinkle crosswords and cut-out games. (We once had a Fine Print fortuneteller! There were Beyonce jokes!)

  • We also make infographics  that sum up important news or events (or even just tell you how to get around ) which you can rip out and keep with you.

  • Prairie is its own physical experience (not to toot our own horn), printed on thick, textured paper and hand-bound with twine.

  • Reading from a physical, printed copy is a particular pleasure. We want to encourage you to retain that tiny joy, because we feel it too.

Your money could also help The Fine Print expand. We always hope to add pages, which lengthens our stories to provide more in-depth reporting and storytelling. We want to support more new, young writers, photographers, illustrators and designers who also feel an urge to contribute to the community. With more pages, we can publish a more robust and detailed issue.


Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can’t spare the cash, we could still use your help. Share this campaign -- verbally or virtually -- to help us spread the word! Any time you take out of your day to help us we sincerely appreciate, and we hope to continue providing you with locally grown, lovingly produced journalism and art.
