story:
*If you donate anonymously and choose a perk in which there is a public thank you on my website I will automatically omit that part of the reward unless notified. I want to honor your privacy. 

The Book and What It Means to Me

We all reach a point in our lives when we wish we could go back and tell our younger selves a great many things.  In fact for a number of years now I’ve wished that I could write a book to my younger self and to anyone who’s facing the same challenges I did, and about a year ago I felt the Lord say that it was time for me to write just such a book. 

Since January I’ve spent hundreds of hours writing a very transparent account of my life and relationship with God.  It covers my struggles with grief, rejection, drug addiction, homosexuality, pornography, and most importantly my struggle to find my identity.  I know, it sounds like a somber affair, but it’s actually filled with a lot humor and hope.  You’ll read about a quirky little town along with many other interesting characters, as well as many of the extraordinary happenings that have gotten me to where (and who) I am today.  You’ll walk with me through both challenges and triumphs.

Over the last several years my husband and I have ministered to many men and women who deal with similar issues to the ones we’ve faced in our walk with God.  This book is being written both to give encouragement to those who face difficulties with sexual brokenness and to inspire the Church to love and nurture them.

Underlying the whole work is a larger goal, which is to open up honest conversations and promote love and respect towards all people. My aim is to un-vilify those who have been considered outcasts by the church and to break the stigmas that I feel are keeping people away from Christ. Ultimately, it’s meant to inspire us as a church to reach out to others with love and the good news of the gospel.  

Where We’re At and What We Need

Right now my editor and I are finishing up the third draft and preparing to gather feedback so that we can then complete the fourth and final draft.  We’re also still trying to come up with a title…  Who knew it would be so difficult to pick one?

When you contribute to this project, your money will go directly toward the following areas:

Graphic Design

The cover of the book, both front and back, need to be designed and potentially tested and altered to fit printing requirements.

Website Design

In order to properly promote and sell the book I need a website.  Funds will go directly toward hiring a programmer/designer.

Editing/Layout

I’m working closely with my editor to ensure that this book is of the highest quality and that it’s properly formatted for both physical and ebook copies.

The First Print

When the book is done we’ll need to build inventory in order to begin distributing it.  Any amount of money over the project’s initial goal will go directly toward printing more copies, and having extra stock will allow me to give some copies away to people or ministries that may need it.

The Impact

Contributing to this book’s publication will not only help in fulfilling my dream of telling my story to others, but I believe it will also help bring knowledge and wisdom to them.  This book is about how God brought freedom and redemption into my life; it’s a labor of love, and I fully believe it carries the message of the gospel, which has the power to change lives.  It’s my hope that through your investment it can bring hope to multitudes of people and impact the ways in which the church ministers to those who face similar struggles as my own.

Risks & Challenges

This is thankfully a very low-risk project.  The book is nearly done; I would estimate that 90%-95% of the work on the content itself is done.  Right now the primary thing that we need is this initial investment, and the risk of requiring further funds is low; I’ve received quotes for much of the work and printing details are already mostly set.  The only challenge I can see is one of delays in getting the book into a finalized form and working out all of the printing.  Even if this process does take longer than expected, I can’t see it taking more than a few months.  My goal is to officially release the book this summer, and I don’t believe there’s any reason that can’t happen.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can’t give toward this project, even sharing it with your friends helps tremendously. And whether or not you’re giving, the most important thing you can do is pray!  Please pray that there are no unforeseen hindrances in completing this project.  Please pray that the book, once published, will find its way to the right people.  Please pray for myself and my family, that we would be protected and encouraged, and that doors would be opened through which we can share and promote the message of the book, which is ultimately the good news of the gospel.

story:
The French have a saying, "The best part of an affair is going up the stairs". And so it’s been that way for me with my 89-year affair with life. For me, the anticipation of finding the unexpected has been the equivalent of 'going up the stairs'. ~ Bernie Feshbach

Allow us to introduce Bernie Feshbach, WWII Veteran and Purple Heart recipient.

An extraordinary man who's lived an extraordinary life.

Ten different careers spanning the course of seventy plus years. All varied, all unexpected or as Bernie likes to call it, serendipitous. It's made for some amazing, unbelievable, hilarious, heartfelt and shocking stories. We know, we've read them. Think Mad Men on steroids. (Seriously, if you've ever wanted to live vicariously through someone, it should be this guy.)

Manufacturing Furrier

I borrow $7,500 in 1942 from my Mom and go into the business of manufacturing fur coats. I was 17 years old and my Pop naturally gave me fabulous 'guidance'. My Pop was the smartest, most giving person I've ever known.

Garmento (AKA Dress Salesman)

I became a very successful 'traveling' man, selling dresses on the road. Loved it. Wasn't home enough for the Princess to really dislike me. That dislike did come, with a passion, a little later. Our marriage lasted 27 years sustained by a white hot bond of anger. It's easy to stay hooked by being jointly and passionately pissed off at one another. Generates a lot of noise and action. One of first wife's favorite lines about me, told to anyone who would listen, was "Bernie doesn't get ulcers. He gives them".

Iowa Hog & Cattle Farmer

I was a walking, farming, financial disaster. Always smelling like hog farmer shit. Most days the Princess made me take a shower as soon as I got home. Which I did, after swallowing a few belts of Teacher's Scotch, neat, out of a glass. Resisted the temptation to drink right out of the bottle. Being a failure ain't exactly an ego booster. In the end, neither was the booze.

Private U.S. Army

After I returned to my outfit from radio operator's school, I taught myself how to type and became a high speed radio operator and the second fastest dot/dit guy in the radio group. Lieutenant Hamlin then called me in his office to proudly tell me that he was going to put me in for PFC which came with a $4.00 a month pay raise (the base pay was $50 a month). I told the Lieutenant that I would pass the promotion. I was the ranking private in my barracks, a private longer than anybody else in the barracks and liked that distinction. So I told him to "give the $4 a month to someone who needed it".

That brilliant move really accelerated my application to get transferred to an outfit that was going overseas. Ah, the folly of youth. Hamlin couldn't wait to get rid of me, so I was sent as a high speed radio operator (with a high speed confrontational big mouth) to Ft. Lewis to join the 241st Signal Corps Group which was attached to the Sixth Army. The 241st was out of Boston consisting mostly of Boston Irish from Scollay Square. They were tough mothers who always wanted to beat the shit out of any Jew. But embarkation on the troop ship saw the end of that attitude. We also had a few homos, as gays were called in those days, and no one gave a fiddler's fuck. People who never served with gays don't know shit, only ignorant prejudice.

Successful Stock Broker (Simultaneously becoming a drunk.)

I went looking for a job as a stock broker and got hired a few days later by a small time brokerage firm for a draw of $250 a month. The Princess cried the Mississippi River when I told her of my new profession, even as I 'guaranteed' her that I would be making at least $1,500 a month within 90 days. Being a fierce prospector, I bested that in very short order. In her defense, I never, ever consulted the Princess of my desire to get into the investment business because of her drive for a table-top smooth life. I have always tried to avoid pissing into the wind.

Now at age 89 and having outlived his money, Bernie is embarking upon his eleventh and latest career, author. But at 89, he needs some help. After taking one for us in Okinawa, we think it's only fitting to help him reach that goal.

Our campaign is simple: Let's get Bernie published!

It's not cheap people. To really do it right it requires not only the cost for the publishing itself but all the book promotion hoopla that comes with it. Things like event dates, travel, press, etc. Publishing houses shell out a lot of dough to establish first time writers and it can easily be 150k and up.

A dear friend of Bernie's, Simon Murray, has been incredibly helpful in getting the book into a publisher's hand. If something comes of it, we'll be thrilled. But deals like that can take a long time to develop.

So we're taking a grassroots approach to this effort. We've broken it down in stages and this is the first.

$22,500 puts us on the map. With this we can pay for:

  • ISBNS
  • EDITING
  • LAYOUT & DESIGN
  • COVER ART & ILLUSTRATION
  • PRINTING COSTS
  • EBOOK COSTS
  • PACKAGING, SHIPPING &  A FEW OTHER INCIDENTALS

Anything above that helps us move the process along further and faster. But with the above we can get this book published and into your, our benefactors', hands.

Plus we've come up some kinda cool rewards, ones you won't be getting from say a HarperCollins or a Random House.

With the hard work done, Bernie has now completed the book, we're incredibly confident that this task can be accomplished. And seriously, how awesome would it be to get his work into the Library of Congress? Frankly, we think the Library of Congress could use a little dose of piss & vinegar and shits & giggles. We sure know we could and we think you could too.

Just look at this guy, would ya.

This photo was taken in 1946, aboard the USS St.Mihiel which was serving as a hospital ship. It hauled my ass from Korea to Los Angeles by way of Yokohama and Honolulu. The trip took over a month. Wrote my folks almost every day with mailings from the stops. Hard to believe that I was ever 22 years old. ~ Bernie

Finally, we just want to thank you so very, very much for your help! 

For those of you who'd like to contribute but are unable to do so financially, that's okay. Here's how you can help...and boy will it really help!

Get the word out and make some noise about our campaign. Let your Facebook friends know about us and give them the link.
story_txt:
The French have a saying, "The best part of an affair is going up the stairs". And so it’s been that way for me with my 89-year affair with life. For me, the anticipation of finding the unexpected has been the equivalent of 'going up the stairs'. ~ Bernie Feshbach
Allow us to introduce Bernie Feshbach, WWII Veteran and Purple Heart recipient.
An extraordinary man who's lived an extraordinary life.
Ten different careers spanning the course of seventy plus years. All varied, all unexpected or as Bernie likes to call it, serendipitous. It's made for some amazing, unbelievable, hilarious, heartfelt and shocking stories. We know, we've read them. Think Mad Men on steroids. (Seriously, if you've ever wanted to live vicariously through someone, it should be this guy.)
Manufacturing Furrier
I borrow $7,500 in 1942 from my Mom and go into the business of manufacturing fur coats. I was 17 years old and my Pop naturally gave me fabulous 'guidance'. My Pop was the smartest, most giving person I've ever known.
Garmento (AKA Dress Salesman)
I became a very successful 'traveling' man, selling dresses on the road. Loved it. Wasn't home enough for the Princess to really dislike me. That dislike did come, with a passion, a little later. Our marriage lasted 27 years sustained by a white hot bond of anger. It's easy to stay hooked by being jointly and passionately pissed off at one another. Generates a lot of noise and action. One of first wife's favorite lines about me, told to anyone who would listen, was "Bernie doesn't get ulcers. He gives them".
Iowa Hog & Cattle Farmer
I was a walking, farming, financial disaster. Always smelling like hog farmer shit. Most days the Princess made me take a shower as soon as I got home. Which I did, after swallowing a few belts of Teacher's Scotch, neat, out of a glass. Resisted the temptation to drink right out of the bottle. Being a failure ain't exactly an ego booster. In the end, neither was the booze.
Private U.S. Army
After I returned to my outfit from radio operator's school, I taught myself how to type and became a high speed radio operator and the second fastest dot/dit guy in the radio group. Lieutenant Hamlin then called me in his office to proudly tell me that he was going to put me in for PFC which came with a $4.00 a month pay raise (the base pay was $50 a month). I told the Lieutenant that I would pass the promotion. I was the ranking private in my barracks, a private longer than anybody else in the barracks and liked that distinction. So I told him to "give the $4 a month to someone who needed it".
That brilliant move really accelerated my application to get transferred to an outfit that was going overseas. Ah, the folly of youth. Hamlin couldn't wait to get rid of me, so I was sent as a high speed radio operator (with a high speed confrontational big mouth) to Ft. Lewis to join the 241st Signal Corps Group which was attached to the Sixth Army. The 241st was out of Boston consisting mostly of Boston Irish from Scollay Square. They were tough mothers who always wanted to beat the shit out of any Jew. But embarkation on the troop ship saw the end of that attitude. We also had a few homos, as gays were called in those days, and no one gave a fiddler's fuck. People who never served with gays don't know shit, only ignorant prejudice.
Successful Stock Broker (Simultaneously becoming a drunk.)
I went looking for a job as a stock broker and got hired a few days later by a small time brokerage firm for a draw of $250 a month. The Princess cried the Mississippi River when I told her of my new profession, even as I 'guaranteed' her that I would be making at least $1,500 a month within 90 days. Being a fierce prospector, I bested that in very short order. In her defense, I never, ever consulted the Princess of my desire to get into the investment business because of her drive for a table-top smooth life. I have always tried to avoid pissing into the wind.
Now at age 89 and having outlived his money, Bernie is embarking upon his eleventh and latest career, author. But at 89, he needs some help. After taking one for us in Okinawa, we think it's only fitting to help him reach that goal.
Our campaign is simple: Let's get Bernie published!
It's not cheap people. To really do it right it requires not only the cost for the publishing itself but all the book promotion hoopla that comes with it. Things like event dates, travel, press, etc. Publishing houses shell out a lot of dough to establish first time writers and it can easily be 150k and up.
A dear friend of Bernie's, Simon Murray, has been incredibly helpful in getting the book into a publisher's hand. If something comes of it, we'll be thrilled. But deals like that can take a long time to develop.
So we're taking a grassroots approach to this effort. We've broken it down in stages and this is the first.
$22,500 puts us on the map. With this we can pay for:

ISBNS
EDITING
LAYOUT & DESIGN
COVER ART & ILLUSTRATION
PRINTING COSTS
EBOOK COSTS
PACKAGING, SHIPPING &  A FEW OTHER INCIDENTALS
Anything above that helps us move the process along further and faster. But with the above we can get this book published and into your, our benefactors', hands.
Plus we've come up some kinda cool rewards, ones you won't be getting from say a HarperCollins or a Random House.
With the hard work done, Bernie has now completed the book, we're incredibly confident that this task can be accomplished. And seriously, how awesome would it be to get his work into the Library of Congress? Frankly, we think the Library of Congress could use a little dose of piss & vinegar and shits & giggles. We sure know we could and we think you could too.
Just look at this guy, would ya.


This photo was taken in 1946, aboard the USS St.Mihiel which was serving as a hospital ship. It hauled my ass from Korea to Los Angeles by way of Yokohama and Honolulu. The trip took over a month. Wrote my folks almost every day with mailings from the stops. Hard to believe that I was ever 22 years old. ~ Bernie
Finally, we just want to thank you so very, very much for your help! 

For those of you who'd like to contribute but are unable to do so financially, that's okay. Here's how you can help...and boy will it really help!
Get the word out and make some noise about our campaign. Let your Facebook friends know about us and give them the link.

story:
The Vision

I'm Justin Harmon. For the past several months, I've been putting together a guide that I believe will help people follow their dreams, bring purpose and meaning to their lives, and maybe even change the world. 

I've connected with and brought together a cast of some of the most amazing world changers and dreamers I know to help in spreading the messages for positive life change and the pursuit of purpose and fulfillment. 

I believe that with a little inspirational & motivational push, anyone can change their life and become a beacon of light for themselves and the rest of the world. This guide is that push. My fellow contributors are the beacon of light. And you are the key to changing the world. 

The Guide

Change your Perception, Change your Life is a collection of essays written by myself and many other dreamers and world changers that talk about following dreams, changing the world, changing negative life perceptions, waking up from the status quo mindset, finding meaning, reaching fulfillment, and more. 

I'm raising money to help in publishing of this book. I want to bring this book to life and help it reach those who need it. Any excess funds will be used to help further spread the message for positive life change and fulfillment. 

Why? You Say. 

As a young adult, I basically did everything I could to escape my life’s circumstances. I despised the notion of having to conform to the standards of life which surrounded me. It wasn't until I finally started to feel a deep inner need to find a purpose for my life, did I begin to learn and find a way to escape those negative feelings. I found that as long as I was pursuing or taking action on doing whatever I could to change my circumstances, by changing the way I viewed my life, and what was actually possible for it, did I start altering my perceptions of what I thought was possible.

The more I was focusing on and moving towards change, the more I grew, and progressed, and started to feel differently towards my situation. I want to help people find the joy and fulfillment that comes from seeking purpose, and meaning. I want to help people recreate a life for themselves that brings them happiness. That's what Change your Perception, Change your Life is about.

Why Should I donate?

Because the world needs all the positive inspiration and encouragement we can give it. 

That, and I don't want to just slapdash it together, when I believe that this guide can truly help people make some positive changes in their lives. 

The better quality it is, the more seriously people will take it. What better way to spread the message for change than to make it beautiful? That, and it just feels like the right thing to do. 

Where does the money go?

Your donations will allow me to have this book published and help bring it to those who need it most. It will also cover the costs of printing the book and t-shirts, as well as the 4% Indiegogo fees, and finally-just a little for myself for my time and effort in making this possible. 

This is a fixed campaign, so it's all or nothing. Let's make this happen! What do you say?

These are just a few of the color options available. However, all shirts come with the gray wording you see below. Sizes include (small, medium, large, xl, and xxl)

 

Can't afford to give? No problem!

If you aren't able to contibute financially, there is still a way you can help out. 

Wherever you are able to share and spread the word, that would be awesome!

story:
How to Not Lose Your Teen - Raising Kids who Love God and You Too!

We teach our kids about an enormous God—a God who shuts lion’s mouths, calms raging storms and speaks to us personally! But when they want to take a risk, we warn them of danger, afraid they’ll wreck their lives. God uses our struggles and mistakes to show us who He is… but parents don’t want to let their kids struggle or make mistakes. Though we say the most important thing is our faith, we often interact with our kids as if we don’t have any faith.

God taught me an enormous amount as we raised our own five teens, and through the teens I discipled and who lived with us. Witnessing the family dynamic up close, compassion welled up in me, and I wrote a book for parents of teens (and teens-to-be). People have told me it has transformed their families.

“I love the author’s stories, personal experiences and conversational style. She reminds me of Beth Moore. I was chuckling out loud at some parts and crying at others. I could relate to so many things she describes as a parent and have never been able to put into words – and now she did!”

We smother our kids in our desire to direct... we need to let them breathe. I love to watch the burden fall off parents’ shoulders as they stop “trying to be God.” Many have told me they now enjoy their teen!   Click here to read the brand-new first chapter: FreedHearts.org

 “The floodgates of my heart burst open after reading this book and I feel I have found a 'comrade' in this great adventure of parenting! I will use it to confirm God’s guidance as we parent our son.”

 About the Project

I printed a small run of this book a couple of years ago—now I need to reprint. Meanwhile, I’ve expanded, revised, and renamed it: How Not to Lose Your Teen: Raising Kids who Love God and You. (The previous title was: The Heart-Connected Life for Parents: Raising God-Dependent Teens.) The goal of this IndieGoGo campaign is to cover the reprint, new cover design, layout and professional edit. This book belongs in the hands of parents, pastors and youth leaders. I will use it at conferences and retreats when I speak and will distribute it online. I plan to produce an ebook and an audiobook as well.

“This is the best treatise on parenting I’ve ever read, and I read a lot. She poured her heart into every page.”

How far along is my project?

  • The first printing of my book is sold out!  I have made revisions to make it even more powerful and it is complete and ready to go to the printer!
  • I have obtained key endorsement from parents and counseling professionals.
  • I have an established blog and website:  www.FreedHearts.org
  • I have secured someone who is focusing on social media like FaceBook, Twitter, Amazon Author Pages, GoodReads, etc.
  • I am scheduling speaking engagements and retreats.

How will the funds be used?

  • ISBN number & Barcode
  • Book Cover design
  • Website and social media development
  • Printing of soft cover copies
  • eBook conversions
  • AudioBook recording

About Future Projects

I’m setting up conferences and retreats now. I have also nearly finished a second book, The Marriage Renovation. Take a sneak peek at the first chapter here:  FreedHearts.org   My hope is to exceed our IndieGoGo goal, to have money toward printing the marriage book as well. Eventually, I will produce companion books (workbooks, daily readings) for both parenting and marriage.

More About Me

“The Lord has given the author humor to pull down defenses and the boldness to speak the truth, as He attracts hearts to Himself.”

My husband and I have raised five (nearly) grown kids. This journey began as I was homeschooling, teaching at church and writing. I was privileged to disciple a handful of teens, some of whom lived with us when they could not live at home. I learned a lot through that time—about faith, about how God works in us. The parenting book welled up in me in response. If you have any questions or comments for me, please send them to freedhearts@gmail.com

 
Our Wonderful Kids

Thank you so much for your kind support of this project!

 “This book really touched my heart and tapped into a place that wants to filter out all the other 'muck' out there and plug myself totally into the Lord and only listen for His voice.”

story:
Despite the fact that I am still in shock, I will attempt here to tell the "story" relating why I need YOUR help. 

About a month ago I applied, very much on a whim, to a summer intensive at Columbia University for writing for television. I had searched for other programs like it, but the course at Columbia was the only one that was worth aiming for. I submitted my info, along with a creative writing sample (which I was very anxious about).

I highly doubted I would be accepted, knowing I aimed unbelievably high, but yesterday I got the acceptance letter in my inbox! 

Needless to say, I am over the moon. But as this program is at an Ivy League institution across the country, it's rather out of my financial range, which is why I made this fundraiser profile. If I'm going to pay for the course, travel, and living expenses for the month I am going to be in NY, then I'm going to need YOUR help! 

Please donate and thank you in advance!

-Ariel

story:
Smart Swipe uses the stories from real college students as well as my own stories to explore college hookup culture. This book offers a venue for students to turn to if they are feeling shameful, guilty, and unsafe about hooking up in college.

My name is Valerie McPherson and I am the author of Smart Swipe . I wrote this book because I wanted to get people to start talking about sex in a positive way. More specifically I wanted to help college students become more self-aware and empowered if they were participating in the hookup culture surrounding them.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover that college hookup culture is normal and that people shouldn’t be shamed for enjoying sexual pleasure. In this book, I hope to instill in you the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for a sex positive culture in you. And then ultimately, I want you to see this book as a tool to help you go about talking about sex or hooking up as a way to help you discover what you like physically and emotionally. But also ways to keep yourself safe and secured.

In this book, you'll learn about college hookup culture and sexual empowerment and education:

Common Sex - You will discover that most people who participated in college hookup culture shared a lot of similarities. A lot of students were nervous, excited and curious about this new freedom that they had. Most people were able to use this culture as part of this self-discovery about what they truly wanted in a future partner.

Female Empowerment - Women were able to neglect what they constantly heard in the media. They were able to take back their bodies and express openly that they too can enjoy sex. They too can be dominant. They too had a voice when it came to sex-related issues.

The Only Option - College Students go into college with these ideas and images of what it means to have fun in college. They watch movies about excessive drinking, partying and, of course, hooking up. So it’s no wonder that many of them go in believing that hookup culture is the only form of relationship they can have in college. In this section of the book, I pull from other researchers and their studies on hookup culture and why this mindset still continues to be popular.

You will love this book if you are an incoming college student, current college student, or anyone who has an interest in what it means to think positive about sex and hooking up.

Smart Swipe is a non-fiction book that speaks to college students and even parents who are looking at the phenomenon of sex on college campuses and so-called dating apps for the first time.

The Book - Smart Swipe


The book is written in three parts....

Part one contains the introduction, the questions I asked the students I interviewed, the student’s perspectives on hookup culture, the personal stories from students, and what they all had in common. In this section you will develop a general view on what college hookup culture is for you, what it is for students and just how people are doing it. Women were generally feeling empowered, excited and ashamed. Men were feeling confident, active and pressured when it came to this culture.

Part two contains chapters five and six. I look more in depth into just how women are feeling empowered from hooking up. In this chapter, you see that women are taking their lives and bodies back and how they are trying to break down that sex double standard. You also learn just how we as a society have set up the sex double standard for men and women. This leads into Chapter 6, that focuses on the myth that hooking up is the only option in college.

Part three contains chapters seven and eight. I open up about why I participated in the hookup culture and just what I learned from it. Much like the other students interviewed, I felt shame and was scared to open up about my sex life. But after a while, I learned that I like being in control of my sexuality and feeling this rush. I also discuss how I developed new lingo and how I discovered apps that were somewhat addicting. This chapter spills into the reality chapter where I discuss the issues we are scared to talk about, whether this is being tested, becoming pregnant, and facing those double standards.
It concludes with a final piece of advice for students who are thinking about or already participating in the college hookup culture.

What I Need & What You'll Get


This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:
 

The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in February 2020.

The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!

The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)

The Copyediting for My Book - to make help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication

The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this [season of year]

When I pre-sell 100 copies of my book, I will also publish an audiobook. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:
You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish

A Personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book

Your Name will appear in a Special, Acknowledgements Section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)

Early access to the Introduction of my Book and my entire manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback

The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover

I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share experience the experiences of writing my book

And more...


About the Author


Valerie McPherson is a current graduate student and research assistant studying Sociology at the University of West Georgia. Her hopes are to create conversations about sociological issues that are still having a major impact on people’s lives. As a sex positive feminist, Valerie McPherson wants to allow for individuals to become more open about talking about sex in order to drop the stigma that is associated with it. With these conversation she hopes to refine sex education in America. In regards to a career, she strives to become a Sociological Researcher, motivational speaker, and eventually obtain a PhD in Marriage and Family therapy to continue her journey on creating conversations we find hard to discuss.

I wrote this book because I was very curious on how individuals, regardless of gender, were looking at their own hooking up experience. In addtion, I notice that apps such as Tinder, were having a major influence on how college students were interacting with one anohter. With that, I was about to discover that there was still some conversations needing to be held in order for individuals become more self-aware, whether this was emotionally or physically.

Smart Swipe does just that--it opens up the conversation on just how hookup culture started. It gives the dialogue between empowerment and sexual liberation. Finally, it offers the talk most people are forgetting and that is the reality that hookup culture can be beneficial but also harmful.

My passion for the subject truly began my senior year of undergrad. I was at a place in my life where I felt absolutely low and hated the way I looked and felt--to the point where I was contacted multiple times by an individual who called me a ‘whore’ or ‘slut’. I didn’t believe it, but it just made me sad to think that these words were being used on people who didn’t actually do anything wrong, they just wanted to enjoy themselves sexually.

I was always safe about sex, I got tested, I got myself out of situations when I knew I couldn’t commit to someone. But I realized a lot of peers were not doing the same. So I wanted to do something about. I want people to stop thinking that by hooking up with someone or using these apps, they weren’t a bad person, or even worse, a ‘slut’. It just meant that it was right for you at the time, as long as it was your choice. All I ever wanted in my life was to help people face their problems head-on, and one of the best ways is to start educating others about problems that people are facing and what they can do to help alleviate those issues.

For more information, you can connect with Valerie McPherson at vmcpher1@my.westga.edu and on Instagram @valerie_mcpherson.

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #SmartSwipe and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page

Please share my book to 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.

Thank you so much of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Valerie McPherson

I wrote this book because I wanted to get people to start talking about sex in a positive way. More specifically I wanted to help college students become more self-aware and empowered if they were participating in the hookup culture surrounding them.My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover that college hookup culture is normal and that people shouldn’t be shamed for enjoying sexual pleasure. In this book, I hope to instill in you the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for a sex positive culture in you. And then ultimately, I want you to see this book as a tool to help you go about talking about sex or hooking up as a way to help you discover what you like physically and emotionally. But also ways to keep yourself safe and secured.In this book, you'll learn about college hookup culture and sexual empowerment and education:
Common Sex - You will discover that most people who participated in college hookup culture shared a lot of similarities. A lot of students were nervous, excited and curious about this new freedom that they had. Most people were able to use this culture as part of this self-discovery about what they truly wanted in a future partner.
Female Empowerment - Women were able to neglect what they constantly heard in the media. They were able to take back their bodies and express openly that they too can enjoy sex. They too can be dominant. They too had a voice when it came to sex-related issues.
The Only Option - College Students go into college with these ideas and images of what it means to have fun in college. They watch movies about excessive drinking, partying and, of course, hooking up. So it’s no wonder that many of them go in believing that hookup culture is the only form of relationship they can have in college. In this section of the book, I pull from other researchers and their studies on hookup culture and why this mindset still continues to be popular.You will love this book if you are an incoming college student, current college student, or anyone who has an interest in what it means to think positive about sex and hooking up.Smart Swipe is a non-fiction book that speaks to college students and even parents who are looking at the phenomenon of sex on college campuses and so-called dating apps for the first time.The Book - Smart Swipe
The book is written in three parts....Part one contains the introduction, the questions I asked the students I interviewed, the student’s perspectives on hookup culture, the personal stories from students, and what they all had in common. In this section you will develop a general view on what college hookup culture is for you, what it is for students and just how people are doing it. Women were generally feeling empowered, excited and ashamed. Men were feeling confident, active and pressured when it came to this culture.Part two contains chapters five and six. I look more in depth into just how women are feeling empowered from hooking up. In this chapter, you see that women are taking their lives and bodies back and how they are trying to break down that sex double standard. You also learn just how we as a society have set up the sex double standard for men and women. This leads into Chapter 6, that focuses on the myth that hooking up is the only option in college.Part three contains chapters seven and eight. I open up about why I participated in the hookup culture and just what I learned from it. Much like the other students interviewed, I felt shame and was scared to open up about my sex life. But after a while, I learned that I like being in control of my sexuality and feeling this rush. I also discuss how I developed new lingo and how I discovered apps that were somewhat addicting. This chapter spills into the reality chapter where I discuss the issues we are scared to talk about, whether this is being tested, becoming pregnant, and facing those double standards.It concludes with a final piece of advice for students who are thinking about or already participating in the college hookup culture.What I Need & What You'll Get
This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following: The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in February 2020.
The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!
The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)
The Copyediting for My Book - to make help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication
The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this [season of year] When I pre-sell 100 copies of my book, I will also publish an audiobook. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition.I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publishA Personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book
Your Name will appear in a Special, Acknowledgements Section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)
Early access to the Introduction of my Book and my entire manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback
The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover
I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share experience the experiences of writing my book
And more...
About the Author
Valerie McPherson is a current graduate student and research assistant studying Sociology at the University of West Georgia. Her hopes are to create conversations about sociological issues that are still having a major impact on people’s lives. As a sex positive feminist, Valerie McPherson wants to allow for individuals to become more open about talking about sex in order to drop the stigma that is associated with it. With these conversation she hopes to refine sex education in America. In regards to a career, she strives to become a Sociological Researcher, motivational speaker, and eventually obtain a PhD in Marriage and Family therapy to continue her journey on creating conversations we find hard to discuss.I wrote this book because I was very curious on how individuals, regardless of gender, were looking at their own hooking up experience. In addtion, I notice that apps such as Tinder, were having a major influence on how college students were interacting with one anohter. With that, I was about to discover that there was still some conversations needing to be held in order for individuals become more self-aware, whether this was emotionally or physically.Smart Swipe does just that--it opens up the conversation on just how hookup culture started. It gives the dialogue between empowerment and sexual liberation. Finally, it offers the talk most people are forgetting and that is the reality that hookup culture can be beneficial but also harmful.My passion for the subject truly began my senior year of undergrad. I was at a place in my life where I felt absolutely low and hated the way I looked and felt--to the point where I was contacted multiple times by an individual who called me a ‘whore’ or ‘slut’. I didn’t believe it, but it just made me sad to think that these words were being used on people who didn’t actually do anything wrong, they just wanted to enjoy themselves sexually.I was always safe about sex, I got tested, I got myself out of situations when I knew I couldn’t commit to someone. But I realized a lot of peers were not doing the same. So I wanted to do something about. I want people to stop thinking that by hooking up with someone or using these apps, they weren’t a bad person, or even worse, a ‘slut’. It just meant that it was right for you at the time, as long as it was your choice. All I ever wanted in my life was to help people face their problems head-on, and one of the best ways is to start educating others about problems that people are facing and what they can do to help alleviate those issues.For more information, you can connect with Valerie McPherson at vmcpher1@my.westga.edu and on Instagram @valerie_mcpherson.Risks & Challenges The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.Other Ways You Can Help Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:Please Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #SmartSwipe and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.
You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page
Please share my book to 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.
Thank you so much of all of your love and support!Thanks again,Valerie McPherson

story:
Here's My Story

More than 5 years ago, I began a theological transformation. I used to be a fundamentalist pastor who was certain about everything I had ever been taught about God, the Bible, and the church. Now, I'm an emergent church planter with a lot of doubt and whole new way of thinking about my faith. Fundamorphosis is my story.

What We Need & What You Get

Fundamorphosis is completed and now in the production stage with my publisher, Civitas Press. Finishing the writing and editing is really just the beginning of telling my story through Fundamorphosis, and I need your help to tell this story to as many people as possible.

  • By contributing to this campaign, you are enabling me to broadcast my story of transformation and change.
  • Plus, you get some really awesome, one-of-a-kind perks. Check them out on the sidebar to the right.
  • The goal is a nice round number: $2929 by Halloween (trick or treat!). I think we can do it. Will you help?

Everyone Has a Story to Tell. Help Me Tell Mine.

When you contribute to this campaign, here's what you're helping me to accomplish:

  • Marketing & Setup Costs
  • Website, Video Trailer, and Podcast Development
  • Travel Expenses
  • Launch Party

Use Your Megaphone for Good, Not Evil

I hate the bullhorn guy on the side of the street, condemning people in Jesus' name. Don't be that guy. Use your megaphone for good, not evil. Here's what you can do:

  • Share this campaign on Facebook
  • Tweet it on Twitter
  • Pin it on Pinterest
  • Email a link to all of your friends
  • Talk about it
  • Pray for it 

Summary of Fundamorphosis

Fundamorphosis is the story of how Robb Ryerse went from being a fundamentalist pastor to an emergent church planter. In time, the answers of fundamentalism just stopped resonating with Robb. He couldn't in good conscience perpetuate the traditions and beliefs with which he had grown up. So Robb, like many others have, left fundamentalism behind.
 
Fundamorphosis details the struggle of saying goodbye to the church he had always know. But more than just deconstructing fundamentalism, Fundamorphosis provides a constructive look at the shape Robb's beliefs now take: authentic, gracious, optimistic, and unfinished.
 
Fundamorphosis is a story in which many will be able to find themselves. It provides food for thought for those who remain fundamentalists. It also provides a roadmap for those who are in the midst of their own fundamorphosis.

Praise for Fundamorphosis

"Things change, the saying goes, and so do people - and that even includes fundamentalists. If you doubt it, let Robb Ryerse tell you about his Fundamorphosis. I have been witness to growing numbers of stories like Robb's - starting, of course, with my own. You may be an Evangelical/fundamentalist secretly dreaming of breaking out of your cocoon, or you may be an outsider trying to understand fundamentalism and its discontents - either way, Robb's story will introduce you to a growing trend that may indeed become a movement in the years to come." 
 
- Brian D. McLaren, author/speaker/networker brianmclaren.net
 
 
"Robb Ryerse’s Fundamorphosis gently addresses the psychological pain and nagging intellectual questions of so many who have been shaped by fundamentalist Christianity. Robb writes with honesty, compassion and respect for his religious roots and seeks to transcend and include. Fundamentalism, in it’s most basic sense, isn’t a cogent belief system to be critique as much as it is a desperate cry of the human heart. We all long for a certainty and security and a sense of belonging, that ultimately, can only be found in the mystery of God." 
 
- Mark Scandrette, author of Soul Graffiti and Practicing the Way of Jesus markscandrette.com
 
 
"Fundamentalism remains a powerful and polarizing part of the Christian landscape, deeply shaping its adherents in forms of life and thought that are contrary to the way of Jesus. In this book, Robb Ryerse narrates the story of his own journey from the dogmatic certainties of fundamentalism to a faith that embraces the mysteries and complexities of human existence in order to better love God and neighbor. This is a compelling story of personal and theological change, told with wisdom and insight, conveying both the intellectual and psychological stress of the transformation process as well as the joy associated with the discovery of new and life-giving paths."
 
- John R. Franke, General Coordinator, The Gospel and Our Culture Network
 
 
To read more about what I've written about Fundamorphosis, visit my blog: Fundamorphosis on The Grenzian
 
Thanks!
 
- Robb

story:
"You expect me to believe you're over eight hundred years old?"

"I don't expect you to believe it, but I'm actually closer to ten thousand and if you don't listen to me then you and half this city will be dead within a week."

The Story

Much is Taken is the first in a trilogy of books named The Neverman Chronicles. This series follows the life and trials of the world's only immortal as he evolves from a comically inept hunter-gatherer to a true master of the modern age.

Drawn to history's greatest events by an instinct he can neither understand nor resist, he has been our ever-present witness. But now that instinct is telling him to run. A shadow is falling over the wounded city that he calls home, one which threatens to undo all that he has fought so hard to protect.

Racing against time and unseen foes he must discover whether he has the strength to deny his own destiny and save us from ourselves. Never before has so much been at stake, never before has he had so much to lose.


Want More?  Download the first chapter for free, here.

The Author

I'm a daydreamer, a ginger, and an unrepentant sci-fi junkie.  I got hooked on the genre when I was a kid and I've been devouring it ever since.  I love all the what ifs and why nots that can be explored within the covers of a good science-fiction story.  So, when a 'what if' of my own presented itself, I wrote it down, and then I wrote some more.  Next thing I knew I had a three book story arc, a chapter by chapter overview for the first installment, and twenty chapters worth of first draft.

This was all done while studying full time (science, of course) and being randomly jumped on by my awesome two-year-old daughter.  How awesome you ask?  Well, one of her first words was 'dinosaur', so yeah, THAT awesome. Now the summer is here and, with your help, I have the chance to see this project through to the end.

What Your Support Will Provide

Overview:

  • Research: $750
  • Design:  $1,000
  • Promotion and Marketing: $750
  • Professional Editing: $1,000
  • Contributors Perks: $1,500

Research:  Writing is an incredibly time consuming process; writing feasible science-fiction, even more so.  The story is character-driven but I still want to create a universe built on sound science.  That will require a great deal of research and travelling to have sit down interviews with experts for their insight.

Design:  Every book needs a cover by which people will claim not to have judged it by.  This portion of the financing will be used to commission the artwork for said cover as well as additional promotional materialssuch as bookmarks, postcards et cetera.

Marketing: This portion of the financing will be used to purchase advertising in both online and print media.  The online investment will be primarily used to fund ad campaigns through Facebook and Google while the remaining money goes towards buying space in popular Science Fiction magazines.

Editing: Every writer needs an editor and this part of the funding will go towards hiring one with experience in the genre to review, critique my final draft in order to make it more appealing to publishers.

Perks: This project doesn't do donations.  People who contribute receive actual goods and limited edition items in return for their investment.  This part of the money will be earmarked for the sole purpose of honouring their rewards.

What You Get

By supporting this project, you will be the first to read the finished product and have your name included in the book's dedications.

Larger donations will bring larger rewards, including:

  • Signed hard-copies of the book.

  • Signed artwork (cover, concept art et cetera).

  • A character named after you.

  • Written to order short stories featuring characters from the book.

  • Original notes and handwritten draft material.

Should the target not be reached, the book will still be completed (though over a longer schedule) and all funds raised will be earmarked for delivering the perks owed to the contributors.

My intention is to have the completed book picked up by an established publisher, but, in the interest of seeing your contributions repaid in full, I do have a backup plan should this not occur.  I already have contacts with an independent E-book publisher/promoter that will carry the book and I will ensure that the amount required to self-publish contributors’ hard-copies is set aside for that specific purpose.

Other Ways You Can Help

Do you know any sci fi/fantasy readers who might be interested in this book? Make sure to let them know it's here.

See those lovely, shiny social media buttons?  Give them a click!  It costs you nothing, but it could help get this project the attention it needs and give a potential reader the book they've been looking for.

story:
Hur svårt kan det vara-samhället

- hur tusen år av kunskapstörst gjorde alla till experter på allt

Det vi ser utspelas under Corona-pandemin illustrerar problemet så tydligt: AI-företagare som utger sig för att veta hur viruset kommer att sprida sig, självutnämnda experter på Facebook som ”granskar” sanningen i myndigheternas budskap och forskare inom helt andra områden som plötsligt blivit experter på smittskydd. Att alla tydligen är experter på allt är inte unikt för Corona-krisen, men nu ser vi det tydligare. Boken började nästan skriva sig själv.

Boken har varit planerad länge. Jag gör sedan tidigare podden ”Hur svårt kan det vara” där jag intervjuar människor som faktiskt kan något – om saker som vi alla borde vara nyfikna på (www.hursvårtkandetvara.se). Tanken har hela tiden varit att en del av de där intervjuerna skulle användas i en kommande bok som ett sätt att förklara att ämnen faktiskt är komplicerade - tillsammans med exempel på ”dumhet” och folk som tror mer på sunt förnuft än forskning. Jag håller på att skriva boken, men jag behöver hjälp med att publicera den…

Även förlagsutgivning kräver insamling

Jag hoppas att ett förlag ska ge ut boken men har lärt mig att inga förlag har råd att ta risker - så för att ge ut en bok om man inte har en säker försäljningssuccé krävs förbeställd upplaga eller finansiering av layout, tryck och marknadsföring. Jag kommer inte tjäna något på bokutgivningen, eventuella pengar som blir över från kampanjen kommer att gå till marknadsföring av boken (och kanske utdelning till exempelvis skolor...?).

Jag har högskoleexamen och erfarenhet inom kommunikation, i övrigt är jag inte expert på det jag skriver om i boken: jag försöker istället förklara vad forskning visar och vad andra experter kommit fram till. Drygt 20 år inom politik på olika nivåer har gett mig en god förståelse för hur samhället fungerar och att man gör klokt i att lyssna på andra innan beslut. Nyfikenhet, bra minne och en hyfsad förmåga att förklara komplicerade saker är en bra förutsättning...

2017 skrev jag boken "Samhällsbygge pågår" (Hjalmarson & Högberg förlag).

Här kan du läsa mer om mig.

Tidsplan

Jag håller på att skriva boken och ett första utkast skickades till dem som ville i somras. Nu avvaktar vi i princip bara att det ska klarna hur det blir efter presidentvalet i USA (Trump är ett lite för tydligt exempel i boken för att missa det...). Tanken var ursprungligen utgivning tidigt denna höst.

Mer om bokens innehåll och syfte:

Grundtesen i boken är att vi står inför en utveckling där tusentals år av utveckling och framåtskridande – som gett oss de mest utvecklade samhällen människan någonsin upplevt – riskerar att brytas av fördumning och tillbakagång. En del av det som lett oss till dagens situation är förklarliga följder av teknisk utveckling, ökad kunskap, globalisering och bättre kommunikation. Men krafter som tjänar på att försvaga tilltron till kunskap och erfarenhet har – av olika skäl – lärt sig utnyttja svagheterna i dagens samhälle på ett sätt som förskräcker.

Trumps seger i USA 2016 och Brexit i Storbritannien är de mest kända, men jag argumenterar i boken för att det är samma faktorer som gjort att ”invandringsfrågan” blivit viktigare än ekonomi, jobb och utbildning och att allmänt populistisk politik kommit att dominera inte bara det svenska samhället utan de flesta demokratiska samhällen. Och att det är samma logik som gör att en hockeymålvakt anser sig vara expert på hur smittspridning ska stoppas.

Vill du läsa och ha synpunkter?

Vill du hjälpa till att läsa hela eller delar av manuset innan det går till tryck är jag jättetacksam! I så fall kan du anmäla det när du bidrar eller genom att e-posta till bjorn@bjornsundin.se
story_txt: Hur svårt kan det vara-samhället- hur tusen år av kunskapstörst gjorde alla till experter på alltDet vi ser utspelas under Corona-pandemin illustrerar problemet så tydligt: AI-företagare som utger sig för att veta hur viruset kommer att sprida sig, självutnämnda experter på Facebook som ”granskar” sanningen i myndigheternas budskap och forskare inom helt andra områden som plötsligt blivit experter på smittskydd. Att alla tydligen är experter på allt är inte unikt för Corona-krisen, men nu ser vi det tydligare. Boken började nästan skriva sig själv.Boken har varit planerad länge. Jag gör sedan tidigare podden ”Hur svårt kan det vara” där jag intervjuar människor som faktiskt kan något – om saker som vi alla borde vara nyfikna på (www.hursvårtkandetvara.se). Tanken har hela tiden varit att en del av de där intervjuerna skulle användas i en kommande bok som ett sätt att förklara att ämnen faktiskt är komplicerade - tillsammans med exempel på ”dumhet” och folk som tror mer på sunt förnuft än forskning. Jag håller på att skriva boken, men jag behöver hjälp med att publicera den…Även förlagsutgivning kräver insamlingJag hoppas att ett förlag ska ge ut boken men har lärt mig att inga förlag har råd att ta risker - så för att ge ut en bok om man inte har en säker försäljningssuccé krävs förbeställd upplaga eller finansiering av layout, tryck och marknadsföring. Jag kommer inte tjäna något på bokutgivningen, eventuella pengar som blir över från kampanjen kommer att gå till marknadsföring av boken (och kanske utdelning till exempelvis skolor...?).Jag har högskoleexamen och erfarenhet inom kommunikation, i övrigt är jag inte expert på det jag skriver om i boken: jag försöker istället förklara vad forskning visar och vad andra experter kommit fram till. Drygt 20 år inom politik på olika nivåer har gett mig en god förståelse för hur samhället fungerar och att man gör klokt i att lyssna på andra innan beslut. Nyfikenhet, bra minne och en hyfsad förmåga att förklara komplicerade saker är en bra förutsättning...2017 skrev jag boken "Samhällsbygge pågår" (Hjalmarson & Högberg förlag).Här kan du läsa mer om mig.TidsplanJag håller på att skriva boken och ett första utkast skickades till dem som ville i somras. Nu avvaktar vi i princip bara att det ska klarna hur det blir efter presidentvalet i USA (Trump är ett lite för tydligt exempel i boken för att missa det...). Tanken var ursprungligen utgivning tidigt denna höst.Mer om bokens innehåll och syfte:Grundtesen i boken är att vi står inför en utveckling där tusentals år av utveckling och framåtskridande – som gett oss de mest utvecklade samhällen människan någonsin upplevt – riskerar att brytas av fördumning och tillbakagång. En del av det som lett oss till dagens situation är förklarliga följder av teknisk utveckling, ökad kunskap, globalisering och bättre kommunikation. Men krafter som tjänar på att försvaga tilltron till kunskap och erfarenhet har – av olika skäl – lärt sig utnyttja svagheterna i dagens samhälle på ett sätt som förskräcker.Trumps seger i USA 2016 och Brexit i Storbritannien är de mest kända, men jag argumenterar i boken för att det är samma faktorer som gjort att ”invandringsfrågan” blivit viktigare än ekonomi, jobb och utbildning och att allmänt populistisk politik kommit att dominera inte bara det svenska samhället utan de flesta demokratiska samhällen. Och att det är samma logik som gör att en hockeymålvakt anser sig vara expert på hur smittspridning ska stoppas.Vill du läsa och ha synpunkter?Vill du hjälpa till att läsa hela eller delar av manuset innan det går till tryck är jag jättetacksam! I så fall kan du anmäla det när du bidrar eller genom att e-posta till bjorn@bjornsundin.se

story:
Short Summary

On March 20, 2013 my five year old son, Seth James Maceyko, died in a tragic accident.  Not only was my life changed by the loss of my son, but it was also changed by the things I experienced during those dark days.

I didn't go to Heaven and return to tell the world about it nor did my son come back from Heaven and suddenly share with me miraculous visions and stories of the after-life.  No, my son died and left us.  Unfortunately that is my reality.

However, I did experience some signs that changed the way that I view the after-life and what may or may not be waiting for us.  I now have a firm faith and belief that we all have a mission in this life and mine was shown to me during those horrible days.  My eyes were opened in ways that I never imagined and now I'm looking to share that story.

In one of the early mornings after my son passed I woke up with thoughts filling my head about how we used to snuggle every night and how Seth knew he was loved.  The visions were strong and I immediately wrote them down.  Shortly after I shared what became known as the Snuggle Time story on Seth's Facebook page (In Memory of Seth James Maceyko) and to my amazement within a week it was shared and seen by almost 200,000 people in states all over this nation.  It was shared in several countries and reached multiple continents.  It became a small movement of sorts and I even gathered the strength to share it at my own child's funeral.

People were so moved by the story that they began to ask me to write a children's book about snuggle time so that they could sit and read it before bed and share in their own special moment each day.  They emailed me about how the story changed the way they parented or the way that they viewed the world as a whole.  My loss and my pain opened their eyes and they saw.  They were realizing the value of the here and now.  The fact that we need to spend valuable time daily with our children.  If more people in the world shared nightly snuggle time maybe our world would change a little for the better.  That is what this story is all about.  Making a difference in other's lives through a children's story.  Opening up the avenue for conversation and hopefully ending with more love being shared between parents and children around the world. The original story went like this: 

Every night Seth would ask me one question. Every single night it was the same question. It didn't matter if he was playing with his toys, watching TV or whatever else he may have been doing. Right around 9 pm he would ask me that question and he expected me to play his game. The exchange would go like this: "Do you know what time it is?" Me: "Time for you to get a job?" Seth: "No." Me: "Time for you to clean your room?" Seth "Noooo." And we would continue back and forth until I responded with the correct "Snuggle Time?" And Seth would give a resounding "YES". Then he would climb up on my lap, snuggle up against his daddy and stay that way until he fell asleep. This happened every night. Snuggle time was the high light of my day and I believe it was Seth's as well. Snuggle time in our home meant hugs, kisses, and unconditional love. Snuggle time completed another day for us and allowed Seth to give and receive love, have a sense of security, and get the attention of his daddy to end his day. Snuggle time was pure. Snuggle time was open and honest. Snuggle time completed us. It didn't matter if I was reading, watching TV, browsing Facebook or anything else. When I heard "Do you know what time it is?" The world stopped so I could have snuggle time with my son. I no longer will get to hear that question. Snuggle time with Seth had come to an end but at least I experienced it. Some people drink alcohol, do drugs, or find another way to experience a high. Snuggle time replaced any need for that. There was no better high than holding that child in your arms and receiving his little hugs and kisses and hearing "I love you daddy" to finish your day. So I ask all of you, "Do you know what time it is?" It's a game that we all need to play more often. Maybe instead of play station the world replaced it with "Do you know what time it is" this world would be a better place. Maybe children would grow up with less hate in their heart. Maybe there would be less violence. Maybe there would be more kindness. Maybe we all would feel more fulfilled. Through all of this pain I at least can rest assured that Seth knew he was loved and I knew that I was loved in return. Both of us knew the answer before the question was asked. In our world it was always snuggle time. Now ask yourself, "Do you know what time it is?"


    What We Need & What You Get

    The funding is going to pay for the illustrator to help turn this story into a true children story.  We will complete the book and then self-publish.   If enough funds are raised we will even be making stuffed animals of "SJ the Monkey" so that children can snuggle up in bed with their very own SJ.   

    • You can purchase an autographed first edition copy through one of our perks.
    • You can get your loved ones name listed in a book, get a special speaking engagement for your church or group and so much more by checking out the perks area!  Please think about supporting us as we start out.
    • Surplus funds that are left over after the original printing and illustration of the story will be used to kick off the Snuggle Time movement - stuffed animals, bracelets, advertising, and even a phone app game is being discussed.  Any way we can get the Snuggle Time message out there we will use the funds to do just that!

    The Impact

    This is not just another book project.  This is a complete movement designed to impact the world.  Seth's Snuggle Time story came about because of a young child's death and a father's desire to not let hat death be in vain.  Seth touched many people while he was alive with his love and zest for life and now he is touching many more through death.  Join us as we attempt to change the world - one child at a time.


        Risks & Challenges

         What risks and challenges do we face?  It depends on what you consider a risk!  If we raise $50,000 and for some reason we only change one child's life would you consider that a waste of money?  Was that a risk? 

        We have already changed the way people around us view the world.  We have received many emails on line from people who read the snuggle time story and felt compelled to share with us how it moved them to change.  If we are changing people with the story already imagine what the right children's book could do!  How much risk is there if we can make the world better for children by reminding parents everywhere to slow down, value the time they have and focus on their children each day?  We are not promised tomorrow on this earth so value the time we have.

        Other Ways You Can Help

        Not everyone can financially support the many causes out there and we realize that.  However, you can still spread the message for us.  Share the Snuggle Time story.  Tell everyone who will listen about our situation and how we truly want to make a difference in this world by encouraging others to snuggle and love their children. 

        Even if you don't have a child at home anymore I'm sure you know people who do.  Maybe they need to be reminded because life is fast-paced these days and most of us never meant to be too busy.  Maybe you are the only one who can help them see it before it's too late.  Seth's Snuggle Time - a message of love.  Join us by spreading the word!

For every $5 raised we will send a CD to a family of the Sandy Hook Elementary School.

A beautirul aristic work, sound effects and lyrics expresing a story of human life, its challenge and spiritual connection.  She is CSO of Human Champion Spirit, with a passion for positively impacting youth for over 20 years, who come from fostercare, probation, broken homes and loving them to victory,.

The Mustard Tree is a childrens lost book, very comforting for those grieving from a lost pet or loved one. As the Children venture out to build a tree house they discover how Great Grandpa saves the day.

Imagine during this holiday season touching the lives of children all over the world who may want to feel close to their missing loved ones. 

THe fun part is that this is available in MP3 download, Kindle, soft cover/hardcover/CD Singalong

MP3 singalong audio book is complete, with digital sound effects, illustrations are comppete.

  • $3,000 for printing 1000 books soft cover
  • $3,000 for printing 500 hardcover
  • $1,000 more marketing costs (video,marketing techno tools)
  • $1,000 for cost of creation, to contributing children and audio editing.
  • Totalling $9,000 for cost to get this into the hands of kids for
    Christmas

We have already pre-sold 31 copies of hard cover/CD book and 2 audio demos. 

There are 3 Christian bookstores already intersted in the final copy.

With $10,000 we could complete all this with ease and get everything in the hands of our customers for Christmas.  And continue the marketing launch

  • under $50 gets a copy of MP3 Download link
  • $100 and over MPe and soft cover or more
  • Anything over $500 gets all of the forms in multimles of 5 each

How many childrens books do you know come with an audio, singalong. This has young children leading the singalong so everyone feels comfortable.

A portion of the sales

  • is contracted with the Author of the Lyrics, I am A Child of God, to fund education and mission scholarships. 
  • The participating children will receive a start up college steipend. 
  • The editor for the book is 14 years old.

The Impact

Our goal is to impact 37,000 children by Christmas, much  through the digital capabilities,  And many tangible in time for Christmas

  • Imagine who you know who's child is wondering where their loved one went.
  • THe music alone helps children feel more peaceful and they get to move with the music.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

Please pass the word and link to anyone you know who would love to touch a child's life during the holiday season.

And that’s all there is to it.

story:
Contrary to the classic and much-loved story, Dorothy never went to Oz. The emerald city over the rainbow was actually Paris! There that she found age-old wisdom, heart-felt creativity, and the courage to pursue her dream of brick-road-skipping dance routines. She became an ex-pat — never returning to Kansas — married an unsuccessful wizard, and spent the rest of her days in the city of bright lights. Why? Because there’s no place like a chez-soi! (Okay, the bluebirds were actually pigeons flying above the rainbow but let’s not quibble.)

I’m Bob Davis and I am conducting this funding campaign to self-publish a book about Paris, France, based on my experiences living there during most of the last year. The title of the book is “Radical Lines from a Lit City” and it will contain new poetry, satire, and commentaries from a viewpoint of living in Paris. This book will be approximately 6" by 6” wide with ten chapters and roughly 60 pages. There will be eight to ten pages of color and black and white photos showing unique aspects of the city. I am also including a chapter on French influence in Washington, DC, and American influence in Paris including interviews with several American writers/performers who live there. The cover page will be a copy of an abstract painting by a local DC artist. I intend to have the manuscript completed by the end of December. 

I finally decided, at 55, to live in Paris after many years of “thinking about it.” I first went to Paris when I was 16 and it was then that I fell in love with the city. I have been writing for most of my life — poetry, satiric stories, a one-man show when I lived in Los Angeles (and legal writing during three years of law school). Writing and acting was always an avocation, my solace from the tedium of a multitude of administrative jobs. I finally thought it was time to have a career doing something I love. I have been writing a blog since arriving in Paris last September called “The Bob-World” (www.the-bob-world.com). The blog consists of my adventures in France and many of my recent writings plus commentaries on modern-day Paris. I attend two weekly open mics, one in English and the other in French, which give me the opportunity to read/perform my work in front of an attentive audience. I also attend a weekly writing workshop where I get feedback from other writers about pieces on which I am working.

My goal is to raise $4800 during the five-week campaign. This figure is based on the following estimated costs to self-publish a book of this size with color photographs and color cover design:

Developmental edit — $1200

Copy editing — $800

Cover Design —$100

Book Formatting and layout — $600

Printing — (on demand only)

ISBN — $100

Total Marketing spend — $1500

Website — $150

Indiegogo and Paypal fees (7% for successful campaign, 12% otherwise) — $350

A digital copy of the book will be available at a later date. All donors will be included in an acknowledgment page. Donations of $50 or more will receive one or more complimentary copies of the book and updates on the progress.  (Please see section on Perks.)

 5% of the campaign contributions up to $4000 of goal amount and 10% for any contributions above $4000 will be donated to Hearts for Hope, an organization that supports families of children with cystic fibrosis.

Your contribution will allow me to publish a book with a unique perspective from 21st century Paris. It is an opportunity to share my writing with a larger audience as well as my enthusiasm for this legendary city.  I had the choice -- Oz or Paris -- and I, too, made the right decision.

story:
Mega Chomp & Cowgirl Ninja

I love writing and wanted to create characters that my nieces and nephews could relate to, in order to encourage them to read and help them discover that reading can be fun and rewarding.

In the series I will have:

  • Children's books that teach lessons to pre-school aged kids.
  • Books for early readers and late elementary/early middle school.
  • Graphic novels for young adults.

What We Need & What You Get

  • The major expenses for this project include: artist illustrations, book printing costs and interactive eBook expenses.
  • The rewards include: digital copies of the book, hard copies of the book (potentially delivered in person by the real life Mega Chomp!), a Mega Chomp themed party (including a live book reading and a Mega Chomp cake) and more!
  • Although we can't update the Perks once they have been claimed, rest assured that anyone who contributes at the $15 level or above (that is, anyone who reserves a copy of Mega Chomp to the Rescue, whether hard copy or digital) will also receive the digital audio download, which will include six songs and an audiobook! Other perks have been added unofficially (see the Updates for details) including things like temporary tattoos designed by Jack Lowe of Skin Kitchen, and a coloring and activity book featuring art from both the children's book and graphic novel!

Why Mega Chomp Matters

Unexpected changes can be scary for anyone, and children deal with unforeseen change all the time. MEGA CHOMP TO THE RESCUE reminds kids that even though change can be scary, they have the power to turn those changes into unique gifts that make them special. Encouraged by a big sister with her own set of quirky attributes, Mega Chomp learns that even a girl like her can be a superhero.

Risks & Challenges

The illustrator for this book, the very talented Aleksandar Bozic Ske, has completed the artwork for MEGA CHOMP TO THE RESCUE, and is already working on artwork for the sequel! We already have the first physical proof of MEGA CHOMP TO THE RESCUE in our hands, and we're making a few minor edits before the printing begins. It's so close, we can taste it!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you like the idea of Mega Chomp and Cowgirl Ninja but can't afford any financial support today, you can still be a huge help by sharing this campaign with your friends. You can like our Facebook page at the link below, and you can use the Indiegogo sharing tools to spread the word on social media.

  • Mega Chomp and Cowgirl Ninja on Facebook.
  • Mega Chomp to the Rescue on Pinterest.
  • Mega Ninja Publishing on Youtube.

Thanks!

-Dustin
