story:
If you can't contribute, help by Sharing on Face book

I'm Anton Brzezinski. I wrote Picasso's Secret, False Memories and other novels.

I'm basically an old sci fi fan whose been writing all his llfe and never broke into the big time world of publishing. I even had a Hollywood agent over twenty years ago who couldn't sell my spy novel Cain and Able. In fact a top agent, thirty years ago, who promised to send out my first novel, Starship Conquistador, then conveniently lost the only copy, back in the days of typewritten manuscripts. Admittedly my first novels were pretty bad. I'm a slow learner. It took me until now to write a great book. But now I've done it,

I want to publicize it. If you like the genre, I think if you read it, you'd realize it's a page turner, with rich detail and intricate plotting. I'm raising money to publicize it. At whatever level this campaign succeeds, something can be done. At the highest level, I can hire a good publicity company. At lower levels of campaign success, I can use You Tube's system of short commercials placed on thousands of videos to let people know the series exists.

  Lets face it, books no one knows about sell few copies. I've published several and they wound up selling only to people who knew me as a semi-celebrity artist. Google the name. I painted sci-fi and surrealism.

  I had some great wiring teachers in Hollywood.
Author Robert Bloch who wrote Hitchcock's Psycho edited my short stories and told me how to write for movies. Ray Bradbury encouraged me to write. A.E.Van Vogt gave me his writing secrets. I had unique advantages which apply to this genre.      I took swordsmanship from swashbuckler Errol Flynn's instructor.
I took horsemanship from a Hollywood stuntman. I've fought hours with sharp medieval swords and have the scars to prove it. I've studied medieval history, combed the ruins myself in Europe, excavated Mayan sites in Yucatan. I know how to make  Epic novels like this come to life with detail. Lets make this happen.

story:
Help Bring My Life In Horror to print

My name is Kit Power, and I am an author, blogger, podcaster, reviewer, and lifelong fan of the horror genre. 

For the last five years, I've written a monthly blog as part of Gingernuts Of Horror - Europes biggest independent horror blog, and recipient of 12 British Fantasy Society nominations in the Best Non-Fiction and Best Magazine / Periodical categories.

Part critique, part autobiography, My Life In Horror is an extended act of cultural and psychological archaeology: every month, I write about a book, film, album or event that had a permanent impact on my developing mind, and talk both about the item itself and my relationship with and to it. 

The volume one collection includes extended essays on:

Robocop

The Temple Of Doom

Stephen King's IT

John Carpenter's The Thing

The Wasp Factory

Queen: Greatest Hits II

Gremlins

And many, many more.

Every single essay has been fully revised, expanded, and will be professionally edited for this edition, and the essays themselves have been rearranged to be presented in the order in which I first experienced the subjects. This volume will represent the definitive edition of this work, creating a book that serves as both a passionate appreciation of the works of horror that have shaped my life and as a memoir of my development as a writer.

I am incredibly proud of this book and want to ensure it's published to a professional standard, with thorough editing, clean formatting, and a good looking cover.

And I can only do it with your help.

 

What I Need & What You Get

Professional editing costs money. Professional formatting costs money. Professional cover design? Money. I need this book to be as good as it can be, and I'm not currently in a position to invest that money ahead of time. This campaign allows me to fund that important work by pre-selling copies of the book, and then use the funds raised to ensure the book is presented to a standard I feel proud of.

For that reason, I have made this an all or nothing campaign. That means the project will only go ahead if I raise enough money to ensure that the editing, book production and shipping can be completed (including calculating in-site and transaction fees).

So, that's why I'm making this project a crowdfunded one. What do you get in return for your support? Well, most obviously, you'll get a copy of the book - in the case of the physical editions, signed copies. There are also exclusive-to-this-campaign perks where you can request me to record a reading of your favourite My Life In Horror column or short story. See FAQs for more.

There will also be two different limited hardback editions of the book, both of which will only be available via this campaign. These editions will both feature covers exclusive to this campaign and will be individually numbered and signed. The Deluxe Edition (limited to 26 copies, lettered and signed) will also contain an exclusive essay. This essay will only ever be published as part of this edition of this book.

So, you'll get My Life In Volume 1, signed and/or in a format unique to this campaign. You'll also get a warm glow from knowing you helped me get this book out into the world in the best shape I could.

 

Risks & Challenges

This is not my first self-publishing rodeo. I have successfully self-published my debut short story collection A WARNING ABOUT YOUR FUTURE ENSLAVEMENT THAT YOU WILL DISMISS AS A COLLECTION OF SHORT FICTION AND ESSAYS BY KIT POWER. 

Prior to starting this campaign, I approached several editors I have worked with before for quotes. All have been advised of the timescale and confirmed they can work within it safely. The person who will be formatting and creating the covers has also confirmed they'll be available to do the work within the timescale. In each case, I also have an alternate who is also available.

That said, the two biggest risks are that either those timescales slip or I have miscalculated the costs. 

In the first case, I will be transparent about any such issues as and when they arise and will keep you fully appraised of the production process following the close of the campaign. I don't anticipate any issues here - for my part, the text is fully assembled and ready to go to the editor the second the campaign successfully concludes.

In the second case, the main x-factor is the transaction fees from the site itself. Having spoken to other people who have run this kind of campaign, they've advised that those fees end up taking out around 15% of the total figure (and that doesn't include the separate 5% the site itself takes or the £50 flat fee). That transaction figure can vary, though, depending on the number of small backers, as it has a 'floor' of 30p + 3%. What this means is that if this project funds entirely through e-book purchases, say, those transaction fees would be higher than 15% (though in that case, the project would still fund comfortably).

The pre-production costs are known, and the physical productions costs and postage I have estimated carefully. Should I turn out to have miscalculated on either, I will swallow any additional costs in order to complete the production and get you your books. I don't expect to make much (if any) money off this project, but I am confident that if it funds, I will be able to fulfil it, out of pocket if necessary. That's why I've set it as an all-or-nothing campaign, and why the figure to raise is £1100.

If the project funds, barring an act of God, the book is going to happen.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

A project like this will live or die by word of mouth. If you've enjoyed My Life In Horror, whether or not you can contribute financially, you can absolutely help make this happen in a number of ways:

Tell people about the project - Tweet or post a link to Facebook. Tell people why you dig MLiH, and why you think this'll be worth their while.

If you have a blog, plug it there (and if you want me to provide some text, drop me a message).

If you have a podcast, mention it there - again, every avenue that helps get the word out helps the project (and if you do this, drop me a link so I can signal boost).

If you're a part of any Facebook or Goodreads group that might enjoy the book, share the link and let them know.

Thank you for taking the time to check out this project, and for your support in making it happen.

story:
A book for every Somali who lives abroad and who wants to understand his/her religion, culture and heritage. Book was inspired by a woman, who saw Somalis turning into dozens of different nationalities only because they were brought up in another country. We have to remember who we are and where we come from, so that our offspring can live confidently in this world.

 

The book is meant for the whole family and it's written in understandble somali because we want everyone to benefit from it fully. The main topic in the book is  our religion and our worldview. It will satisfy everyone who reads it iA.  

 

The money that we are raising to help Somalis is going to be used for publishing the book and putting it in amazon which will help everyone get hold of the book. We are so happy that we can contribute to the growth  of our somali community all over the world.

 

Help us reach publish this book and share forward!

 

___________

 

Assalaamu calaykum wa raxmatullaahi wa barakaatu! Soomaalida caalamka ku faaftay waxa aanu u soo saarnay buug ay caqiidadooda ku ilaashtaan meel walba ay joogaan ayna ka walwalin noloshooda iyo ta ciyaalkooda toona. Waa buug loogu tala galay reerku inay isla akhristaan oo ay ka faaidaan. Wuxuu ku qoranyahay soomaali fudud oo si fiican loo fahmi karo. 

 

Nagu caawi inaan buugan muhiimka ah caalamka oo dhan gaadhsiinno oodadkeenna ugu caawinno. Fadlan dadka kale sii gaadhsii!

story:
Hello all, it's Kat Sloan here with Kathel Coven Press. I want to thank you so much for taking the time to check out my campaign. You are a major contributing factor in helping this project become a reality.

Welcome to my World!

     I am an ambitious author and novelist, and I recently opened a small publishing company; Kathel Coven Press. I am so excited to have embarked on this amazing journey and I would love for you, that's right YOU, to be a part of it. This project has been three years in the making, but I finally have all the tools I need to make it a reality. What I need is an integrated support system, readers, fans, and contributors. You are the behind-the-scenes superstar and your assistance is invaluable. This campaign is my starting platform to fund my company and get my first book published and effectively marketed. I have amazing plans for the future, and by backing me here you will forever be on my list of supporters and have first access to perks down the road. You won’t want to miss out on this part, but I’ll explain more about that later.

     So without further ado, I present to you The Lycanthropire Saga: Half Blood! The first of four books in the saga (possibly five or six since the feedback thus far has been so fantastic!), this novel is approximately 76,000 words and about 300 pages. It is a full length romance-thriller work of fiction layered with elements of the supernatural and it breaks all the rules as far as genre goes. It has romance, thrilling adventure, supernatural creatures, and characters that you simply won’t be able to get enough of.

     "Trapped in a world she doesn’t understand and haunted by a past she doesn’t remember, young Native-American Lakota Avital discovers that she is part of a supernatural existence. When Irishman, Aiden Kathel enters her life and captivates her with his magnetic charisma, she falls desperately in love with him. In a tumultuous turn of events, Lakota discovers that she is a half-blood werewolf and her eternal love, Aiden, is a vampire. Their forbidden love and the dark secrets of Lakota’s past unravel and threaten to tear both their worlds apart.  Their lives will be tormented with heartbreak, grief, and sacrifice as they desperately attempt to thwart war of catastrophic proportions between their two worlds."

What We Need & What You Get

     My goal is to raise to raise $6500 in 30 days and you can help make that happen. The money will be used to get the publishing imprint off the ground paving the way for future authors and help publish the debut novel. It won’t fund the entire project but will help get it kick-started so that in the next year it will be able to fund itself through sales and sponsors. But I can’t do it without you, so I’ve set aside some amazing perks for all my backers. Yes, that’s YOU!

Contributor levels and what you’ll get...

     Human - $5   

     You’ll get to be noted as a contributor on a special “thank you” page on my website

     Kalapuya - $10   

     You’ll get the e-book for Kindle, Nook, or Ipad + the $5 perk

     Werewolf - $25   

      You’ll get a signed paperback edition + $5 perk

     Vampire - $50   

     You’ll get a signed paperback edition + a limited edition bookmark featuring the cover art + a personal thank you note + the $5 perk

     Half Blood - $100   

     You’ll get a signed hardcover edition + a limited edition bookmark featuring the cover art + a limited edition poster featuring the cover art + a personal thank you note + the $5 perk

     Lycanthropire - $250 

     You’ll get everything in the $100 level + Your name as a sponsor on the “Acknowledgments” page in the interior of the second print of the book (We are republishing sometime between March and June 2014 to accommodate celebrity endorsements, yes that means you get the original print + the new print with famous endorsements and your name on the interior.)

     Untouchable - $1000 

     You’ll be my ambassador at one of the “Supernatural” or “The Vampire Diaries” conventions I will be attending in 2014. You’ll be able to sit and chat with me at my booth, enjoy the three or four day weekend on your own, or a little of both. I will provide one general admission ticket for the weekend and at least one autograph or photo-op session with Jensen Ackles or Jared Padalecki from Supernatural or Ian Somerhalder, Paul Wesley or Nina Dobrev from The Vampire Diaries. Conventions will be held in either Las Vegas, NV or Burbank, CA (near Los Angeles) on select dates in 2014 and at this level I can only guarantee one ambassador per event. Please contact me in advance to contributing to check availability of ambassador position or request the event you would prefer to attend. Travel and accommodations not included, but the conventions do offer great deals at the hotels.

     BONUS!!! - EVERY SINGLE BACKER will forever be on my list of contributing sponsors and you will be the first to know about new things happening with the project as it progresses such as: celebrity endorsements, merchandise, film deals, and 1st access to second book. You will also be the first to receive invitations for special opportunities such as: convention appearances, meet-and-greets, and fan events.

Here is a breakdown of where the funds will go. If the whole goal is not met, the funds will be distributed proportionally to each of the categories.

  * $300 – Kathel Coven Press start-up costs; business licensing, permits, etc.

  * $300 – ISBN and barcodes for print books

  * $200 – Copyright & Trademark rights

  * $650 – Developmental and Copyediting services 

  * $100 – Team of collaborators and proofreaders

  * $200 – Print and e-book formatting and design

  * $500 – Cover art design and formatting

  * $2000 – Marketing & Advertising; bookmarks, flyers, posters, storyboards,   merchandise, newspaper-TV-radio ads, book signing costs, convention vendor fees and licensing, and the list goes on.

 * $1750 – Promised materials to be sentto my backers 

  * $500 – Other unforeseen costs that will inevitably pop up

(Indiegogo does take a small cut of the proceeds that are raised here in exchange for us being able to use their platform.)

 

Impact

     There are three amazing ways you will make a difference with your contribution as a backer on this campaign:

BREAKING BARRIERS - The world of vampires, werewolves, and all things supernatural is hot, and I mean burning like a bonfire hot, industry. My vampires don’t sparkle in the sun, but the genre has continued to develop a massive fan base with the ever increasing popularity of The Vampire Diaries, Supernatural, and Being Human among other television shows. The literary world has mirrored that hunger by releasing dozens of new novels related to the genre. Ironically, I wrote this book before it was such a hit and I wrote it because I wanted to see the genre take a new direction. The series will feature an entirely new species that will change the way we look at the genre. It was intended to appeal to the audiences with its heavy tilt towards romance while maintaining much of the old ways we think of vampires: think Anne Rice and Interview with a Vampire. But it also pushes the genre to think in a new direction all together, by blending the two once hardened worlds into one cohesive existence. It breaks stereotypes and barriers of the vampire versus werewolf world in a way that’s never been done before and that will have an epic impact on the genre. Become a part of the phenomenon before it hits a massive scale, and you can say that “I helped make that book possible!” 
 

FUTURE MOTION PICTURE - Becoming a backer now helps me pave the way to a major motion picture. There will be scripts, yes as in movie scripts, written between 2014 and 2015, and I’m already making connections with Hollywood to find the right director, producer and film company. I need your contribution now so that I can continue to grow these relationships and see this massive project fully realized. I also have limited production merchandise in the works based on the book for all those fans out there that just can’t get enough. 
 

RESPONSIBLE PUBLISHING - Finally, as a backer, you’ll be helping me set an example of responsible publishing for the next generation. Traditional full-scale publishing avenues are cost efficient but not necessarily environmentally responsible. It’s sad, but so many of the books end of in our land fill. I am outsourcing and teaming up with Ingram Spark and their on-demand printing abilities. This greatly reduces the number of books and paper that go to waste since the books are only printed once they are ordered. In addition, Ingram Spark now has the ability to print on SFI certified, acid-free, crème paper instead of the industry white. That means more responsible use of the materials used when printing the book. This avenue isn’t the cheapest route, but I felt like this was the perfect opportunity to set an example for responsible book publishing. As a result, your contribution means that much more and you will be a part of the positive environmental impact. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you aren’t in a position to contribute, no worries… that doesn’t mean you can’t
help.

  • BECOME MY AMBASSADOR - help spread the word with me, make some noise about the campaign and about the book. Facebook it! Tweet it! Tell that gal that makes your coffee at the local Peet’s or Starbucks! Ask your friends to pitch in! I have business cards with all the info and I’d be happy to send you some if you think you have a fantastic circle of people who would be interested in my work. 
  • SHARE - Indiegogo makes it super easy with their share tools, so use them at no charge!

 

ANNOUNCEMENT!!!

BONUS PERKS will be added here at random times!

           *BONUS PERK #1 - First contribution at the $100 level will also receive a $5 gift card to Starbucks!
story_txt:
Hello all, it's Kat Sloan here with Kathel Coven Press. I want to thank you so much for taking the time to check out my campaign. You are a major contributing factor in helping this project become a reality. Welcome to my World!     I am an ambitious author and novelist, and I recently opened a small publishing company; Kathel Coven Press. I am so excited to have embarked on this amazing journey and I would love for you, that's right YOU, to be a part of it. This project has been three years in the making, but I finally have all the tools I need to make it a reality. What I need is an integrated support system, readers, fans, and contributors. You are the behind-the-scenes superstar and your assistance is invaluable. This campaign is my starting platform to fund my company and get my first book published and effectively marketed. I have amazing plans for the future, and by backing me here you will forever be on my list of supporters and have first access to perks down the road. You won’t want to miss out on this part, but I’ll explain more about that later.     So without further ado, I present to you The Lycanthropire Saga: Half Blood! The first of four books in the saga (possibly five or six since the feedback thus far has been so fantastic!), this novel is approximately 76,000 words and about 300 pages. It is a full length romance-thriller work of fiction layered with elements of the supernatural and it breaks all the rules as far as genre goes. It has romance, thrilling adventure, supernatural creatures, and characters that you simply won’t be able to get enough of.     "Trapped in a world she doesn’t understand and haunted by a past she doesn’t remember, young Native-American Lakota Avital discovers that she is part of a supernatural existence. When Irishman, Aiden Kathel enters her life and captivates her with his magnetic charisma, she falls desperately in love with him. In a tumultuous turn of events, Lakota discovers that she is a half-blood werewolf and her eternal love, Aiden, is a vampire. Their forbidden love and the dark secrets of Lakota’s past unravel and threaten to tear both their worlds apart.  Their lives will be tormented with heartbreak, grief, and sacrifice as they desperately attempt to thwart war of catastrophic proportions between their two worlds."What We Need & What You Get     My goal is to raise to raise $6500 in 30 days and you can help make that happen. The money will be used to get the publishing imprint off the ground paving the way for future authors and help publish the debut novel. It won’t fund the entire project but will help get it kick-started so that in the next year it will be able to fund itself through sales and sponsors. But I can’t do it without you, so I’ve set aside some amazing perks for all my backers. Yes, that’s YOU!Contributor levels and what you’ll get...     Human - $5         You’ll get to be noted as a contributor on a special “thank you” page on my website     Kalapuya - $10         You’ll get the e-book for Kindle, Nook, or Ipad + the $5 perk     Werewolf - $25          You’ll get a signed paperback edition + $5 perk     Vampire - $50         You’ll get a signed paperback edition + a limited edition bookmark featuring the cover art + a personal thank you note + the $5 perk     Half Blood - $100         You’ll get a signed hardcover edition + a limited edition bookmark featuring the cover art + a limited edition poster featuring the cover art + a personal thank you note + the $5 perk     Lycanthropire - $250       You’ll get everything in the $100 level + Your name as a sponsor on the “Acknowledgments” page in the interior of the second print of the book (We are republishing sometime between March and June 2014 to accommodate celebrity endorsements, yes that means you get the original print + the new print with famous endorsements and your name on the interior.)      Untouchable - $1000       You’ll be my ambassador at one of the “Supernatural” or “The Vampire Diaries” conventions I will be attending in 2014. You’ll be able to sit and chat with me at my booth, enjoy the three or four day weekend on your own, or a little of both. I will provide one general admission ticket for the weekend and at least one autograph or photo-op session with Jensen Ackles or Jared Padalecki from Supernatural or Ian Somerhalder, Paul Wesley or Nina Dobrev from The Vampire Diaries. Conventions will be held in either Las Vegas, NV or Burbank, CA (near Los Angeles) on select dates in 2014 and at this level I can only guarantee one ambassador per event. Please contact me in advance to contributing to check availability of ambassador position or request the event you would prefer to attend. Travel and accommodations not included, but the conventions do offer great deals at the hotels.      BONUS!!! - EVERY SINGLE BACKER will forever be on my list of contributing sponsors and you will be the first to know about new things happening with the project as it progresses such as: celebrity endorsements, merchandise, film deals, and 1st access to second book. You will also be the first to receive invitations for special opportunities such as: convention appearances, meet-and-greets, and fan events.Here is a breakdown of where the funds will go. If the whole goal is not met, the funds will be distributed proportionally to each of the categories.  * $300 – Kathel Coven Press start-up costs; business licensing, permits, etc.  * $300 – ISBN and barcodes for print books  * $200 – Copyright & Trademark rights  * $650 – Developmental and Copyediting services   * $100 – Team of collaborators and proofreaders  * $200 – Print and e-book formatting and design  * $500 – Cover art design and formatting  * $2000 – Marketing & Advertising; bookmarks, flyers, posters, storyboards,   merchandise, newspaper-TV-radio ads, book signing costs, convention vendor fees and licensing, and the list goes on. * $1750 – Promised materials to be sentto my backers    * $500 – Other unforeseen costs that will inevitably pop up(Indiegogo does take a small cut of the proceeds that are raised here in exchange for us being able to use their platform.) Impact     There are three amazing ways you will make a difference with your contribution as a backer on this campaign:BREAKING BARRIERS - The world of vampires, werewolves, and all things supernatural is hot, and I mean burning like a bonfire hot, industry. this is an art project more than a fundraiser. give me a dollar ($1) and I will send you a poem. I will write it for you, on a tiny yellow legal pad, sign and date it, buy an envelope and a stamp, address it and drop it in the mailbox.

I wanted the goal of this to be $60 (to buy a bag of inspiration to write poems for y'all) but the minimum has to be $500. 

once indiegogo gets their 4-9%, there won't be any left for me. which is kind of how I wanted it.

also, the poems might be vulgar at times, so no one easily offended please.

-ben burr

pps don't forget to claim your perk, if you don't I can't send you a poem

story:
On November 24, 2013, over 100,000 Ukrainians gathered on Kyiv’s Maidan Square to protest the decision of President Viktor Yanukovych to dismiss a planned trade deal with the European Union in favor of strengthening ties with Russia. The subsequent demonstrations rapidly escalated into what was referred to as a civil war between the police and anti-government protesters in which at least 70 lives were lost and many more injured.  The recent ousting of President of Ukraine Viktor Yanukovych, while a success for pro-European Union activists, has placed Ukraine and its 45 million people in an enduring state of worry over securing a peaceful transition of political power, possible national fragmentation, and the continued strategic battle between the West and Russia.

Since 2003 the Centre for Applied Nonviolent Action and Strategies (CANVAS) has worked with activists facing oppression all over the world.  In October, we launched the English version of Making Oppression Backfire, a booklet of methodologies and tactics for nonviolent activists dealing with oppression.  The booklet was compiled by CANVAS from over ten years of experience with individual activists and movements who learned how to turn a bad situation into positive momentum. 

In line with our goals of making the tactics of nonviolent resistance more globally accessible, we would now like to offer a translation of the book in Ukrainian in support of the nonviolent struggle of the Ukrainian people. 

                                 

CANVAS needs your support to make this translation possible - as soon as possible!

Dealing with oppression is a skill set - and it is teachable.  With CANVAS' track record of training and equipping the top tier of civil resistors, you can be sure that your donation will help to spread the cause of nonviolent action in Ukraine!

What We Need & What You Get

With the funds raised for the translation, we will publish a Ukrainian version of Making Oppression Backfire to be available for FREE online alongside our other freely downloadable publication, 50 Crucial Points.

The Impact

By making a contribution to this campaign, you will be supporting current and future Ukrainian activists interested in furthering their nonviolent struggle for democracy and an accountable government. '

While we cannot predict what the future will bring for the Ukrainian people, we CAN do our utmost to ensure that violence is avoided and that Ukrainian activists have the resources necessary to make their movement a success.

               

ABOUT CANVAS

The Centre for Applied Nonviolent Actions and Strategies is a Belgrade, Serbia -based activist group that seeks to educate civil resistors all over the world about strategic nonviolence.  It was founded by the members of the Serbian nonviolent resistance group Otpor (resistance!) that helped to bring down dictator Slobodan Milosevic in the year 2000. Since then CANVAS has been involved in hundreds of youth movements in central Europe and the middle east. Some of the groups that have learned and applied CANVAS methods directly include Egypt’s April 6th movement (2011), Georgia’s Kmara! Movement, Sudan’s Girifna movement, Ukraine’s Orange Revolution participants  and Russia’s Oborona  movement. CANVAS trainers have worked with people in over 40 countries, and participated in  over 200 workshops or conferences and trained over 2000 participants. The CANVAS workshop model is based around the ideas of unity, planning and nonviolent discipline and seeks to bring about the transfer of knowledge about nonviolent strategies from the people who have successfully implemented it themselves.

CANVAS members have been featured in multiple documentaries including the Peabody award winning Bringing Down a Dictator, and the movie How to Start a Revolution.

In 2006 CANVAS published an activist textbook entitled Nonviolent Struggle: 50 Crucial Points that has since been translated into five languages and downloaded over 17,000 times by nonviolent resistors all around the world. Making Oppression Backfire is envisioned to be another booklet for activists, with updated case studies and exercises.

Other Ways You Can Help

In addition to donating to our campaign, we warmly welcome any thoughts or suggestions you might have that would help us to realize our goal.

You can also go to our LIBRARY at  WWW.CANVASOPEDIA.ORG to download our other nonviolent resistance materials. or check out the documentary BRINGING DOWN A DICTATOR about the Otpor/CANVAS struggle.

Finally, please VISIT our FACEBOOK PAGE  or find us on TWITTER .

Thank you for your help!

~  CANVAS Team ~

story:
Bosnian American Professionals Association presents the First Annual BAPA Forum 

October 3rd-5th in SLC


ABOUT THE SPONSOR: 
The Bosnian American Professionals Association's (BAPA) is a non-profit based out of Salt Lake City. BAPA's primary purpose is to provide networking opportunities for fellow Bosnian Americans and foster continued professional growth in the community. As part of the first BAPA Forum we have decided to feature Bosnian American authors and share their expertise with the Salt Lake City community. 
Additionally, as our event partner, we have selected Bosana Foundation, a 501 c(3) which offers scholarships and professional development to college students in Bosnia & Herzegovina. We will contribute 50% of our fundraising efforts to their campaign. This is in line with our strategy to strengthen the connection to Bosnia & Herzegovina. 


ABOUT THE Keynote Speaker Kenan Trebincevic, author ofThe Bosnia List :
At age eleven, Kenan Trebincevic was a happy, karate-loving kid living with his family in the quiet Eastern European town of Brcko. Then, in the spring of 1992, war broke out and his friends, neighbors and teammates all turned on him. Pero - Kenan's beloved karate coach - showed up at his door with an AK-47 - screaming: "You have one hour to leave or be killed!" Kenan’s only crime: he was Muslim. This poignant, searing memoir chronicles Kenan’s miraculous escape from the brutal ethnic cleansing campaign that swept the former Yugoslavia. After two decades in the United States, Kenan honors his father’s wish to visit their homeland, making a list of what he wants to do there. Kenan decides to confront the former next door neighbor who stole from his mother, see the concentration camp where his Dad and brother were imprisoned and stand on the grave of his first betrayer to make sure he’s really dead. Back in the land of his birth, Kenan finds something more powerful—and shocking—than revenge. 


FRIDAY OCTOBER 3rd, 2014 

VIP Fundraising Reception
Benefiting  BAPA & Bosana Foundation 5:00pm-6:30pm
Meet our honored guests Kenan Trebincevic, Jasmina Cesic, Elvis Hadzic & Ajla Terzic. Hors d'oeuvres provided by BAPA.
*Donate through Indiegogo to attend the VIP Reception.
Location: Squatter’s Upstairs 146 W Broadway

Keynote Presentation 
Kenan TrebincevicThe Bosnia List 7:00pm-8:30 pm
*Book Signing to follow Q&A
*sales provided by King’s English
Location: Salt Lake City Public Library-  210 E 400 S

SATURDAY OCTOBER 4th, 2014

Utah Humanities Book Festival Panel
Bosnian American authors in the US
3:00pm-5:00pm 
Kenan Trebincevic  The Bosnia List 
Elvis Hadzic The Curious Case of Benjamin Zec
Jasmina Dervisevic-Cesic The River Runs Salt, Runs Sweet
Ajla Terzic Mogla je biti prosta prica, Lutrija

Develop Blueprint for 2015 Strategic Plan 
Get Involved- Committee Breakout Sessions

story:
Run to Nowhere: a Fact... Fiction... Farcical... is a book of short stories. It is the first of a three-volume collection of short stories. In addition, Andrew has finished a full length novel, a fast-paced thriller, a comedic screenplay and countless novellas, most of which will be adapted into novels.

"The Employment Assassin" After his inability to find gainful employment, a Phoenix, Arizona man becomes unhinged, going on a killing spree to enact revenge against the executives/HR managers who passed him over for another candidate.

“A Glorious Afternoon” Life stands still as a father and son spend the afternoon at the ballpark, forging a bond through tragedy.

“Voices from the Grave” Scott Carson thought his interview with death row convict Jeff Beverly was going to be routine, however he soon realizes it's anything but, as he finds himself face down on an Alabama jail cell floor.

“The Conversation I” Chestnut, a verbose pensioner, dominates a conversation while trying to engage a pensive stranger as he waits for Darlene.

“A Silly Way to Die” Helen, a new grandmother, fears she’ll never have the opportunity to see little Joey again as her plane experiences serious turbulence.

“Obsession” Love is never easy, especially when the object of your affection is unattainable.

“The Conversation II: The Interrogation” Detective Smitty, in one of his final acts, prior to retirement, questions the prime suspect involved in a love triangle gone wrong.

“The Blood Splattered Sales Meeting” Tempers flare as an eccentric group of misfits endures another ludicrous 7a.m. sales meeting. Will there be blood?

“The End” Success has been good to Max Rockwell, extraordinarily good, but he has a secret, one in which he doesn’t even know.

“Detroit” A retired farmer reflects on his life after a brief encounter with a drug addicted former jazz musician in urban Cleveland.

“Internet Escorts” This is a true account of several women’s financial hardships, and how those hardships transformed ordinary women into unsuspecting internet prostitutes.

“The Howard Stern Defense” Suburbia Phoenix is home to one of the more unusual criminal trials in recent memory. An Arizona man was acquitted of multiple felonies, including murder, after his defense attorney convinces a jury that listening to Howard Stern drove his client insane.

“Lilith and Rocco” Pretentious cat Lilith battles wits with Rocco, the dimwitted family mutt, before one of Rocco’s play-date canines comes out of the closet.

*Carless' goal is to raise the necessary funds to publish, print and market his book. He realizes not everything goes as planned. Therefore,Carless may have to extend the publishing and printing, based on the time-frame needed to complete both. However, his editor is in place and ready to go once the necessary funds are secured. In addition, he has secured guidance for setting up the publishing, printing and promoting of "Run to Nowhere".

questions the prime suspect involved in a love triangle gone wrong.“The Blood Splattered Sales Meeting”
Tempers flare as an eccentric group of misfits endures another ludicrous 7a.m. sales meeting.  Will there be blood?“The End”
Success has been good to Max Rockwell, extraordinarily good, but he has a secret, one in which he doesn’t even know.  “Detroit”
A retired farmer reflects on his life after a brief encounter with a drug addicted former jazz musician in urban Cleveland.  “Internet Escorts”
This is a true account of several women’s financial hardships, and how 
those hardships transformed ordinary women into unsuspecting internet 
prostitutes. “The Howard Stern Defense”
Suburbia Phoenix is home to one of the more unusual criminal trials 
in recent memory. An Arizona man was acquitted of multiple felonies, 
including murder, after his defense attorney convinces a jury that 
listening to Howard Stern drove his client insane.“Lilith and Rocco”
Pretentious cat Lilith battles wits with Rocco, the dimwitted family 
mutt, before one of Rocco’s play-date canines comes out of the closet.
*Carless' goal is to raise the necessary funds to publish, print and 
market his book. He realizes not everything goes as planned. 
Therefore,Carless  may have to extend the publishing and printing, based
 on the time-frame needed to complete both. However, his editor is in 
place and ready to go once the necessary funds are secured. In addition,
 he has secured guidance for setting up the publishing, printing and 
promoting of  "Run to Nowhere".

story:
About the project

The project aims at reprinting the revised second edition of the 'Murder of Democracy in Himalayan Kingdom', a rare and historic book about Bhutan and written by Mr. DB Lamitare in 1978.  The book, whose first edition copies are hardly available in any bookstalls around the world, has been banned for circulations within Bhutan by the Bhutanese regime for the last 35 years. The author has granted permissions to reprint the book, and the project aims to print at least 1500 hardcover copies within this year. If we able to pledge additional contributions, the budget will be used in printing more copies, and translation of the author's rare book 'Dankido Bhutan' into English.

What We Need 

We need USD 5500 to print the revised second edition of the 'Murder of Democracy in Himalayan Kingdom'. We target to make the book ready by the end of January 2014 if we become able to raise the sufficient funds required to publish the book. Here is our tentative budget breakdowns.

  • Digitalization of the book into editable format: 200 USD
  • Content revision, editing and proof reading: 1,000 USD
  • Layout/design/cover: 300 USD
  • Printing/binding: 3,500 USD (1500 copies) 
  • Shipping and handling costs: 500 USD

The Impact

The world community will get chance to know about all insides of Bhutan, its society and geopolitics. Readers can also raise powerful voices against suppression on the Nepali-speaking citizens by their so-called democratic regime.

About the author

Mr. DB Lamitare was born in 1925 in Labsibote village of Goseling block of Chirang district in southern Bhutan. He received his primary education in a Sanskrit Pathasala (school) in Bhutan itself. At the age of 23, he was suspected of his political involvement in the 'Jai Gorkha' movement, which had spilled over parts of the southern Bhutan from Indian district of Darjeeling in late 1940s.

Mahasur Chhetri was one of the most vibrant freedom fighters to sacrifice his life for the cause of Nepali-speaking southern Bhutanese. The first Prime Minister of Bhutan, Jigmi Palden Dorji, packed Mahasur Chhetri inside a leather bag and threw him alive into the Sunkosh River in 1951. Mr. Lamitare was just 26. The Bhutan government crushed the historic uprising in Bhutan ruthlessly; many were declared anti-nationals, arrested, tortured and forcefully evicted.

The brutal killing of Mahasur Chhetri simply for raising voices against suppressions gave Mr. Lamitare a lot of insights, and he decided to fight against that by daring to leave Bhutan. Accordingly, he took asylum in Vanarasi of India, where he started organizing various political campaigns against the Bhutanese regime.

In Vanarasi, Mr. Lamitare joined the Banaras Hindu University and obtained a degree in Sanskrit literature (Vedanta Philosophy). While continuing his struggle for human rights and democracy, he also devoted his time and contributed appreciably in the development and promotion of Nepali literature; encompassing diverse fields of religion, culture, philosophy and poetry.  His most popular writing has been the publication of 'Dankido Bhutan' meaning 'burning crisis in Bhutan', a political book in Nepali language.

Mr. Lamitare began to shape the 'Murder of Democracy in Himalayan Kingdom' after sustained and abstruse studies of political history of Bhutan. The book presents social and political history of Bhutan in a comparative context of Nepal and Sikkim. It is in English language.

This was partly written in 1972, while the remaining portion of the book was completed afterwards. When this book was first published in 1978, the feudal Bhotia, Bhutanese officials and their lackeys got annoyed with him. In fact, the Bhutanese royal family and their so-called democratic government appeared to be very angry with Mr. Lamitare.  Even his feudal Bhotia friends were enormously surprised and irritated as to why a poor Gorkha Bhutanese has dared to raise his pen for siding with the people.

The authority did numerous public campaigns to inform them that this author is a 'most wanted terrorist', and even declared a handsome package for capturing him alive or dead. However, those campaigns never ended his mission to write against the atrocities. 

Currently, Mr. Lamitare resides in Haridwar of India, where he has been extensively writing, and has become a hotspot for Indian media as regards to the Bhutanese issue.

What if we raise EXTRA

Incase we get more generous hearts to join this mission there by enabling us to raise above what we have pledged, the money will be used in translation and printing of the author's another rare book 'Dankido Bhutan' meaning 'Burning Crisis in Bhutan'.

How you can help this project

  • Express your generocity by backing this project. Your contributions will help the global readers to find a must read book about Bhutan's society and politics. Let Bhutan continues banning circulation of this book. We can together increase readership of the rare book by printing a large number of copies.
  • Tell your friends about this book 
  • Share this project among book lovers known to you. You can share it by clicking this button.

Thank you for your incredible support, you have made this dream (and this book) a reality. The Indiegogo campaign is over, but the journey to find meaningful work is just beginning. 


Buy The Quarter-Life Breakthrough on Amazon! 
Join the community! thequarterlifebreakthrough.com

As seen in:

***

My story

Hi, I'm Smiley. I’m a writer and a lover of life. A year ago, the voice inside my head telling me to listen to my heart and take a leap, finally got loud enough that I couldn’t ignore it. So I quit my comfortable, government job in D.C. and moved to San Francisco with nothing but two suitcases, my newfound optimism, and a lot of energy. This book is about that journey. 

I’m sharing my story about coming alive and learning how to make a lasting impact in others’ lives at the age of 30—for you, because no one can have a quarter-life breakthrough alone. By contributing to this project, you’ll not only get a beautiful book that will help you figure out your next steps, but most importantly: you’ll become part of a community of like-minded people that will help support you in achieving your own breakthroughs.

Why write this book?

For starters, it’s not easy to find a job. In 2011, according to The New York Times, over 25% of Americans aged 25-34 were not working. But this doesn’t mean Millennials are lazy—quite the opposite, actually. We want to work, but we want work that is connected to our values. Some of us care so deeply about aligning our jobs with ourselves that we are willing to change careers multiple times, take pay cuts, take unpaid internships, even move back home with our parents, all while we figure out our next step. 

But figuring out that next step can be really hard. After I started writing about my breakthrough on my blog, I realized readers were struggling with the same things I was. I knew I had to develop my ideas into an actual book. 

So I’m writing a book about what has worked in my own search for meaningful work. It’s a book about finding a way to make a living, working hard, doing something you love. I believe it’s unacceptable that half of Americans are unsatisfied with their jobs, and this book is for everyone who feels the same way.  

This book is for everyone who believes the quarter-life crisis shouldn’t be a crisis, but a breakthrough, a moment of empowerment and opportunity.

How is this book unique?

The book will feature beautiful illustrations, goal-mapping worksheets, career transition resources, and writing prompts, all designed so you can have your own breakthrough.

More than just a book, The Quarter-Life Breakthrough is about creating a community of people who refuse to settle for mediocrity.

This book is the companion I wish I had during my own quarter-life breakthrough.

It’s approachable and easy-to-read, featuring personal stories from an actual twentysomething (okay, okay, thirtysomething as of June 29). This is not a 300-page self-help book written by some grey-haired Ph.D from Harvard studying twentysomethings like lab rats.

What will I learn? 

  • How to embrace the journey to find meaning
  • When it’s time to quit a mediocre job that no longer inspires you
  • What questions to ask yourself to figure out what you really want to be doing, and what type of impact you want to make. And how to get paid for what you really want to be doing.
  • How to rewrite your bio to land your dream job
  • How to ensure FOMO (Fear of Missing Out) and FOBO (Fear of Better Options) don’t destroy you
  • How to turn your intimidating 6-month life plan into fun, simple, and doable weekly and daily goals
  • Several questions to ask yourself if you’re thinking about applying to law school
  • When to move back in with your parents. And when to move as far away from your parents as possible.
  • If you're currently not working, how to strike a healthy balance between funemployment and figuring out your next move. 
  • When part-time gigs or unpaid internships make sense. And when to tell an employer to (politely) fuck off if they ask you to work for free.
  • How to have breakthroughs in other aspects of your life, not related to "what you do"
  • When to take a dancing timeout and blast Robyn’s “Dancing On My Own” (ie, right now)
  • And so much more...

Pre-order the e-Book or paperback copy today. Please note: design in-progress, actual cover may look different.

Why are you the right person to write this book?

In the eight years since college, I’ve lived in five different cities on two continents, had seven different jobs, moved back home with my parents twice, and started down three different “career paths,” so I know a thing or two about making life transitions (and freaking out).
 
Leaving my job at the Peace Corps in Washington, D.C. (an incredible organization made up of people who are changing the world), was the scariest thing I ever did—but embarking on a career that makes my heart sing has changed my life and made me come alive as a person and a writer. I started my own blog, got published in Forbes, The Huffington Post, The Hairpin, and Thought Catalog, among others.
 
As academy director of The Bold Academy, I facilitate transformative experiences to empower young professionals to have quarter-life breakthroughs and realize their full potential. In my free time, I surround myself with communities of people who believe in the beauty of their dreams. I’m a mentor for the StartingBloc Institute for Social Innovation and the Dell Social Innovation Lab, which means I’ve had the opportunity to learn from numerous young entrepreneurs who are making an impact by pursuing meaningful work.
 
I went to Wesleyan University—and despite the fact that I majored in film and don’t work in the film industry, and that I spent an estimated $10,254 on an Intro to Dance class senior year—I still maintain that a liberal arts degree was worth it (although I wish it had been cheaper).

Why do you need $9,000?

While writing a book is free, actually publishing a book is rather expensive. I'm paying artists and experts at professional rates to make sure this book is the best it can be, and to ensure as many people as possible end up reading it. Contributing to this project goes directly towards my estimated production costs including: developmental editing and copy editing ($2500), cover art, book design, photography, and illustrations ($2000), book marketing and publicity ($2500), campaign video and promotion ($1000), campaign shipping and fulfillment ($500), and printing costs for the first run of the book ($500).  

Check out the great perks for contributors including the e-Book and signed paperback copies of the book, a hand-designed letterpress poster, virtual pep talks, and in-person coaching.

Why do you have a stretch goal of $12,000?

Thanks to your overwhelming support, we sold over 300 books and hit our $9,000 goal in 2 weeks! Help us sell 500 books, and receive amazing perks available exclusively to Indiegogo contributors.
Your contributions will go towards:

1) The cost of printing more books

2) A marketing campaign so the book reaches a wider audience 

3) Building an engaged community of The Quarter-Life Breakthrough readers who refuse to settle for mediocrity. An online platform so readers can connect and share their stories; what's worked for them in their search for meaningful work, and what their needs are—as well as a book tour which will feature in-person readings and discussion groups throughout the U.S.

Can you really have a "quarter-life" breakthrough at the age of 30?

Yes. I believe it’s never too late to make a change if you need to make one. I may not live to 120, but I've had breakthroughs at the age of 25, 28, and 30—and I hope to continue to have breakthroughs for the rest of my life. I don't know the exact age that the "quarter-life" breakthrough becomes the "mid-life" breakthrough, but I'll let you know when I find out—that will be part of the sequel.  

When will I get the book?

I’ve made great progress on The Quarter-Life Breakthrough so far; I have a working first draft, and recently started the second draft. The writing process, not to mention the publishing process, moves slowly, and can sometimes take just as long as finding a new job. Having said that, my goal is to be finished with the book and have it shipped to you by Christmas 2013. This date may be pushed back due to the nature of the publishing process, but my promise is that I will update contributors on my progress and the anticipated ship date.

Gratitude

I cannot express how grateful I am to you for reading these words and becoming part of this community, and to my family and friends, throughout the country and around the world, who have made this project possible through their love and support over the past 30 years—thank you for everything.

I would also like to acknowledge the incredibly talented artists and changemakers who have worked hard to make this project come to life. These people include: Caroline Kessler (editor), Kara Brodgesell (video and cover photography), Bernat Fortet (cover designer), Nick Baranowski (letterpress art and prints), Guy Fox (music), as well as Sydney Malawer (chief crowdfunding advisor), Sonia Chokshi (social media specialist), Nate Bagley (project advisor), Ben Tseitlin (project advisor), Jeremy Kauffman (project assistant) and Becca Poswolsky (my sister and life coach).

Please share this campaign on Email, Facebook, and Twitter.

Thank you for being here!

story:
Short Summary

Through the experience of sharing my children's joy of camping, we have created the ultimate camping adventure book, 28 pages, written in rhyme, with a full illustration each page. The language is both lyrical and conceptually imaginative. Here's an excerpt from the first morning to get the idea:

''While creatures roam in the light of the moon, she’s kept safe in a butterfly cocoon. There she hides until the faint lights of dawn, like tiny candles behind curtains drawn. Counting the shadows of birds on the tent, she reflects on how night was spent. There’s something quite cozy in morning light, like love reaching out through the sense of sight.''

The story follows a little girl through an adventure with a group of children who discover the mystery behind what has been stealing their pretty little things while they sleep at night. The story takes them along a trail of lost toys and into a cave where they find their own lost treasure:

“Shiny harmonica and silver flute! Now I’m sure it’s pirate loot! Olivia whispers, “It’s beautiful! but also quite unusual. The treasure wouldn’t seem peculiar if it weren't so very familiar.”

For more excerpts of the book, please email me a request at robert@zenbiotic.com

My name is Robert Duffy, the writer of Trail of Toys. Jennifer Rizzo and I collaborated on the concept a couple of years ago and as avid campers, we made sure the essence of camping oozes from every page. She has taught hundreds of children over 15 years but now we both share that experience with our own children.
We have vetted a handful of wonderful illustrators with skills in lighting effects and fantastical settings in nature. We have also contacted a self publishing company that has affordable prices on low runs with significant cost savings for volume. 

What We Need & What You Get

We hope to raise $3,500 for the following:
$1,200, Illustration cost for 28 illustrations.
$250 Professional editing consultation.
$250 Graphic designer to put the the book together.
$1,200 Self Publishing for the first 100 books, 34 pages, hardcover, full color.
$300 reward/perks and shipping cost
$300 fees

In the event of partial funding, first funds go to illustrations, then down the list above.

Send as a gift or donate to the local library.

The Impact

We're trying to combine nature and poetry in a way that is fun and educational. At the end of the book, there will be a section introducing rhyming and poetry. We hope to compel children to make their own poetry and to see the world through a different lens of conceptual thinking and imaginative images.

Risks & Challenges

The book is written! But there are still some minor hurdles. We are consulting with a childrens book editing professional to make sure the story is as taught as it can be. If revisions are necessary, we will amend them in the second edition for the second print run. We have 3 illustrators ready to work on the project right now. From their samples and resume, they are all amazing artists. The printing company is ready to print as soon as we are ready. 100 is the minimum run so if we only get partial funding, I'll fund the printing myself.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you love camping or know people with children who do, please help spread the word.
story_txt:
Short Summary
Through the experience of sharing my children's joy of camping, we have created the ultimate camping adventure book, 28 pages, written in rhyme, with a full illustration each page. The language is both lyrical and conceptually imaginative. Here's an excerpt from the first morning to get the idea:


''While creatures roam in the light of the moon, she’s
kept safe in a butterfly cocoon. There she hides until the faint lights of
dawn, like tiny candles behind curtains drawn. Counting
the shadows of birds on the tent, she reflects on how night was spent.
There’s something quite cozy in morning light, like love reaching out
through the sense of sight.''
The story follows a little girl through an adventure with a group of children who discover the mystery behind what has been stealing their pretty little things while they sleep at night. The story takes them along a trail of lost toys and into a cave where they find their own lost treasure:
“Shiny harmonica and silver flute! Now I’m sure it’s
pirate loot! Olivia whispers, “It’s beautiful! but also quite unusual. The treasure wouldn’t seem peculiar if it weren't so very familiar.”
For more excerpts of the book, please email me a request at robert@zenbiotic.com

My name is Robert Duffy, the writer of Trail of Toys. Jennifer Rizzo and I collaborated on the concept a couple of years ago and as avid campers, we made sure the essence of camping oozes from every page. She has taught hundreds of children over 15 years but now we both share that experience with our own children.
We have vetted a handful of wonderful illustrators with skills in lighting effects and fantastical settings in nature. We have also contacted a self publishing company that has affordable prices on low runs with significant cost savings for volume.    What We Need & What You Get We hope to raise $3,500 for the following:

$1,200, Illustration cost for 28 illustrations.

$250 Professional editing consultation.


$250 Graphic designer to put the the book together.


$1,200 Self Publishing for the first 100 books, 34 pages, hardcover, full color.
$300 reward/perks and shipping cost
$300 fees
In the event of partial funding, first funds go to illustrations, then down the list above.
Send as a gift or donate to the local library.
    The Impact We're trying to combine nature and poetry in a way that is fun and educational. At the end of the book, there will be a section introducing rhyming and poetry. We hope to compel children to make their own poetry and to see the world through a different lens of conceptual thinking and imaginative images.
    Risks & Challenges  The book is written! But there are still some minor hurdles. We are consulting with a childrens book editing professional to make sure the story is as taught as it can be. If revisions are necessary, we will amend them in the second edition for the second print run. We have 3 illustrators ready to work on the project right now. From their samples and resume, they are all amazing artists. The printing company is ready to print as soon as we are ready. 100 is the minimum run so if we only get partial funding, I'll fund the printing myself.   Other Ways You Can Help If you love camping or know people with children who do, please help spread the word.

story:
Eureka Results is a field guide for creative entrepreneurs who have amazing ideas but are struggling with shiny object syndrome or discouragement as they build their businesses. It’s about why systems are so powerful, how they work, and how anyone can wield them as a tool to protect what matters and to get things done.

My name is Ashlee Berghoff and I am the author of Eureka Results: How Entrepreneurs Can Turn Their Best Ideas Into Reality. I wrote this book because I believe that systems are one of the most underestimated but powerful tools in our arsenal as entrepreneurs. Too many of us are searching for THE answer - the one magic bullet that will make everything fall into place. In reality, taking action on a big vision is a marathon...and systems are your shoes and water bottle to help you make it to the finish line.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover practical tools and a powerful mindset you can use to transform your business using systems, especially if systems don’t come easily to you. In this book, I hope to instill in you the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for systems. Ultimately, I want you to see this book as a tool to help you experience focus, momentum, and the joy of seeing your vision come to life.

In this book, you'll learn about the main types of systems, the mindset of a powerful implementer, and the five core systems every business owner needs. You'll hear insights such as...

  • How to embrace iterative problem solving in your business

  • How to use systems to go from an 80-hour work week to a 20-hour work week

  • How simple questions can help you build a business around the lifestyle that is most meaningful to you

You will love this book if you know you should build some structure into your business but aren’t sure how, struggle to finish the projects you start, or feel like other entrepreneurs are magically better at all of this than you are.

Eureka Results is a nonfiction book that speaks to entrepreneurs and small business owners who want to look at creativity and systems in a new way.

 

The Book - Eureka Results

The book is written in 3 parts.

Part 1 contains the introduction and chapters 1-6. In this section, I'll show you how lightbulb moments and determination aren't enough to help you go the distance as an entrepreneur. You also need to know how to wield one of the most powerful and underestimated forces in your business - your systems. I'll explain how you're using systems constantly, even if you can't see them, and how understanding your systems is a big step towards turning your best ideas into reality.

Part 2 contains chapters 7-10. In this section, I'll show you how the journey from eureka moment (those lightbulb moments we all love so much) to eureka results (seeing our vision actually come to life) is a marathon, not a sprint. Before we can use systems effectively to get all the way to the finish line, we need to set fair expectations for ourselves, embrace living in the messy middle, and cultivate an ongoing mindset of experimentation.

Part 3 contains chapters 11-15 and the conclusion. This section is a field guide and will walk you through a step-by-step process of creating five core systems in your business. These core systems will help you focus on what matters, eliminate shiny object syndrome and decision fatigue, help you see the progress you're making, and become the confident leader of a rock star team. 

 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in April, 2021.
  • The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, e-book formats).
  • The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this Spring.

 

When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and e-book. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition and an audiobook.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.
  • You will receive early access to the Introduction and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review them and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
  • And much more!
 

About the Author

Ashlee Berghoff is the founder and CEO of A Squared Online. Her company helps solo entrepreneurs become confident leaders with rock star virtual assistants so that they can double their capacity without working more hours.

Ashlee was compelled to write Eureka Results after watching too many brilliant, creative entrepreneurs get tripped up by shiny object syndrome and become discouraged when their most exciting ideas end up half-finished and sitting on the back burner. She knows that systems are a powerful tool to get things done, and she is passionate about helping the world's creators confidently leverage their own systems in a way that works for them. 

Ashlee was Marie Kondo-ing her stuff before Marie Kondo was cool. She loves country music, international travel, mac n' cheese, deep conversations, boxing gloves, and tattoos.

Ashlee lives with her amazing husband, precocious toddler, and Belgian Malinois in a cozy house in Aurora, CO. 

For more information, you can connect with Ashlee at ashlee@asquaredonline.com or on LinkedIn or Facebook.

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute directly (or even if you can), there are three other ways that you can support me:

  • Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #EurekaResults and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so that we can help amplify your efforts.
  • You can easily share my pre-sale campaign via Indiegogo at the top of the page.
  • Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Ashlee

story:
The Chipmunk needs your help!

As you may know, The Lincoln Squirrel news website recently launched the Lincoln Chipmunk, a companion site to the Squirrel and the web-based successor to the printed Lincoln Review. The Chipmunk is an online periodical showcasing fiction, artwork, poetry, photography and other creative work by and for Lincoln residents. This project would not have been possible without months of work by our software developer to design a customized Lincoln Chipmunk website and then link it with the Squirrel's database of subscribers and customized software. The final cost was about $8,000, so I’m asking for your help in defraying $5,000 of this cost.

This fundraising campaign will run for 30 days. If donations exceed the $5,000 goal during that time, any further donations will be applied to the rest of the cost of creating the Chipmunk and then (if more than $8,000 is donated) towards future expenses, including technical troubleshooting and keeping the software current.

The Lincoln Squirrel/Chipmunk is not an incorporated nonprofit so I’m afraid I can’t offer you a tax deduction — but there are other perks. You’ll get a free gift of Lincoln Squirrel/Lincoln Chipmunk merchandise to enjoy and stimulate conversation among friends and family:

 

  • Seedling level (bronze) — Get a magnet, sticker, or a set of three postcards when you donate at least $50.
  • Acorn level (silver) — Receive a cotton tote bag, coffee mug, face mask, or a set of four coasters when you donate at least $75.
  • Pumpkin level (gold) — Choose from a T-shirt, metal travel mug, or drawstring bag when you donate at least $100.

 

Click here to see all the swag for sale. We have clothing, drinkware and other fun stuff with two logo options: the Lincoln Squirrel alone, or both Chipmunk and Squirrel.

I was pleased and honored when longtime Lincolnite Betty Smith and her friends asked me to take over the Lincoln Review and bring it to a wider audience, and I appreciate any assistance in maintaining both the Chipmunk and the Squirrel as valuable community resources. Please spread the word among friends, family and neighbors in Lincoln and elsewhere by sharing links to this fundraiser, the Chipmunk, or individual submissions. Many thanks, and happy holidays!

story:
Story of My Book

Right the Reset is a story about a trio of new friends who go on a mission to protect their way of life when higher powers threaten to destroy everything they've ever worked for. On a continent recovering from twenty years of plague, political upheaval, and lost individualism, their task grows from something as small as passing along a message to something as large as reviving the broken human spirit. Their target: the education system.

My name is Ania Luckiewicz and I am the author of Right the Reset. I wrote this book because I wanted to talk about the concept of mastery learning versus learning for test scores, in a way that is fun and engaging. As it stands, students are getting left behind and disassociating from academia when they are not given enough support to push through a tough lesson. Why do we normalize going through school with C's and D's? Why even B's? How can you build on top of an unstable foundation? I believe that today's society has the technology and the tools to totally reimagine the education system, but it needs a push to pursue something so new.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover that a change in how we learn is not only necessary, but realistic. I want you to see this book as an opportunity to engage with ideas of education reform, tackle questions of human relevance and vulnerability, and escape into a thrilling fiction adventure that will leave you wanting more.

The year is 2048. Katie Luczynski, Merritt Campbell-Gibbs, and Raegen Cregar are students at Ivory College, a growing institution off the coast of the notorious American Partition. Though not initially the best of friends, these three girls find themselves entangled in a plot to shut down their school and disestablish their island as an independent power. Seemingly unprepared for the task, they're asked to travel to the Partition, face down corrupt leaders, and prove a man's innocence to an alien people wracked with grief and anger. Challenged by the aftereffects of the First Plague, the Superbugs, and the Anthroviroid, the protagonists have to work together to show the world a path to a more fulfilling life. But when secret identities threaten to break the bonds holding them together, can Katie, Merritt, and Raegen trust each other enough to thwart an enemy bigger than anything they had imagined? Can reformed education really be the key to opposing a deadly, foreign Partition?

You will love this book if you enjoy escaping into dystopian and sci-fi narratives. This novel is meant to grab and keep your attention, while making you sit back on your haunches and think a little. Whether you excelled in school or slaved through that part of your life, I think we can all agree that areas exist that we should handle better. If you like authors like Dan Brown, Ruta Sepetys, or Max Brooks, this book will be the next best thing to add to your shelf.

Ultimately, I hope that Right the Reset inspires reflection and fruitful dialogue, pressing into engaging questions like:
  • What did I gain from my own education?
  • Where are we going as a society?
  • How can we do better?

 

I look forward to exploring these questions and beyond with my readers. In times where we are continually pressed for time and overwhelmed by constant media, I believe discussing pressing current issues through a popular fiction storyline is one of the best methods of conveying a message. With Right the Reset, I hope that the plight of the characters generate strong feelings of love, friendship, and inspiration to change us all for the better.

 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:
  • The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in August, 2021.
  • The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this summer.

 

When I pre-sell 120 paperback copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover and an audiobook.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.
  • You will receive early access to the Author’s Note and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
  • And much more!
 

About the Author

Since mid-2020, Ania Luckiewicz has identified as a young woman juggling three jobs, medical school applications, and a hopeful career in writing. She uncovered a passion for working with children while ski instructing in Colorado and an interest in bettering education while employed as a STEM lab instructor at multiple middle schools in her locality. Ania hopes to continue specializing in children's welfare, be it in pediatric medicine or wherever life takes her next.

In her free time, Ania adores skiing, reading, playing the piano, and exploring the outdoors. She will always try to make time for her friends and family and is incapable of turning down any spontaneous adventure. If ever missing in action, she can most likely be found sipping hot tea and typing away furiously on her mountain-decorated laptop in the corner of the cutest neighborhood cafe.

For more information, you can connect with Ania Luckiewicz at aluckiew@gmail.com and on Instagram @onions_onpaper.

 

International Preorders

For international preorders, please send me a private message.
 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.
 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:
  • Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #RighttheReset and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts.
  • You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page.
  • Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

 

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Ania Luckiewicz
