story:
So called Traitors is a story about three sisters who live secretly in a world where their tribe is hunted and killed or enslaved. They must settle their differences and come together to escape and find freedom. Sirien, Amalie and Davina were born to a common farmer and his wife, the daughter of the head Elder of the Tribe Nasinreth. Born with blood blessings, the blessed hold power to heal, see the future, have natural insight for politics and leadership or have strength and stamina in skills of fighting and defense. The sisters keep their blessings secret, hidden not only from the world, but from each other in order to survive the Kings deadly rule until the day they can no longer hide and must flee the Capital City into exile.

My name is Lou Hobbs, and I am the author of So Called Traitors. I wrote this book because I wanted to prove that it is possible to achieve your goals and exceed all expectations, no matter the circumstances or beliefs others have of you.

I want you to see this book as an opportunity to see subjects from multiple perspectives, escape reality, travel through time, and join my character on an adventure to find their true selves and prospective futures.


So Called Traitors speaks to young adults and readers of all ages who are beginning the journey of discovering who they are and grappling with life events, such as loss and love.

Ultimately, I hope that So Called Traitors inspires reflection and fruitful dialogue, pressing into engaging questions like:

How can one person’s choices and perspectives look so different from other’s?

How does loss affect thought processes and outlooks on life?

I look forward to exploring these questions and beyond with my readers, as I believe discussing these topics will change us all for the better.

So Called Traitors is set in Omideon, the second dominating country in the western continent. After years of hostility with countries all over the world, the King seeks new alliances and trade routes to fund his indefinite search for the tribal people of the Nasinreth. Magic is outlawed and has been for over twenty year, and those to be found to posses it is sentenced to death.

The Nasinreth were once highly valuable to the King and his kingdom. Known as a gentle people, they served the crown wholeheartedly. It all came to an end however when the prophecy by the Kings own Visionary came to light. “The first heir will be the downfall of the kingdom, the second heir will unite the people and the third will bring glory.” After years of his fathers attempts to replace him, Agnai grew cold to the Nasinreth, and once crowned vowed to destroy them.

Aldhorran is the Capital city of Omideon where the three sisters reside. Sirien, the eldest has hidden her blessing from the world and her own sisters most her life. Prophesied by her great grandfather, she is the final visionary of her people and therefore valuable. Amalie posses both skill in combat and a wisdom beyond her years, a rare combination of gifts. Davina, the youngest daughter is known as the angel of death to herself and Amalie. Her birth ended her mothers life, and the irony is she is a healer. The girls face trial after trial in their lives, forcing them to choose morality or vengeance.

To the North lies Uutithea, the second largest country in the world. They boast in their architecture and educational advancement. Between Omideon and Uutithea lies Divanthra, also known as “the divide”. Its sole purpose is to keep peace between the two countries and offer safety to any Nasinreth who escape to the Ancient Lands. Even though it stretches along Omideons coastal border, the lands cannot be touched without inciting war.

The Eastern continent holds the largest kingdom, Netheis to which Omideon has created a treaty through marriage between children. The final kingdom, once known as Eporiae is now split in two. Drumidia betrayed Romathe by ending the marriage alliance between the two head clans. When war broke out, hundreds of Romathans fled, creating small settlements around the world, including in Omideon. The Aulik of Romathe are largely left alone due to their rough manner, which they take to their advantage. They thrive on the coast in Western Omideon, waiting for the day to strike and avenge their people against a King who stole their bride.

You will love this book if you enjoy magic, exploring a new world, crazy cultures and traditions and experiencing the most sacred Oath taken by the Romathan Clan Aulik: The Blood Oath.


 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in August 2021.

The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)

The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).

The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.

The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this fall.


When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover and an audiobook.


I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.

Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.

You will receive early access to the Author’s Note and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.

You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover.

You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.

And much more!

 

About the Author


Lou Hobbs has an unwavering passion for the arts and can find the beauty in all subject matters. When it comes to her writing, she remains hardworking, determined, and loyal to the stories that need to be told. Besides her career as an author, she puts God and her family at the forefront of her life, especially her two young ones, whom she finds daily inspiration from to keep pressing forward.

Lou believes that writing is simply an extension of one’s mind, allowing emotions to form into visual aspects, places, and beings. Her passion for history shows in her work as she strives to touch on difficult ideas of persecution, genocide, and the rot in the minds of those who choose to follow the darkest path.

When Lou isn't working on her next upcoming novel, you can find her outside enjoying the different seasons, especially Spring and Fall. In the warmer weather, she loves spending time with her family on the lake, either paddle boarding, fishing, or swimming. To complete her family, she has two orange cats and a red sable husky and also enjoys cooking, partaking in card and board games, and playing pool on her billiard table.

For more information, you can connect with Lou on Facebook or Instagram: louhobbs_writes.
 

International Preorders

For international preorders, please send me a private message.
 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.
 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #SoCalledTraitors21 and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page.

Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Lou Hobbs

story:
Story of My Book

How Games Get Made: The Stories of the People Who Make and Play the Games We Love

This book follows the lives of many types of individuals in the gaming industry— from CEOs and artists, to the programmers and streamers— in order to explore how the game development industry functions. It features interviews with several well-known game development industry veterans, such as Feargus Urquhart and David Cage.

My name is Emma Schaale and I am the author of How Games Get Made. I wrote this book because I’m a game development student myself, and I’ve often worried about job propsects in the future— do I want to pursue working at a large company, or do I want to start my own company? I wanted help in answering these questions, and who better to ask than the successful who made those same decisions themselves?

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will also discover useful advice and context about decisions that other game developers made when fleshing out their career path. I hope to instill the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for game development in you! I want you to see this book as inspiration to help you get into the industry, or learn more about the decisions and sacrifices that people make to work in it.

In this book, you'll learn about business decisions and personal sacrifice:
  • How Sean Baptiste, Influencer Manager at Bethesda, overcame a life-threatening medical diagnosis right out of theater college to become somebody who works with the Internet’s most famous personalities to advertise Bethesda’s games.
  • How David Cage, CEO of Quantic Dream, went from sleeping under his own desk and paying a handful of friends out of his own pocket to becoming the CEO of a 200-person game studio.
  • How Feargus Urquhart, CEO of Obsidian Entertainment, went from dropping out of a bio-engineering degree a semester before completion to becoming the father of the beloved Fallout (1997-) series.
You will love this book if you love games and want to know more about how they’re made, the sacrifices that people make to work in this industry, and what motivates people to work in it.

How Games Get Made is a nonfiction book that speaks to both (soon-to-be) game developers, as well as lovers of gaming who are interested in one of the most successful industries of the modern era.

 

 

The Book: How Games Get Made


The book is written in 4 parts...

Part 1 orients the reader with an introduction, and then promptly delves into several stories following different types of game developers. From this section, the reader will learn much about the business decisions people made (or lack thereof) to be successful and personal sacrifices made.

Part 2 focuses more on a variety of individuals in the game industry— from professors, to toy makers, to storytellers. In this section, you will learn that the game development industry is not just about programmers or business owners; it’s very much a collaborative effort between artists, engineers, storytellers, engineers, marketers, and educators, alongside the two aforementioned categories.

Part 3 focuses purely on CEOs, and how they each landed their respective positions. It is to be expected that a CEO of a company will make significant personal sacrifices in order to maintain their own company, but just what kind of sacrifices are those? What personality traits and behaviors do they exhibit, and how might we reflect those traits ourselves?

Part 4 focuses on perhaps the most crucial part of the equation: how games get sold. Aside from the largest companies, video games often fail in traditional advertising mediums such as television and even online advertisements. However, online streaming, like through Twitch and YouTube, can provide informal yet highly successful advertisements to dedicated audiences of streamers.

 

 

What I Need & What You'll Get


This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:
 
  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in the second half of 2020.
  • The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)
  • The Copyediting for My Book - to make help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this Winter 2020.
When I pre-sell 100 copies of my book, I will publish. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition of my book. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish an audiobook edition.


I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:
You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.
  • A Personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book
  • Your Name will appear in a Special, Acknowledgements Section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)
  • Early access to the Introduction of my Book and my entire manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback
  • The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover
  • I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share experience the experiences of writing my book
  • And more...

 

About the Author


Emma Schaale is a rising senior student of game development at the University of Rochester in Rochester, New York. She plans to work on the design or marketing of a game, or develop a game in a small studio in her future. She is currently working at Studio 374 with two other students on a video game set to release Summer 2021— the third game she has worked on so far.

Emma wrote this book because of her passion for video games since a young age. Her curiosity for the industry drove her to eventually pursue a focus on game development in college, as well as the writing of this book.

Emma enjoys weightlifting and practicing MMA, playing with her cat, and of course, playing video games (particularly story-driven games).

For more information you can connect with Emma at eschaale@u.rochester.edu, as well as Twitter (@itsemmalog) and LinkedIn (/eschaale).

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:
  • Please Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #hggmbook and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.
  • You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page
  • Please share my book to 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Emma Schaale

story:
Blurb for Book 3

When disease ravages Earth’s cacao plantations, Bo Benitez returns home to help with the media spin to hide that chocolate is in danger of being lost forever.  HGB has come up with a new product – one which doesn’t appease the cocoa-addicted murderous, shark-toothed aliens threatening to invade the planet.  Someone has to smooth things out.  Just when Bo starts to make headway, someone tries to kidnap her.  While trying to avoid more would-be-kidnappers, Bo finds out that HGB is developing a cure for withdrawal from the Invincible Heart.  Will she let her need to be physically whole again tie her to HGB and its enigmatic CEO? When she gets a key piece of evidence that would unravel secrets from three different planets, she has tough choices to make about the future of her world and its place in the galaxy.

Short Summary

This campaign  is for the publication of Book 3 in the Chocoverse series.  Though I definitely have more stories to tell in the 'verse, this book wraps up the invasion story plot introduced in the first book, and lets you see where Bo winds up in relation to her world.  The first two books have gained a small but passionate following (Chestla, in particular has her own fans, and you should have seen the reaction when I threatened to kill off another secondary character in Book 2).  Mi amigos, you deserve an ending to the trilogy.  If you're currently at the cliff hanger at the end of Pure Chocolate -- I feel you.  You trusted me.  I wouldn't end with that.

I personally believe this series is important because it shows a Latina protag (loosely based on a conglomeration of several of my close friends) in the lead role in a science fiction series.  It is a homage to the cheesiness of the telenovela tradition, complete with all the heart and optimism that implies.  There's a lot in the series  about overcoming prejudice and finding family inside blended cultures and backgrounds.  The messages of love, mercy, and hope run through all three books, summed up by Tawny's media campaign centered around the slogan Mercy Is a Gift.  

And yes, mercy is a gift.  Pero . . . money is a gift, too.  I have a hard time asking for this, but I need help if I'm going to make this book available to readers.  I've already written Fake Chocolate.  What I need from you guys is support for professional quality cover art, a thorough edit (because, seriously, it's nearly impossible to catch all the places where Tyson can't say TH all by myself), and all of the production stages that get a book into the hands of readers.  There's a lot that goes into this.  The font with the swooping c-s alone is going to cost roughly $200.

A lot of you visiting this probably know me.  But if you don't, here's my bio:  Amber Royer writes the CHOCOVERSE comic telenovela-style foodie-inspired space opera series.  She is also co-author of the cookbook There are Herbs in My Chocolate, which combines culinary herbs and chocolate in over 60 sweet and savory recipes. She also had a long-running column for Dave’s Garden, where she covered gardening and crafting. She blogs about creative writing techniques and all things chocolate-related at www.amberroyer.com.  She also teaches creative writing in North Texas for both UT Arlington Continuing Education and Writing Workshops Dallas.  If you are very nice to her, she might make you cupcakes.

If you are new to the Chocoverse, bienveindo!  Here are the book trailers for the first two books to help get you up to speed.

 

 

What We Need & What You Get

In this series, there is something for everyone.  You get:

  • Alien dragons
  • An adorable corgi
  • Laser monkey robots
  • Wombat cyborgs
  • Shark monsters that eat people

Here's the expenses I need to cover:

  • Cover art to match the AWESOME art I have in place for Books 1 and 2
  • Professional editing
  • Book trailer to match the AMAZING ones X27 Films and Media did for Book 1 and 2
  • Production and shipping of the print copies of the book (including ISBN)

 

The Impact

A number of people have asked me how I can write about chocolate in the future when the future of chocolate as an actual botanical plant is in question.  The more people are interested in chocolate, the more options there will be.  My husband and I have been experimenting with growing cacao indoors as office plants.  We created a series of videos documenting The Office Cacao Project.  Here's the first one.

 

Doing the first two books has allowed me to partner with www.DallasChocolate.org, and to learn about initiatives craft chocolate makers are working on to improve transparency in the small-scale production supply chain -- and also transparency in production techniques.   (We've actually gotten to take hands on classes in chocolate making from makers at companies including Fresco Chocolate, Five Mile Chocolate and Potomac Chocolate). In a small attempt to give back, I have started interviewing chocolate makers and chocolatiers on my blog www.amberroyer.com. 

There is so much generosity in the craft chocolate community.  People have allowed me to tour their factories (including one in Monterrey Mexico and one in small-town Hico, Texas) and plantations (in the Domincan Republic) and have offered their expertise in making sure I get what I am writing about chocolate correct. 

This is an expansive 'verse. I have a short story set in the Chocoverse coming out soon in Issue 5 of Amazing Stories.

https://amazingstories.com/

 

Free Chocolate garnered a number of positive reviews, including this one from Publisher's Weekly:

“In writing teacher Royer’s clever debut, humans have turned Earth into a fear-filled bunker after learning about the existence of aliens. Earth’s sole valuable commodity on the interplanetary market is chocolate, and some humans will do anything to preserve its value. Bodacious “Bo” Benitez wants to disrupt the system by smuggling cacao plants offworld, but doing so brings her face-to-face with her alien boyfriend’s hidden past, the man who murdered her chocolate-smuggling father, and the possibility of global war. The story is languidly paced and occasionally feels too drawn out, but Royer keeps things interesting by portraying how one tiny encounter can quickly spiral out of control in an interconnected galaxy. The aliens aren’t out to conquer Earth, just the markets, and they ruthlessly wield economics and niceties instead of lasers, to darkly comic and sometimes deadly serious effect. Trade-related science fiction is a small but solid niche, and Royer’s work fills it nicely. Agent: Jennie Goloboy, Donald Maass Literary. (June)" — Publisher’s Weekly

The Barnes and Noble SFF Blog broke down the whole of Book 1 in an extensive post.  Here are a few paragraphs:

Bo Benitez (“Bo” being short for Bodacious) has chocolate in her blood, almost literally: her father died in a (suspicious) fire at a cacao plantation, and her mother is a superstar celebrity chef working with the sponsorship of HGB. Bo herself is a culinary student being groomed by the coffee giant as a spokesmodel. She’s not much interested in that path, as it turns out, and it doesn’t take much to convince her that the chocolate monopoly is as bad for Earth as it is for the galactic community. To some extent, she falls into activism, egged on by her alien boyfriend, but she quickly proves (almost) as capable of getting into trouble as of getting out of it as she attempts to free the bean.

In spite of her connections at the coffee company, nothing goes according to plan. Which is, naturally, part of the fun. And for a book that begins with a history lesson about coffee, fun is clearly the reason to read this deliciously rich chunk of space opera. Bo’s schemes put her up against deadly robot monkeys, on a chase through an alien spaceport, and onto a ship full of aliens best known for eating stowaways. The aliens, in general, are imaginative (they generally relate to Earth animals, even though the various alien species find it tacky when humans point it out): Bo’s boyfriend is a Krom, a species of manipulative traders whose eyes change colors when they lie; her best friend is a cat-like creature who makes humans shudder. An honorable reptilian cop joins the hunt for Bo and her illicit beans.

Royer’s language is a key draw. Her human characters generally hail from South America, with English serving as a core tongue, but liberally sprinkled with Spanish and bits of Portuguese. That particular flavor of bi-/tri-lingual blending isn’t uncommon in the world today, but Free Chocolate suggests a continued evolution and formalization that makes perfect sense. -- https://www.barnesandnoble.com/blog/sci-fi-fant...

 

Risks & Challenges

The manuscript for the book has been completely drafted and is in the editing stage.  The challenge will be in getting the marketing in place to make the project a success with readers.

  • The first two books had traditional publishing's marketing power behind them.  This will help readers recognize the series.
  • I have taken several classes related to social media marketing, and scheduled appearances promoting the first two books across the country.  I already have a launch event for book 3 scheduled locally in partnership with Interabang Books and a chocolatier associated with DallasChocolate.org -- and a followup event at Indi Chocolate in Seattle.
  • I am anticipating interviews on blogs and podcasts, and will actively work to set more up.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute dinero, there are still ways you can contribute to the book's success:

  • Follow me on social media, especially my Instagram, @amberroyerauthor
  • Sign up for my newsletter (it is aimed at writers, but there is a section for my upcoming appearances -- and includes the occasional recipe) on the Saturday Night Write page at http://amberroyer.com/saturday-night-write/ .
  • Review the first two books, especially on Amazon.
  • Contact me for an advance copy of the e-book so that you can review Fake Chocolate as soon as it comes out.
  • Host me on your blog or podcast, or have me out in person to speak to your book club or writer's group.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools to let people know about the Book 3 Campaign

Muchas gracias por todo, amigos!  You guys are the best!

story:
I’ve just completed an intensive summer study of herbalism. Initially familiar with a few herbs, I now know over 150 herbs well enough to use. My next step is an apprenticeship which leads to certification, practice, and income. The culmination is writing, illustrating, and publishing my manual, Accessible Herbaria.

Accessible Herbaria is both a resource for allies and for any individual to support their own health. While written through the lens of herbal medicine, the tools provided are for anyone to examine their relationship with marginalized people. Further, Accessible Herbaria presents multiple approaches toward supporting health, complimentary to any current health care management.

For the ally, Accessible Herbaria is a resource for better consideration of disabled, neurodivergent, black/brown indigenous people of color (BIPOC), fat, chronically ill, LGBTQI & gender-nonconforming people. While whether to support diverse clients, students, colleagues, and friends is typically not a question, doing so without projecting personal bias is a greater challenge than simple intention.

Not only are you ensuring my course, and with it earning my deepest gratitude, but I am excited to offer perks in return. If you are new to this site, I made a note in the FAQ about this, and the site provides more info in the FAQ section.

I deeply appreciate your time and your consideration as I continue to my next right thing.

 

My goal is admittedly high, with the figure applying over several years. Here’s a breakdown of essential steps, because every bit helps and I will work hard to make up the difference:

First benchmark- almost funded!!!, $2,000: With my personal inquiry already completed, I will engage in an apprenticeship in spring and summer of 2019, gaining over 250 hours of study. I’ll learn every aspect of herbalism, from an expert registered herbalist. This work directly applies to my certification as a registered herbalist and lays the foundation for a lifetime of learning. As part of the final project of my apprenticeship, I will begin work on my book, and complete it directly following. 

Research of scholarly articles for Accessible Herbaria requires access to multiple high-quality sources for each topic. Yearly subscriptions to journals can be up to $300/year, and individual articles cost up to $35 each. Thorough research will require at least $5,000, but possibly much more. I’ll use these funds from fall 2019, through summer 2020. I have access to articles now, but it’s limited.

Professional Illustration & Photography normally costs about $250 per illustration, digital photography is at least $75 per shot. I will do this work myself, so the $7,000 will stay in-house. This funding, I’ll be able to save, but will use my time and resources from spring 2019 to summer 2020.

Layout & Editing another one I will do myself, about $1,000, starting summer 2020.

A reserve of at least $5,000: to provide seeds and supplies to readers who might not have access to high-quality seed stock, and to provide the print edition of the book on a sliding scale, so it is available for all. This comes into play after the book is out, and will go on indefinitely. I’ll likely post another fund to get this really set up.

My herbal study, $2,000: a known, but vastly under-used, genus that aids hyperglycemia, liver health, has antioxidant properties & more. Once this survey is complete, it will be of great use to far more people. I hope you will say that you helped make it so. I’ll start work on this in fall of 2019, and expect I will complete it, along with the other big projects, in 2020.

The rest of the fund I expect to spread out over several years-I’ve only ever lived on a little, and can make it stretch-whatever is shared allows me to write, particularly during daylight hours, and not work late into the night once my kid is in bed. 

To claim an inclusive practice in whatever sphere we engage ourselves, we require a new set of tools—to better address assumptions and prejudices, both within our larger community and ourselves. This project aims to do some of the work so that when minorities and marginalized people speak, practitioners may listen. Accessible Herbaria will convey the foundations of intersectionality and allyship, through dialogue, and promoting primary sources. From understanding new phrases and definitions, to appreciating deeper issues being faced by minorities and marginalized people—by taking charge of our own awareness, we may acknowledge these multi-faceted concerns, and support all members of our communities.

Some topics for allies include the emotional labor of self-advocacy, intersectionality, non-binary gender identities, trauma-informed care, body positivity, honoring traditional ecological knowledge (TEK) & supporting the empowerment of BIPOC in community-specific medicine.

Who else will I write this book for? For transgender & non-binary folks, who want to support the needs of their own bodies, but can’t find the information. This will be one of the first print resources!

For gestational parents, people who experience premenstrual symptoms, and for people going through the menopause transition—not all of whom are women. In US culture, we expect postpartum, and menopause to create emotional and physical isolation and disturbance, while they are also discussed with shame and misunderstanding, if at all. Juxtaposed with other cultures, birthing parents and people with menopause find deep support and these significant disorders are uncommon.

For folks living in cities, and those with limited access to green or growing space, and for folks who can’t access those spaces. This will be a source for obtaining what they need, reclaiming what is out of reach, and validation of the unseen barriers present every day.

For anyone who didn‘t realize that there are members of their community who aren’t able to get to the woods, or to a lush city park. For anyone who has always grown a garden, or has purchased whatever they needed—here is an opportunity for insight and building bridges. 

Overall, a seeker of holistic health may appreciate the surface, or go deep to the core of the book. Herbal medicine seeks to support the whole individual, just as western medicine addresses only symptoms. Holistic remedies support the individual, rather than forcing reactions or quashing a symptom in the body.  The structure of Accessible Herbaria allows anyone to explore and implement the many facets of health—emotion, nutrition, remedies—and discover how these things can work in harmony with each other, in the timeframe that works best for them. I base this on a saying in herbal medicine (or at least Matthew Wood!), that if an herbal remedy works, try using a similar but a gentler one, and if that works, try using something yet gentler, instead.

I undertake this work as community services and feel deeply called to do so. Herbalism is my passion as is the illustration and photography of my book. More so, while most mainstream herbal texts are written by and for white people, usually of some financial privilege, my intended audience is far more diverse.

Every perk featured is connected to the project, and to my heart, from prints of herb illustrations and photos I’ve produced, to personal garden consultations, tea blends crafted just for you, and even the commission of a painting. I work most with landscapes, still-life, and barn portraiture, and I’m always pushing out of my comfort zone. I look forward to collaborating with you!

Risks & Challenges

My chosen field requires an extensive education, and I know I will achieve this goal. Prior to realizing that I must pursue this work, I earned a degree in mathematics, with significant study in studio art, English language and literature, and publishing of small press and poetry.

I also successfully competed in a widely known small business startup and undertook several courses in small-business management based in agriculture. My analytical training, enriched with my life and academic experience, led directly to this pivotal project. Once certified and published, I have the small-business experience necessary to translate my work into something not only deeply fulfilling but also financially gainful. My target amount is not small, but it’s enough to be able take the time needed to research and write a book! 

How You Can Help

If you are able, please help to found my future. More importantly, please share this widely within your personal networks. Thank you for your time and meaningful contribution!

image description: a green elevated train track, backlit by sun

 

image description: a small burdock leaf over a sprig of goldenrod, both on a brown leather book, with green grass through a window in the background

    image description: a red onion, with skin torn down several layers, and the center beginning to emerge

    image description: sunlight coming from the left through windows that are out of the shot, onto broad wood plank floors

    image description: live and blooming purple New England asters, with yellow centers, and a honey bee, laden with pollen, collecting its food

    image description: three back-lit jars, full of honey as well as, rose-hips, hawthorn, and elderberries, respectively. 

     

    image description: a white person, smiling, wearing glasses, a yellow shirt and blue shorts, standing in knee-deep water, holding the edge of a canoe that is also in the water

         My path—a shining example of how so little of life is a straight line—led me from a small town in Oregon, to Seattle’s indie art and music scenes, then North-Central Mexico, back to Oregon (can’t say no to grandparents, but don't tell them I basically hitchhiked), and ultimately rural New England. Such is the way, it seems. Through those times and spaces, both bright and very dark, I built community, deepened passions, earned a degree, and lately, started a family. Herbalism—once a passionate, but latent interest—is now my focus, allowing me to be my best self.

    Self-Identity: she/her pronouns, pwd, enby femme, white.

I’ll use these funds from fall 2019, through summer 2020. I have access to articles now, but it’s limited.Professional Illustration & Photography normally costs about $250 per illustration, digital photography is at least $75 per shot. I will do this work myself, so the $7,000 will stay in-house. This funding, I’ll be able to save, but will use my time and resources from spring 2019 to summer 2020.Layout & Editing another one I will do myself, about $1,000, starting summer 2020.A reserve of at least $5,000: to provide seeds and supplies to readers who might not have access to high-quality seed stock, and to provide the print edition of the book on a sliding scale, so it is available for all. This comes into play after the book is out, and will go on indefinitely. I’ll likely post another fund to get this really set up.My herbal study, $2,000: a known, but vastly under-used, genus that aids hyperglycemia, liver health, has antioxidant properties & more. Once this survey is complete, it will be of great use to far more people. I hope you will say that you helped make it so. I’ll start work on this in fall of 2019, and expect I will complete it, along with the other big projects, in 2020.The rest of the fund I expect to spread out over several years-I’ve only ever lived on a little, and can make it stretch-whatever is shared allows me to write, particularly during daylight hours, and not work late into the night once my kid is in bed. To claim an inclusive practice in whatever sphere we engage ourselves, we require a new set of tools—to better address assumptions and prejudices, both within our larger community and ourselves. This project aims to do some of the work so that when minorities and marginalized people speak, practitioners may listen. Accessible Herbaria will convey the foundations of intersectionality and allyship, through dialogue, and promoting primary sources. From understanding new phrases and definitions, to appreciating deeper issues being faced by minorities and marginalized people—by taking charge of our own awareness, we may acknowledge these multi-faceted concerns, and support all members of our communities.Some topics for allies include the emotional labor of self-advocacy, intersectionality, non-binary gender identities, trauma-informed care, body positivity, honoring traditional ecological knowledge (TEK) & supporting the empowerment of BIPOC in community-specific medicine.Who else will I write this book for? For transgender & non-binary folks, who want to support the needs of their own bodies, but can’t find the information. This will be one of the first print resources!For gestational parents, people who experience premenstrual symptoms, and for people going through the menopause transition—not all of whom are women. In US culture, we expect postpartum, and menopause to create emotional and physical isolation and disturbance, while they are also discussed with shame and misunderstanding, if at all. Juxtaposed with other cultures, birthing parents and people with menopause find deep support and these significant disorders are uncommon.For folks living in cities, and those with limited access to green or growing space, and for folks who can’t access those spaces. This will be a source for obtaining what they need, reclaiming what is out of reach, and validation of the unseen barriers present every day.For anyone who didn‘t realize that there are members of their community who aren’t able to get to the woods, or to a lush city park. For anyone who has always grown a garden, or has purchased whatever they needed—here is an opportunity for insight and building bridges. Overall, a seeker of holistic health may appreciate the surface, or go deep to the core of the book. Herbal medicine seeks to support the whole individual, just as western medicine addresses only symptoms. Holistic remedies support the individual, rather than forcing reactions or quashing a symptom in the body.  The structure of Accessible Herbaria allows anyone to explore and implement the many facets of health—emotion, nutrition, remedies—and discover how these things can work in harmony with each other, in the timeframe that works best for them. I base this on a saying in herbal medicine (or at least Matthew Wood!), that if an herbal remedy works, try using a similar but a gentler one, and if that works, try using something yet gentler, instead.I undertake this work as community services and feel deeply called to do so. Herbalism is my passion as is the illustration and photography of my book. More so, while most mainstream herbal texts are written by and for white people, usually of some financial privilege, my intended audience is far more diverse.Every perk featured is connected to the project, and to my heart, from prints of herb illustrations and photos I’ve produced, to personal garden consultations, tea blends crafted just for you, and even the commission of a painting. I work most with landscapes, still-life, and barn portraiture, and I’m always pushing out of my comfort zone. I look forward to collaborating with you!Risks & ChallengesMy chosen field requires an extensive education, and I know I will achieve this goal. Prior to realizing that I must pursue this work, I earned a degree in mathematics, with significant study in studio art, English language and literature, and publishing of small press and poetry.I also successfully competed in a widely known small business startup and undertook several courses in small-business management based in agriculture. My analytical training, enriched with my life and academic experience, led directly to this pivotal project. Once certified and published, I have the small-business experience necessary to translate my work into something not only deeply fulfilling but also financially gainful. My target amount is not small, but it’s enough to be able take the time needed to research and write a book! How You Can HelpIf you are able, please help to found my future. More importantly, please share this widely within your personal networks. Thank you for your time and meaningful contribution!image description: a green elevated train track, backlit by sun image description: a small burdock leaf over a sprig of goldenrod, both on a brown leather book, with green grass through a window in the backgroundimage description: a red onion, with skin torn down several layers, and the center beginning to emergeimage description: sunlight coming from the left through windows that are out of the shot, onto broad wood plank floorsimage description: live and blooming purple New England asters, with yellow centers, and a honey bee, laden with pollen, collecting its foodimage description: three back-lit jars, full of honey as well as, rose-hips, hawthorn, and elderberries, respectively.  image description: a white person, smiling, wearing glasses, a yellow shirt and blue shorts, standing in knee-deep water, holding the edge of a canoe that is also in the water     My path—a shining example of how so little of life is a straight line—led me from a small town in Oregon, to Seattle’s indie art and music scenes, then North-Central Mexico, back to Oregon (can’t say no to grandparents, but don't tell them I basically hitchhiked), and ultimately rural New England. Such is the way, it seems. Through those times and spaces, both bright and very dark, I built community, deepened passions, earned a degree, and lately, started a family. Herbalism—once a passionate, but latent interest—is now my focus, allowing me to be my best self.Self-Identity: she/her pronouns, pwd, enby femme, white. image description: a red barn on a stone foundation with white window frames, wooden chairs on green grass, a small child with reddish hair, blue pants, pink shoes, and a pink-dotted sweater, stands on one of the chairs

story:
The Project

Healing happens is a collection of creative writings sharing a common theme – personal empowerment. In this day of advancing technologies such as facebooking, twittering, and various other forms of verb born in our century – it seems the need and desire to “connect” remains intact as the primary motivation.

We want to know that we are not alone. We want to know that we matter. We are afraid to believe that when we are talking about something or someone, amazing, gifted and special – that we are free to include ourselves in that conversation.

Healing happens offers the insight found along many pathways that we are only as alone as we wish to be. Born with us is our own personal right to survive and experience life. Of course what that means from one to another varies greatly.

Ironically, I am a rather quiet and private person. Yet throughout my day, I interact with many people suffering in various ways – physically, mentally, emotionally. The tenacity of people, their ability to endure, is what both inspired and encouraged me to finally print and publish some of my writings that have only been held back by fear for too many years.

I have found that through the sharing these works people have discovered a kindred spirit, not only with another, but their very own. It is becoming a welcome surprise. While I am still on shaky ground and fear based thoughts revisit often, I am also gaining hope with growing interest and positive feedback.

Is it for everyone? I could say yes or no, but so what? Ice cream isn’t for everyone, but it’s on lots of freezer shelves anyway – either for oneself to enjoy or for a visitor who might also enjoy.

So I am reaching out for help in moving forward with a project that I believe in.

Sometimes we need a little help holding on, or letting go. This book does a little of both. Either way, readers “feel” something through the honesty in print. If we do nothing else with our lives, let us not forget to feel it as we go.

About the Book

This book has already received powerful feedback from people. Here are some reviews from amazon.com:

"This is a book that captures the true essence of healing mind, body and soul. The authors journey to wholeness is raw, authentic and inspiring! I would highly recommend this book to all who seek to understand themselves better and to bring clarity to what it means to arrive in the present moment. Michelle's writing speaks to a deeper level of humanness, where all of our darkness and light reside. Her ability to integrate her path is simply pure and candid. A must read for those traveling on this road, or those who have gratitude for having experienced this most sacred path." 

"What a powerful book. I had to stop reading at some parts because I was so
stunned at how much the words were my words...the feelings my feelings...the
stories my stories. I think this book has something for anyone on their own
journey of finding their truth. I can't wait to read it again!"

 Someone once threw me the line - healing is natural. Internal voice echoed, healing is not only natural, it is our business and our right. A seed already living within us, though sometimes deeply buried by the noise and experiences of our lives. For me, something unsettled stirred inside. I stir with it. Maybe it’s worth digging for. Trauma of any flavor forms exceptional layer, which can separate us further from our own truth.

Empowerment is a magnificent thing – free to be received, if only we stop to pick it up. While the journey of our return may not always be easy, it is possible - and it is undeniably, worth the effort.  (back cover, "healing happens")

 

About Me

My name is Michelle L. Tate. I grew up in Chicago, the youngest of 7. Though we struggled financially, I was fortunate enough to be raised by one who encouraged exploration and growth in creative directions, teaching me the value of imagination.

At a young age, I began writing, influenced by things around me, both visible and non-visible. Treasured experiences gave me an interest in the exploration of life and spirit energy through many avenues.

These studies and pursuits continue through my practice of Aikido and Traditional Chinese Medicine. Aside from being a writer, I am a licensed acupuncturist and co-founder of a practice located in Illinois, Acupuncture & Oriental Medicine, and am also an instructor of Aikido at the Abiding Spirit Center and the Aikido Shimboku Kai.

 

What We Need & Perks for Your Support

What We Need

The purpose of this campaign is to raise funds for promotion of this book. I've got the book on amazon.com, but want to reach people more personally. I plan to visit book stores, coffeehouses, wellness centers and other places that seem open to the idea to talk to people about my book.

We will use the money we raise to:

  • Cover marketing costs.
  • Provide copies of the book for giveaways at events.
  • Cover costs for traveling to places in the Midwest area (IL, IN, WI, MI, KY etc) to introduce myself and this project, which I believe can help and empower people wherever they are in their lives.

The Perks of Being a Funder

I believe that mutual benefit and reciprocity are important. In exchange for your support in funding the growth of my project I'm providing a variety of thank you's - handwritten poems, signed copies of my book, a mention on my website as a supporter and an in-person poetry reading.

 

Why Is It Important?

Healing happens is important because, let's face it - life is sometimes hard. Sometimes life is always hard. But it doesn't really have to be.

Personal empowerment, from right where you are, is a very important concept. Through creative venue, this book helps to open doors to one's self, aiding in acknowledgment, empowerment and ultimately, healing.

Sometimes we need a little help holding on, or letting go. This book does a little of both. Either way, readers “feel” something through the honesty in print.

This book has the capacity to change lives. That possibility, makes it important to me. Hopefully you can agree.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

I understand that times are hard, and some of you just aren't able to financially contribute, but that doesn't mean you can’t help:

  • You can spread the word about my book to your friends, family, coworkers, and anyone else you know who you think might be interested. You can find more information on my website, www.michelleltate.com or on amazon.
  • You can post about my book on your Facebook page, or Twitter, or any other of those social media methods.
  • You can use the Indiegogo share tools to share this campaign on Facebook and Twitter, or email folks you know. Please ask them to support me and my book.

And, always, I am open to words of encouragement or valuable constructive feedback.  I would appreciate it greatly.

story:
Short Summary

Creative writing is one of the few professions where you produce something nobody really wants. No one goes into a bookstore and requests a book that has three protagonists set in Canada, France, England and the deserts of Niger. And specifies that the book be written in present and past tense. Still, as writers, we continue to write.

I’m fortunate to have had five books published through traditional trade publishers and collected some awards along the way. My last novel, Quintet, won the Thomas Head Raddall Atlantic Fiction Prize and rave reviews in the Canadian national press. My children’s book, The Magic Compass, was placed in all elementary schools in Nova Scotia by the Department of Education. I’ve also received an Established Artist Recognition Award from the province of Nova Scotia and last year I was awarded the Queen Elizabeth II Diamond Jubilee Medal for my contribution to Canadian Culture.

Writers, by nature, are entrepreneurs. Along the way I also published the former Canadian literary magazine Pottersfield Portfolio for several years. With over twenty years in the writing and publishing sector, recent years have been a challenge. Fewer publishers, fewer books published and reduced or no advances. Last year I created a small company called Boularderie Island Press that assists professional Canadian writers in the transition from trade publishing to self-publishing. Most of these writers are established but cannot get their latest work published. Writers like me.

I have decided to self-publish my new novel Seeds and am using Indiegogo as a platform to raise funds to assist in the book’s publication.

Seeds is the story of Aphra Abrams, a celebrated television gardening guru who seeks out the daughter she gave up for adoption fifty years ago. Unexpectedly, she not only locates her daughter, Caroline, but a man Caroline claims is her brother and Aphra’s son. They all embark on a journey that takes the reader to Canada, England, France, and the deserts of Niger as the three of them seek to discover the meaning of family.

I was once asked by a journalist why all of my novels deal with family. My answer was that we all have one. Seeds weds my exploration of family dynamics with my own personal love of gardening.


What We Need & What You Get

My financial goal through Indiegogo is to raise $6900. However, the true cost of editing, designing, publishing, marketing and distribution of my novel is at least double that sum. However, I believe that I have a responsibility to commit my own funds to the project. After all, if you have not personally invested in your own ventures, you have nothing to lose, which can lead to complacency and entitlement.

The funds raised through my campaign will offset the costs of editing, design, formatting and printing of the book, shipping the title, the production of a dedicated website for the project, the cost of shipping promotional copies to media and reviewers, and modest advertising costs.


The Impact

Although this is my first crowd-sharing experience, I have created successful fund-raising campaigns in the past. I am particularly proud of having created a library of Canadian children’s literature for a rural elementary school on Cape Breton Island, Nova Scotia where my appeal to Canadian publishers resulted in the donation of books worth $4000. At another elementary school with a library lacking books by Nova Scotia writers I was able to secure the donation of class sets from publishers.

By supporting this campaign you are helping me to publish my sixth book in the hope of reaching readers both old and new and to enable the continued publication of professional writing voices silenced by the dwindling trade publishing landscape in Canada.

Thank you.

story:
Measuring History Applies Lunar-like Phases to History

My name is Tony Dickey and my ongoing research in the Measuring History comes from ten years of thorough research.



The Impact

Measuring History changes how we see the past, present and future. By applying the quarterly model we already use, the lunar cycles or the seasons of the year to the outer planets, we gain an objective means to view history and the future.


What We Need & What You Get

Any funds up to and beyond the amount requested allow me to complete the first manuscript, Measuring History, A Visual Primer.


Other Ways You Can Help

Please share this request with friends, families and co-workers. The Measuring Series will appear across many decades. You can tell people for many years  to come that you were part of this ground-breaking work!

story:
My Story

My name is Michael White, and I've been a music journalist (often for love, seldom for money) in my native Canada for almost 20 years. Late in 2011, I was given the blessing of Matt Haynes and Clare Wadd to write an official biography of Sarah Records, the hugely influential independent record label they co-founded and jointly ran in Bristol, England, from 1987 to 1995. In addition to being somewhat averse to backward glancing, Matt and Clare are rigorously â€” and understandably â€” protective of Sarah's legacy and how its story is recounted, so to be given permission to write the first book-length account of the label is an enormous honour that I don't take lightly. I plan to conduct over 100 interviews and spend up to the next two years (but hopefully less) writing it. A publisher has not yet been secured; in the meantime, all expenses are being paid for out of my own pocket. As the Sarah Records story is of interest to a highly specialized â€” and, admittedly, limited â€” audience, I expect it will find a home with a small press and profit will be modest. 


The Impact

Sarah Records â€” and the musical genre it exemplified, variously referred to as 'indiepop,' 'C86,' 'twee' and other descriptors of questionable accuracy and flattery â€” has never been written about with the depth of research and credibility it deserves. My aim is to finally validate the accomplishments of Sarah, and the small but influential underground culture from which it sprung, with the same journalistic seriousness and thoroughness that has been afforded to every other kind of music that has cast a significant influence. More importantly, I want the book to have an appeal far beyond Sarah's existing cult following. I want it to be a great music biography, period, that has the potential to entertain and enlighten anyone, regardless of their musical preferences.


What We Need & What You Get

The single most important endeavour while writing the book is to visit the UK â€” ideally during April or May of this year â€” to conduct in-person interviews and carry out other crucial research that cannot easily be done from my home in Toronto. Without a publisher's advance, this will have to be paid for by me â€” something I'm unable to do alone. I'm hoping to raise a modest $1,800 to cover some (but not all) of the travel and accommodation costs of the trip. While I cannot offer anything substantial in return for donors' generosity, I'm offering the theme-appropriate gift of access to a download mix of some of the best and rarest (non-Sarah) indiepop from my extensive collection. It is also my hope that once the book is ready for publication, I'll be able to offer donors early shipment. (Of course, this will depend on the cooperation of the publisher.) 


Other Ways You Can Help

Whether or not you're able to make a donation, please visit the book's Facebook page (https://www.facebook.com/pages/The-Sarah-Record...) and share it with anyone you think might be interested. Feel free to send any questions you may have to thesarahrecordsbook@rogers.com.


Sincerest thanks,

Michael White

As the Sarah Records story is of interest to a highly specialized â€” and, admittedly, limited â€” audience, I expect it will find a home with a small press and profit will be modest. 


The Impact
Sarah Records â€” and the musical genre it exemplified, variously referred to as 'indiepop,' 'C86,' 'twee' and other descriptors of questionable accuracy and flattery â€” has never been written about with the depth of research and credibility it deserves. My aim is to finally validate the accomplishments of Sarah, and the small but influential underground culture from which it sprung, with the same journalistic seriousness and thoroughness that has been afforded to every other kind of music that has cast a significant influence. More importantly, I want the book to have an appeal far beyond Sarah's existing cult following. I want it to be a great music biography, period, that has the potential to entertain and enlighten anyone, regardless of their musical preferences.


What We Need & What You Get
The single most important endeavour while writing the book is to visit the UK â€” ideally during April or May of this year â€” to conduct in-person interviews and carry out other crucial research that cannot easily be done from my home in Toronto. Without a publisher's advance, this will have to be paid for by me â€” something I'm unable to do alone. I'm hoping to raise a modest $1,800 to cover some (but not all) of the travel and accommodation costs of the trip. While I cannot offer anything substantial in return for donors' generosity, I'm offering the theme-appropriate gift of access to a download mix of some of the best and rarest (non-Sarah) indiepop from my extensive collection. It is also my hope that once the book is ready for publication, I'll be able to offer donors early shipment. (Of course, this will depend on the cooperation of the publisher.) 


Other Ways You Can Help
Whether or not you're able to make a donation, please visit the book's Facebook page (https://www.facebook.com/pages/The-Sarah-Record...) and share it with anyone you think might be interested. Feel free to send any questions you may have to thesarahrecordsbook@rogers.com.

Sincerest thanks,
Michael White

story:
About 'The Grotesque'

Hey horror fans! Welcome to the Indiegogo page for my novel ‘The Grotesque.’ My name’s Vinnie and I'm a writer/director/illustrator who has just finished directing my horror feature movie ‘Haters’. My passion is writing; telling a story that will thrill, charm, amuse, or terrify those turning the pages of my novels, listening to my radio plays, or perhaps one day watching my movies on the 'big screen'. 

The project at hand, and the one that really needs your help, is my novel 'The Grotesque'. I've had this story in my head for several years now. It's a particularly dark, malevolent, and truly terrifying tale in which we see an ancient evil introduced into the life of a young boy who has already suffered an unfair number of life traumas. I finished writing this story recently and have since been designing the cover and thinking of ways to finance its publication. A friend suggested Indiegogo and well, here I am. 

Before I continue, have a read of my synopsis...

“To say that Mark’s year had been a bad one would be a gross understatement. It all began with the accident; the car crash that took his father away, forcing him and his mother to uproot and move across the city. In school, he got into fights...lots; so many in-fact that Detention and Suspension became words his mother began to hear on a weekly basis, but it was the crash that started it all, and to Mark it was all that mattered, everything since was merely crash residue.

GREEN AMBER RED! Mark’s father hadn’t seen red at all, he had however seen rose coloured visions of perfection as he stumbled from the wreck of his car to ask the driver from the other twisted car wreck, “Are you alive?” Anne - the other driver - calmly alighted what was left of her car and replied, “I am,” before fainting onto the tarmac. That afternoon, Anne and Mark’s father bought two coffees in the hospital canteen. That night, Anne and Mark’s father decided that they were meant to be together.The accident had taken Mark’s father away as sure as if he’d smashed through the windscreen of his car, causing his head to be sliced clean off in the process. Mark hated that year. The year his mother cried constantly. The year in which his bottled up feelings of rage, fear, and disappointment became so increasingly warped they finally manifested into a dark presence, a brooding and violent other-worldly creature, a creature whose sole purpose was to destroy the one responsible for its horrific existence.” 

What We'll Achieve

I figure that if I want to do this the right way, I'm not going to go by half-measures. I'm going to get it professionally edited, professionally marketed and distributed both electronically and as a print piece. I'm going big, because that's the only way to really make this work. 

Should I make my funding limit, I'll contract through Lulu.com to deal with my editing, design and distribution; depending on my options, I may go elsewhere for editing and marketing services. I'll set up a website for the book and I'll dedicate myself to moving the book forward and moving myself forward as an author. 

Our Goal & Your Rewards

The goal is to reach $7500. This will go towards all the priorities above, plus a Grotesque website, and also rewriting the book as a screenplay. The perks are many (as you can see listed on the right) and are well worth investing in. They include original signed novels, surprise horror packages, and original artworks. 

More Ways You Can Help

So that's my story. If you can help by giving a few coins and upwards then that will be greatly appreciated, but if your help comes by way of telling friends, family, the media (blogs, twitter, facebook, local newspapers etc.) or associates about my campaign, then that will also be greatly appreciated.

With Your Help...

...The Grotesque will one day hit the bookshelves with the force of the best Stephen King novel, so please support this campaign as this story's worth telling. It's worth reading. It's worth your help.

Thanks for your time.

Vinnie :)

story:
Our ancestors engaged deeply and directly with the plants growing around them, invoking their guidance and their power to transform lives, relationships, and worlds.
 
The magic I teach and practice comes from these roots -- the practice of engaging with a living world fully and completely.   I work with plants not as inert objects, but as teachers, allies, and companions in my work.
 
This book will help you to develop or deepen your own practice of magical herbalism, whether you are a beginner or a seasoned practitioner.  It will teach you how to:
 
  • Develop, maintain, and deepen relationships with plants
  • Engage the four powers of the witch in your work with plants: the power to know, the power to will, the power to dare, and the power to hold silence.
  • Understand the energetic properties of plants and how those properties influence the magic you work with plants
  • Find plants in your landscape that can aid in clearing unwanted energies, protecting you and your home, seeking dreams and visions, blessing your work and your life, and claiming your own power.
  • It will also include selections from my own Materia Magica -- accounts of my personal relationships with my deepest plant allies.


The Green Wand will be released as an e-book next December, but donors to this project will be able to download the book a month before its public release.   My long term goal is to pubish a print edition in 2014, but I want to make this e-book happen first.

What I Need to Make This Happen

Friends, students, clients, and fellow herbalists have been asking me for years "When are you going to write a book?"  
 
My answer has always been "as soon as I can carve out the time."
 
You see, like most herbalists, I usuallly have a dozen different projects on the go to help me make ends meet financially.   Time for writing tends to get sandwiched into the odd hour or two of relative calm. 
 
The purpose of this fundrasing campaign is to raise enough money for me to be able to set aside a substantial block of time each week to focus exclusively on writing The Green Wand.   My goal is to have the manuscript done by Beltane, 2013.
 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't afford to make a donation yourself, please share this appeal with your friends!

story:
Short Summary

My name is Shane Pinnegar, from Perth, Western Australia, and I need your help to publish my debut novel, Jada: Mountain Warrior as an Exclusive First Edition paperback. Jada is an exciting fantasy adventure story which I wrote for tweens, teens and big kids like me (and you)!

I hope you will join me here on Indiegogo and become one of Jada's Warriors. I'm offering some cool rewards for contributors - you can pre-order the book, become a patron or platinum sponsor of the book, and even get yourself written into and featured on the cover of my next novel.

 

A Little About Me

I’ve wanted to write a novel since I was twelve years old, but my insecurity got in the way and I always found other things to do. I worked in computer support, travelled the world and worked as a chef not only in Australia, but also England, France, Canada and Greece, ran a catering business for sixteen years, and for the past ten years I've written about rock n’ roll, movies and books on my 100% ROCK MAGAZINE website, as well as for a bunch of other magazines.

Finally, I’m publishing my debut novel, Jada: Mountain Warrior.

Of course I could just publish this novel digitally, but I love holding a book in my hands and most of my friends do too. With your help, I’ll produce an Exclusive First Edition Paperback complete with a never-to-be-published-elsewhere short story. I’ll even sign and dedicate it if you like.

 

    A Little About The Book

    JADA: MOUNTAIN WARRIOR is a fantasy novel that is as exciting for adults as for teens, and its positive messages are relevant to all of us, no matter what age we are. I think it's suitable for all ages over eleven, but parents should be aware that there are monsters and fighting in the book, and some people and monsters do get killed.

    The book has an amazing cover thanks to artist Dave Howarth, who really captured the strength and positivity of Jada and her unicorn.

    Jada is a courageous tweenage warrior-in-training and unicorn herder, and when her and her clan are attacked by monsters atop the mountain where they live, she must learn great courage to protect her family and their unicorn herd.

    If she is to defeat their attackers, Jada will need to draw on her mother and father’s wisdom and leadership, as well as new-found magical powers she doesn’t yet understand. As Jada goes into battle she discovers that in sacrifice and selflessness there can be found great power.

    She is given strength in this adventure by the return of her ‘imaginary’ childhood friend Bando, and the special bond she shares with a unicorn named Baby.

    Jada: Mountain Warrior is a positive and uplifting fantasy adventure full of action and some fundamental positive messages about finding oneself and finding courage, with a little help from those we care about.

    My early readers have loved the book, calling it "gripping," "unputdownable" (which if it isn't already a word, certainly should be), "fantastic and uplifting" and "so good it made me cry."

     

    Breaking Down The Money

    I'm aiming to raise $2650 through this campaign.

    This will allow for a print run of 100 books ($1250), artwork for the book cover by artist Dave Howarth, graphic design for this campaign ($500), shipping costs ($600), Indiegogo and credit card fees (approx $300).

     

    Other Ways You Can Help

    Not interested in buying a book right now? I hear you, brothers and sisters. You can still help this campaign by sharing this page or my social media posts to your own networks. The more noise you make, the better chance we have for Jada to find her audience.

     

    Links and stuff

    You can find out more about me at my website shanepinnegarwriter.com and sign up for my newsletter to find out what I am up to.

    My rock n' roll and other pop culture reviews and interviews are at 100percentrock.com. I've also written for X-Press Magazine, Around The Sound, Beat Magazine, Brag Magazine, Mysteria Maxima Magazine, The Rockpit and a couple of others as well, so there are other things out there if you Google.

    I'm often sharing photos of our dogs on Instagram @shanepinnegarwriter and am getting better at understanding Twitter @spinnegarwriter and LinkedIn.

     

    UPDATE & STRETCH GOALS

    I am blown away by the response to this campaign so far - after only eight days we're running hot at well over 180% of my initial goal. Sincere superthanks to you all for backing this project and sharing the link around, it means a lot and you've helped me realise a childhood dream.

    Since we have just cracked AUD $5,000 (woo hoo!!!), I am going to print some cool bookmarks featuring the Jada cover art, and every physical order will get one with their book as a special thankyou from me to you.

    I want to make this the best damned book it can be, as well as provide some incentives to keep the campaign rocking and rolling, so I have thought up two major stretch goals.

    If the campaign can raise AUD $7,500, I will be able to commission a further series of illustrations for inside the book from our extremely talented cover artist, Mr Dave Howarth, Esquire. Check his cartoon and graphic design work here, he’s an unsung legend — http://www.hmdesigners.com/

    If the campaign reaches AUD $12,000, then all orders of physical books will be fulfilled in a super-special, ultra-unique hard-cover format, destined to become a collector’s item as well as a work of art in itself. This might be a long-shot, but if we can all pull together and make the campaign go viral, maybe not… so please encourage all those you think might be interested to chip in, buy a book, and share amongst their networks. You rock!

     

    That's all for now, folks - thanks for reading/watching/listening and if you want to get involved, please click on the option on the right should you wish to purchase right now, and help me bring Jada to life in paperback.

    Have an excellent day!

story:
Photo above of mural by Chris Milk

 

Hello, persons...

I'm Elizabeth Cogar,

and I'm writing a book called

Really Richmond: A City Guide

 

+Why am I doing this, you ask?

1. I'm a writer and knower of many things about Richmond, Virginia because... 

2. I'm from here and have explored most every nook and cranny of the environs.

3. I once worked at Richmond's visitor center where I told thousands of tourists about all there is to do here. I also helped them find places, like "Chickenham Parkway" and  "Fallopian Turnpike." Hmmm. Ah, that road on Southside. And the ever popular, "How do I get back on 95?" To which I'd say: Wait one minute! Stay here! We're fun!

4. I'm always up for a challenge!

 

+Ok, but why are you writing it now?

I recently noticed that there is no current Richmond guide book in print, other than some very nice books about history. I thought, maybe I should write a book to help people find the cool places around here. So I put pen to paper (not really), and with your help, I can have them on shop shelves in December.

 

+Who's really going to buy/sell/give REALLY RICHMOND—A City Guide?

•Visitors, present and future (7 million a year!)
•Locals 
•Their out of town guests
•Tourism, convention and economic development professionals
•Newcomers
•Bookstores and gift shops
•Airbnbs, hotels, inns
•Real estate agents
•Corporate recruiters and relocation specialists
•People who prepare gift baskets and welcome packets
•People who conduct orientations for businesses and organizations 
•and others I haven't even thought of yet!

 

+What's REAL about the book?

My main focus is on places and experiences that are really Richmond — most are locally owned and some are one of a kind. There's info on museums, cafes, places to stay, historical sites, one-way streets, theaters, breweries, street art, shopping, tattoos, galleries, parks, tours, events and lots more.

 

+How are you going to print it? Won't it get outdated fast?

I'm self-publishing with a great print-on-demand printer and distributor. When I finish the book, I'll upload a PDF to them, order some and receive them within two weeks. 

Best of all, at any time, I can make corrections and upload a new PDF to the printer and they will immediately start printing with the updated text. So nice!

 

This sounds just great. How can we help?!

I need $5,250 to complete this project and get the books out into the world. 

The funds are needed to:

  • Complete my research and writing
  • Enlist the spectacular talents of graphic designer Alex Fulton and artist Chris Milk
  • Do an initial printing of books
  • Cover start-up marketing costs

Thank you for any contribution you can make! To express my gratitude, each donor will receive something special... check out the Perks at right------>

 

I feel compelled to assist with this noble project!

Yay!

Click on the pink BACK IT button on the upper right of this page.

You can choose to make a Contribution of any amount by typing the amount and clicking on Continue.

OR

You can select a Perk from the boxes at right, give that amount and receive cool stuff.

If you have any trouble, email me at reallyrichmondbook@gmail.com.

ORDERS.....

If you'd like to pre-order a book(s) now, you'll receive one when the first batch arrives... by mid-December at the latest. Here's the link: https://tinyurl.com/reallyrichmondbook

!!!!THANK YOU THANK YOU THANK YOU !!!!!

ALSO, you're invited to submit your answers to these questions, and I'll include as many as I can in the book.

Keep it positive, friends... this is a family book. Send your answers to reallyrichmondbook@gmail.com. Thanks.

Richmond is really......................

Here's an inside tip on something cool in Richmond...........................

ADDITIONAL THANK YOUS!!!!!THANK YOU!!!THANK YOU!!!thank you!! and you!!! also you!

For help with this form or questions: reallyrichmondbook@gmail.com

The funds are needed to:

Complete my research and writing
Enlist the spectacular talents of graphic designer Alex Fulton and artist Chris Milk

Do an initial printing of books
Cover start-up marketing costs

Thank you for any contribution you can make! To express my gratitude, each donor will receive something special... check out the Perks at right------>
 
I feel compelled to assist with this noble project!

OR
You can select a Perk from the boxes at right, give that amount and receive cool stuff.
