story:
Mr. Woible's Foibles!

I am so pumped up to get Mr. Woible's Foibles started! I will send a fresh, funny chapter of Mr. Woible's 6th grade class each week to each subscribing school. This will make reading fun and fresh!

As a therapist, a writer, a storyteller, and a former stand-up comic I have seen kids struggle to read things that they have no connection to. With Mr. Woible's Foibles when there is an election going on Mr. Woible might have a class election or a debate. If it is near Valentine's Day there could be Valentine's Day that puppy love Valentine's Day drama in that weeks story.

Not only will students be engaged through the humor and the relevance but the teachers will be empowered to use the chapters each week however they feel their students learn best. They can project the chapter on to a screen for a group read along. They can print it out or download it to a pc or a laptop. Teachers know how their students learn best so this puts the power back into our very capable teachers' hands!

I am also very excited that Indiegogo has such a strong international presence because of schools outside of the U.S.A. want to give their students a glimpse of the daily life of American youth this will be a great opportunity!

What's in it for you? If you look at the perks below you can see that you can become a member of Mr. Woible's Monthly Motivational club or you could have everything from a student to the principal to the whole school named after you. YES, YOU COULD BE FAMOUS!

What will I use the money for? I am usually doing home visits seeing families into the evening. This money will give me time to write great storylines and market Mr. Woible's Foibles to schools all over the world.

Your donation and support will make this Mr. Woible's Foibles a very happening thing but you sharing through Facebook, Twitter, and the Indiegogo share tools will assure Mr. Woible's Foibles becomes an uber-happening thing!

Let's get this Woible party started!!! You know it's Woible-icious!

story:
The novel "West to Bravo" is a post Civil War Cavalry tale much in the vein of the classic John Ford films with traditional western characters in an adventure filled story put to the page and someday to the Big Screen!

My profession is Western Filmmaker.  This novel is a work of historical fiction, but it stands on the shoulders of the classic Western genre in American Film.

    

I wrote this story for the folks I meet at Western Festivals and events where a
mutual bond is created over the importance of the Cowboy in our culture.  It is an unspoken brotherhood among those of us who have a Westerner within that special place in our soul.  There is an everlasting desire in this country for the tales and adventures of the American Cowboy.  His code of ethics, moral integrity, self-reliance and knowing good from bad, right from wrong seems like an exotic fanciful tale in this ever changing, fast-paced world. 

A man on a horse inspires us to stop and imagine, putting our technological world away for a short moment to see clearly into the basic joys of life. 

For me, I have a love for the history of the West.  Even more than that, I have a passion for the Western image created by screen legends such as Gary Cooper, James Stewart and the still most recognized star worldwide, John Wayne.  From these figures, we as an audience are taught morality tales of characters who experience the violent conflict of man, nature or self and make it through the journey of survival.

I would like to acknowledge the storytellers who have carried on this great tradition.  I hope you enjoy experiencing these universal western characters as they breathe new life into a fresh adventure.  These unique personalities are of another time in the American West, but belong to us all.

             

Note about the Illustrations: My good friend, actor, artist and cowboy pal Al Bringas illustrated the wonderfully sketched artwork in this book.  His passion for detail and homage to the great cowboy artists is evident in his interpretation of elements from classic western art, masterfully weaving images into the fabric of our western tale.

What We Need & What You Get

I need YOUR help to get this book out to all the potential Western Fans!  

Don't wait, get your Book and Limited Edition items now and help get the message out that the Western genre is still alive and strong. 

Here are the Perks -  Examples in Photo Gallery section. 

Items will be mailed out in mid September 2014.  Postage in USA included - For International Shipping:  Please add $15 for postage

$15 - DVD "Friend of the Devil" Western TV Pilot & Making of: Documentary.  Directed by EH Heisner, filmed at John Wayne's Alamo Village in Texas & the  Alabama Hills in Lone Pine, CA along with a Thank You note of support.

     

$30 - Hardcover First Edition Novel "West to Bravo" personally signed by Author Eric H. Heisner & Illustrator Al P. Bringas

  

$60 - "West to Bravo" Novel in hardcover signed & (2) matted Artworks from novel (choose (2) from the 5 art pieces featured in Photo Gallery)

                

$90 - "West to Bravo" Novel in hardcover signed & (2) framed Artworks from novel (choose (2) from the 5 art pieces featured in Photo Gallery)

   

$100 - "West to Bravo" Novel, hardcover signed with Personalized Inscription & U.S. Cavalry Guidon Flag - hand painted on heavy cotton, 2 feet x 3 feet  (Classic Western Film Cavalry Flag as seen in John Ford Films)

                                           

$100 - "West to Bravo" Novel, hardcover signed with Personalized Inscription & Classic Western Bandana - Choice between the "West to Bravo/Hondo style" "Searchers" & "Sacketts" (Bandanas are silk/cotton blend, 32" x 32")

      

$150 - "West to Bravo" Novel, hardcover signed with Personalized Inscription, "Friend of the Devil" DVD, (2) Framed Artworks, & Classic Western Bandana

$250 - (2 each) "West to Bravo" Novel, hardcover signed with Personalized Inscription, DVD, Framed Artwork, Classic Western Bandana

$500 - "West to Bravo" Novel, hardcover signed with Personalized Inscription, "Classic Western Cavalry Hat", DVD, (2) Artworks, & Classic Western Bandana

   

 $1000 - Dinner with Author in L.A. (travel & lodging not included) & all perks included at the $500 level

$1200 - Signature 'Hero Hat' from "West to Bravo" custom made for you by Master Hatter, Eric Watson at Watson's Hat Shop in Cave Creek AZ.   Perks include:  Inscribed Novel, Bandana, Guidon Flag, Artwork & DVD http://www.watsonshatshop.com/

                                                 

Keep the Western Alive!

One of the Goals with this "Pre-Sale Book Event" is to demonstrate for the New York Publisher that there is a strong market for Western Fiction and works that reflect that genre.  The more books we pre-sell, the larger volume of books the Publisher will send to print and more resources allotted from their Publicity & Marketing Dept.

Enjoy the Read & Thank You for your time and support!

Looking forward to seeing you down the trail...

Sincerely,

Eric H. Heisner

www.leandogproductions.com

"Like us" on Facebook:  Two Rode Together Wardrobe Co.

A special Thank You to Cowboy Actor, Writer & Filmmaker Travis Lee Eller for putting together the Campaign Pitch Video!!  check out his other stuff at: http://www.imdb.com/name/nm3372755/?ref_=fn_al_nm_1

story:
My name is George Kevin Jordan. I am a writer. Three years ago I started working on my third novel project Martin Mills Loves Musical Theatre.

Martin is a young boy figuring out his life when he is kicked out of his house, and forced to navigate the streets of Chicago and find who who he really is and what he wants out of life.

What started out as a way to understand my past growing up in the Midwest, and has morphed into real manuscript.

Martin got me into grad school, and he gave me the courage to move to Los Angeles.

This project and I have been through a lot. Thanks to those pages and the support of MANY MANY readers I have been invited to attend two prestigious writer's conferences - VONA and Tin House.

Attending conferences places writers in front of established authors, publishers and agents. We receive important feedback to help us shape our work. We get to bond with other writers. These events are critical in helping me land a deal for my book, and pushing my career forward.

I am seeking $5,000 in funds to help pay for high costs to attend the two conferences, and for the final research I need to complete my novel.

Writing helps us make sense of the world. It gives us a voice when we feel invisible or when there are so many yours doesn't seem to count. Attending these conferences and completing my book are the ultimate goals of a writer. But I am not just writing for me but to provide a voice for my community.

Getting the word out is critical. If you are inspired share this campaign with your friends.

story:
Introducción

Mi nombre es Akira Uchimura, nacido de padre japonés y madre chilena. 
Soy director de la Fundación Nikkei Youth Network, y administrador del grupo Chilenos en Japón

Mis dos países, Chile y Japón, están lo mas alejados el uno del otro en este planeta.He vivido en medio de estas dos culturas diferentes y a veces similares.

Quise mostrar estas diferencias que me hacen pensar, reír, y a veces enojar en una forma visual. Una comparación gráfica de mis dos países queridos. 

Todo comenzó con este artículo que escribí en nuestro portal Hana.bi (http://hana.bi/2014/11/chile-japon/). Tuvo mucha atención y me han llovido comentarios e ideas para mas comparaciones. También he hecho videos como este: 


Muchos me han pedido que haga un libro sobre ello, y creo que ya es el momento donde pueda escribir y contar estas similitudes y diferencia mas a fondo para entender mejor a estos dos países de una manera visual. 

Contenido del Libro:

Son 60 páginas con 30 imágenes  que contienen una explicación detallada de las diferencias y similitudes.


Lo que necesito para lograr este libro

Es primera vez que hago un libro, y quisiera que surja del apoyo de la comunidad personas que nos gusta la cultura japonesa.

Estoy en un momento en mi vida donde quiero escribir más y darle más fuerza al entendimiento y colaboración entre Japón y America Latina. Quiero pedir tu ayuda para lograr lanzar este libro y se vuelva mi primera milestone en Chile para continuar con proyectos más grandes. 

Los fondos de apoyo que consiga mediante Indiegogo irán para el diseño, producción y envío del libro impreso. 

¿Porque hacer un libro así?

Viviendo entre estas dos culturas, me doy cuenta que hay muchos mal-entendimientos o conceptos equivocados sobre las dos culturas y siento que es mi misión de vida poder ser un puente para que nos podamos entender mejor mutuamente. Eso es lo que sigo haciendo en nuestro portal Hana.bi y con nuestra fundación Nikkei Youth Network. 

Otras formas que puedes ayudarme

Otra forma en que pediría tu ayuda es compartiendo esta campaña en tu cuenta de facebook, twitter, blog, etc. Pero más que nada, compartirlo con alguien que pudiera interesarse en este libro. 

 Eso es todo y よろしくおねがいします！ m(_ _)m


Akira Uchimura 
twitter: @akirau

Muchos me han pedido que haga un libro sobre ello, y creo que ya es el momento donde pueda escribir y contar estas similitudes y diferencia mas a fondo para entender mejor a estos dos países de una manera visual. 
Contenido del Libro:
Son 60 páginas con 30 imágenes  que contienen una explicación detallada de las diferencias y similitudes.



Lo que necesito para lograr este libro
 Es primera vez que hago un libro, y quisiera que surja del apoyo de la comunidad personas que nos gusta la cultura japonesa.
Estoy en un momento en mi vida donde quiero escribir más y darle más fuerza al entendimiento y colaboración entre Japón y America Latina. Quiero pedir tu ayuda para lograr lanzar este libro y se vuelva mi primera milestone en Chile para continuar con proyectos más grandes. 
Los fondos de apoyo que consiga mediante Indiegogo irán para el diseño, producción y envío del libro impreso. 
¿Porque hacer un libro así?
 Viviendo entre estas dos culturas, me doy cuenta que hay muchos mal-entendimientos o conceptos equivocados sobre las dos culturas y siento que es mi misión de vida poder ser un puente para que nos podamos entender mejor mutuamente. Eso es lo que sigo haciendo en nuestro portal Hana.bi y con nuestra fundación Nikkei Youth Network. 

    Otras formas que puedes ayudarme Otra forma en que pediría tu ayuda es compartiendo esta campaña en tu cuenta de facebook, twitter, blog, etc. Pero más que nada, compartirlo con alguien que pudiera interesarse en este libro. 
 Eso es todo y よろしくおねがいします！ m(_ _)m

Akira Uchimura twitter: @akirau

story:
STRETCH GOAL 1- FUNDED!

Thanks to a phenomenal early response, I'm happy to announce that a bonus chapter will be added to the book at 7200 USD raised. This chapter, exploring NJPW's recent international success, will be crowd sourced, and I will be reaching out to contributors with a survey to collect data and potential quotes for entry into the book.

STRETCH GOAL 2!

At 8200 USD raised, there will be a second bonus chapter included. Exploring the 'Greatest 18' introduced in 1990 by Antonio Inoki, the chapter will look at the original members of NJPW's Mount Rushmore, and investigates who would be included in such a list today.

STRETCH GOAL 3!

I'm happy to announce a 9,200USD stretch goal. This will allow for a special hard bound copy of Lion's Pride with exclusive photography not found in the other versions.


ON JANUARY 4, 2015, 36,000 wrestling fans filed into the Tokyo Dome to witness Wrestle Kingdom 9. The show saw more eyes, with more of an international reach than ever in the company's 42 year history, with the brand new NJPW World streaming service and traditional pay per view, called by the legendary Jim Ross and Matt Striker bringing a worldwide audience.

Yet Wrestle Kingdom 9 was not the story of a little promotion that could rise up and seizing the international limelight. It was instead the latest chapter in an ongoing route to redemption. Like wrestling in general in Japan, NJPW was a phenomenon almost out of the gate, but didn't always maintain that high, as poor decision making and mismanagement almost sank a national institution.

ABOUT THE BOOK


Lion's Pride: The Turbulent History of New Japan Pro Wrestling tells the story of many rises and falls in NJPW's ongoing history. From the early years of pro wrestling in Japan, through NJPW's foundation by Antonio Inoki in 1972, through riots, scandals, triumph and heartbreak, this is an essential retrospective for the new NJPW fan, and an incisive commentary for the hardcore expert.

The book contains a chronological history spanning more than sixty years to the foundation of the Japanese Wrestling Association under Rikidozan. It also features in depth commentaries and essays exploring psychology apparent in Japanese wrestling, cross media endeavours, and the promotion's most significant stars. In addition, negotiations are underway to include numerous high quality photographs spanning more than half a century of Japanese wresting history.

ABOUT THE AUTHOR

My first introduction to Japanese wrestling was on a shaky VHS copy of the 1994 Super J Cup. Five years after that viewing, I moved to Japan, where I've lived for the past decade. 

Immersed in the wrestling culture, I trained in the UK, where I wrestled for Midlands Pro Wrestling and NWA: UK Hammerlock. In Japan, I wrestled for various small independents before realising my talents were perhaps best served away from the ring (I wasn't particularly good). 

Since 2012, I've co-hosted Live Audio Wrestling's monthly Japanese podcast with WH Park, as well as commentating extensively on videogames and sub cultures at kaijupop.com.

I currently live in Yokohama with my wife and son. This is my first book.

WHY INDIEGOGO?


The heavy lifting of writing the book is complete, and it's currently being edited. I currently need funding to:

-Arrange for commercial usage rights to thirty stunning photographs, covering more than half a century of Japanese wrestling history. (33%)

- Pay for professional layout, and high quality printed and e-book versions of Lion's Pride (10%)

- Perk fulfillment (including shipping)(48%)

- Indie Gogo's fees (4%) 

- Assorted fees such as ISBN registration. (5%)


FAQ

Q: Can I contribute via PayPal?

A: This is a flexible funding campaign, so you can contribute via credit card, Apple Pay or Paypal. However, due to PayPal Japan's funding rules, PayPal contributions have to be under 100USD. Apologies for any inconvenience caused. 

Q: Is this an official NJPW product?

A: No. The book is in no way affiliated with NJPW, Bushiroad or any other entity. This does make for editorial freedom, and the chance to take a balanced look at the good and bad in the company's history.

Q: How long is the book?

A: It's hard to tell exactly before layout is done, but around 230-250 pages for the standard digital and physical, with slightly fewer for the hardcover (due to the added size). It's around the 70,000 word mark.


Disclaimer:

Delivery of rewards/perks are subject to best efforts and not guaranteed.

story:
Labor of Love

For five years, Fierce, Freethinking Fatties has been covering the issues that affect fat people, from Body Acceptance to health and culture and the latest research. We began Fierce Fatties as a way to give a platform to ordinary fat people from all walks of life to share their views on a world that can be hostile to those whose bodies don't conform to the ideal.

We've needed to upgrade our website since day one, but since this is an all-volunteer endeavor, we've had to make due with our basic Wordpress format. We have a vast archive that would make a valuable resource if we can organize it in a way that isn't quite so confusing. And when our conversations go on too long, the nesting text suffers from the dreaded "noodling":

But most importantly, the bloggers behind Fierce Fatties have been providing fresh daily content for five years and have asked nothing in return. We do this because it's vital that ordinary fatties have a say in this fat-shaming culture. Having been at the helm of this project since the beginning, I can tell you that every day this blog has been a labor of love in every sense of the words.

What We Need and What You Get

We received an estimate on upgrading our site from Jenny Stoffel at Wired Pinecone. We can do a basic update that will be more functional, attractive and effective for an estimated $1,230. If we can raise $2,000, then we would have an adequate cushion to cover any additional updates we may require that weren't considered in the initial estimate, as well as hosting costs for the next five years.

All dollar donations for the Battle of the Santas will go toward this goal, but we will also accept larger donations from loyal readers. In return, we will offer perks, including a number of fat-friendly books, knit hats, homemade caramels, copy-editing services and even health coaching.

If we surpass our goal, any additional funds will be donated to 3rd Annual International Weight Stigma Conference. Also, we will disclose the final invoice for the website upgrade and donate the unspent portion to the IWSC.

The Impact

With a new website, we will be able to give a professional-looking home to the high quality content you've come to expect. We will also be able to host advertising which will allow us to finally reimburse our bloggers for their invaluable contributions and providing a potent incentive to continue the work they've been doing.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    Please help spread the word about the Battle of the Santas and our fundraiser. Share the link to this fundraiser and help us reach our goal.

    Thank you!

story:
Short Summary

My name is Diggie Vitt and I am currently working on a conceptual photography book entitled, Saudade.

Saudade is a Portuguese word meaning "the love that remains." There is no direct translation in English, which gives the word so much more beauty. This book represents the nostalgia and longing I have in a series of feelings and stories.

My Mission

In September I will be leaving America to finish my book in Iceland and throughout many countries in Europe.

I will be leaving Iceland in October and flying to Amsterdam to take a train across several different countries:

  • Amsterdam, Netherlands
  • Berlin, Germany
  • Prague, Czech Republic
  • Budapest, Hungary
  • Vienna, Austria
  • Venice, Italy
  • Milano, Italy
  • Lyon, France
  • Paris, France

I will be spending as little money as possible throughout this trip, so I will be couch surfing while abroad so I can invest all the money I can into the book itself.

I really want to collaborate with a lot of different artist while I'm in these countries, so feel free to contact me while I'm in your home town!

The Impact

This will be my first book. It will be a vertical 6x8 inch book with approximately 40 pages.

Ideally, I would like to self publish this book. So currently, with my limited initial funding I will be working through a third party service. With enough extra funding I will be able to self publish a larger format book!

Risks & Challenges

There are not many risk's involved in this project. Regardless a 6x8 book will be released, but with enough funding I can produce a larger format book with more pages!

I have taken on two big projects while traveling throughout the United States. I finished my first 365 project partially across the United States over the course of 5 months.

The book will be released in 2016.

Other Ways You Can Help

Don't forget to share!
Facebook

story:
☞ WHAT, WHY, WHO, & HUH?:

WHAT: This is a little fundraiser for a big, glittery dream: a twice-monthly podcast called POETRY JAWNS - a murmur in your ear of what we feel is the most vibrant & interesting work being made today, in Philly & beyond. 


WHY: We believe that poetry (& any art form, for that matter) is at its most electric, irreverent, & intimate when it exists outside institutions. We want that energy to come through loud & clear. POETRY JAWNS will be immersive, subversive, & -- most of all -- fun. 

WHO: We're Alina & Emma, two Philly-based women who want to amplify the voices of thinkers & makers in our city & beyond.

HUH?: If you don't get poetry or think poetry doesn't get you, this podcast is for you, too. Dare us to change your opinion. Dare us!

☞ WHERE YOUR DOLLARS WILL GO:

We want POETRY JAWNS to be available worldwide & free to all. To make that happen, we need your help! We're creating a home studio from scratch, but unfortunately, we aren't exactly rolling around in $$ bills $$

Every dollar you donate will be put towards audio interface, microphones, cables, stands, headphones, amplifier, web & file hosting costs, Indiegogo fees, & studio stocking necessities.

In summary: we want to create a decent-sounding podcast, at the lowest expense possible, without going broke in the process. The more cash we raise, the more we'll be able to invest. If we end up completely above & beyond our goal, we can do totally awesome things like pay our guests (fingers crossed!)


☞ OTHER WAYS ☆YOU☆ CAN HELP:

POETRY JAWNS is a community-driven & collaborative labor of love. We're so grateful for any/all support you're able to give! If you're interested in this project (or know someone who might be),  please:

1. Donate at the link to the right (if you can!)
2. Give us a shoutout on social media.
3. Email this page to a friend or two.

Any questions? Give us a shout. 

Thank you so, so much for your support. We'll see you on the other side!

Love,
Emma & Alina

story:
Dear reader! Thank you for your loyalty to the AlterWorld. I am glad that you’ve grown fond of Max’s story. Just like you, I want the rest of the books in the series to get published as soon as possible. But the publication process is being hampered by the expenses and the time-frames associated with translation.

The cost of translating one book ranges from $5,000 to $10,000. The translation itself takes up to 4 months.

There are currently 7 books in the series that are already written, plus additional stories. I am also working on a new LitRPG series about outer space.

In response to the readers’ demands, I am opening a crowdfunding company to raise capital for translating the rest of the books. If we raise enough money, I will hire a second translator to speed up the process and get the books out twice as fast! The new volumes will be released every one and a half or two months! If we only raise a portion of the funds, this will in any case help shorten the waiting time between the book releases. After paying for the translation of one book, it is quite difficult for me to find another spare $7,000 in order to instantly get the next book translated. I am forced to save… which is long and painful…

There are no risks involved; the books are ALREADY written. The only issue is translating them. Every dollar counts; it will be put to good use! A single dollar shortens the waiting time by 10 hours!

Everyone who decides to help out will receive a few wonderful volumes from the AlterWorld series as a thank-you gift: The Sense Of Duty, which recounts the story of the Doc and the hospice, and also The Three Bears And The Zombie Legion, the story of how the Inferno powers came to Earth.

Those who give $10+ will have their names printed in the Acknowledgement Section.

Those who give $30+ will receive the first book in the series with my autograph!

Those who give $60+will additionally receive 3 autographed volumes!

If you can’t afford to donate, it’s no big deal; I am still endlessly grateful to all of you for falling in love with the world I have created! Besides, there are other ways to make major contributions; you could recommend the series to your friends, write a review, or share a link to the books on Facebook or Twitter.

Thanks again for your support!

Yours truly,

Dmitriy Rus

story:
¿Qué?

Los mundos de Dalia: La instrucción se sale de los patrones habituales del género fantástico para presentarnos una historia de personajes alrededor de una trama de madurez... no te la pierdas.

Dalia es una joven adolescente de catorce años inteligente y audaz. Tras una discusión con sus compañeras de instituto acude a casa desconsolada en busca del consejo de su madre. Sin embargo, esa misma noche, Dalia será transportada a un mundo desconocido para ella donde, sin saberlo, es la última esperanza de los darcols ante un conflicto que lleva durando años. Allí descubrirá que es un ser imbuido por la energía al igual que Hive, quien la acompañará como guerrero en su lucha. Pero la energía no es exclusiva de ellos, sino que se manifiesta de numerosas formas y puede ser utilizada con diversos propósitos, viéndose obligada a encontrarse a sí misma para poder tomar parte en el conflicto. Será entonces cuando descubrirá que dicha energía no solo es utilizada para hacer el bien o el mal, sino que existen otras vertientes como la neutralidad, cuyos seres buscarán desesperadamente equilibrar la balanza sin importar nada más.

Los mundos de Dalia pretende ser una serie de novelas de fantasía donde La instrucción no es más que la introducción a ese mundo lleno de fuerzas donde nadie puede asegurar quién está dispuesto a luchar por el bien, por el mal o por otros propósitos impredecibles.
 

¿Quiénes?

Tandaia es una editorial con voluntad de cambio, de dar la alternativa a autores que no la encuentran en otro lugar, con nuevas y refrescantes ideas como es el emplear una campaña preventa para valorar la aceptación y viabilidad de cada título.

De este modo eres tú, ahora que te estás planteando cómo colaborar, el que decide si la obra que te presentamos verá la luz pasando a formar parte de nuestro catálogo... porque consideramos al lector parte fundamental del proceso.

Hoy os presentamos a Juan Vicente Ruiz Blasco.

Nacido en Sevilla en agosto de 1984 crece en la localidad gaditana de Jerez de la Frontera. Afincado actualmente con su familia en Fuenlabrada, siempre tuvo inquietudes que lo llevaban a escribir casi desde que tiene uso de razón. Compaginando sus estudios y su variada vida laboral, continuaba escribiendo casi sin pausas. Pero fue en 2015 cuando su mujer y sus hijos lo animaron a escribir no solo para sí, sino para más público, cosechando así en su primer intento el premio al mejor relato corto de una pequeña localidad de la provincia madrileña. Fue desde este momento cuando se animó a escribir de manera más decidida, llegando a autopublicar en 2016 El duelo de los inocentes, drama que aborda la superación de una familia y amigos tras un triste accidente donde pierden a sus seres más queridos. 

Pero la pasión por las aventuras y, sobre todo, por ver disfrutar a sus hijos con la lectura, fue lo que le llevó a escribir Los mundos de Dalia y probar así con el género de fantasía y literatura juvenil. Despertando así el interés de familiares y amigos que le animaron a emprender la aventura de la publicación y poder llegar así a un público más extenso.

¿Por qué?

Y por aquí una muestra de lo que encontraréis en sus páginas:

«A Dalia le encantaba su habitación. La había decorado a su gusto. En las paredes tenía todo tipo posters colgados de sus películas favoritas, además de aquellos grupos de música de moda. No era demasiado grande, pero ella prefería usar el término “acogedora”. Era feliz en aquellas cuatro paredes donde su mente, insaciable e incansable, solía imaginar todo tipo de situaciones. Entre tanta decoración se podía apreciar el color amarillo en las paredes, a juego con su ropa de cama. Se puso su pijama de color rojo con ositos panda dibujados y se acostó. Estaba cansada aunque no sabía por qué extraña sensación aún se mantenía despierta. Miró el reloj. Las once y veinte.
          Tras un largo período de tiempo, cuando estaba a punto de conciliar el sueño, algo llamó su atención. Una especie de sombra oscura al final de su habitación parecía perturbar su descanso. Se incorporó y pronto observó que aquella sombra no era fruto de la interrupción de la luz, sino algo tangible, algo denso. Su corazón se aceleraba. Dalia estaba a punto de descubrir una aterradora verdad. No estaba sola en su dormitorio»

¿Cómo?

Para arrancar el proyecto nos hemos fijado como objetivo 880€; esta es la cantidad que recaudaríamos si alrededor de cincuenta mecenas se hiciesen, cada cual, con un ejemplar de esta primera edición.

  • Teniendo acceso a las galeradas de edición.
  • Recibiendo un ejemplar semanas antes de la salida al mercado de la obra.
  • Si bien, también podrías ver tu nombre en los agradecimientos aportando un poco más.

Los fondos recaudados, se utilizarán como ayuda para sacar adelante esta primera edición de Los mundos de Dalia: La instrucción que saldría después a la venta.

Además...

Sabemos que son tiempos difíciles, también nosotros los sufrimos, y es posible que no te encuentres en disposición de apoyarnos con tu mecenazgo en estos momentos... pero esperamos que si esto te ha llegado al alma, incluso si tal vez conoces en persona al autor, trates de difundir esta campaña (facebook, twitter, blogger, boca-oreja... ) para que alcancemos nuestra meta y Juan Vicente Ruiz Blasco vea publicada su obra.

Gracias por vuestro tiempo.

¿Qué?
Los mundos de Dalia: La instrucción se sale de los patrones habituales del género fantástico para presentarnos una historia de personajes alrededor de una trama de madurez... no te la pierdas.
Dalia es una joven adolescente de catorce años inteligente y audaz. Tras una discusión con sus compañeras de instituto acude a casa desconsolada en busca del consejo de su madre. Sin embargo, esa misma noche, Dalia será transportada a un mundo desconocido para ella donde, sin saberlo, es la última esperanza de los darcols ante un conflicto que lleva durando años. Allí descubrirá que es un ser imbuido por la energía al igual que Hive, quien la acompañará como guerrero en su lucha. Pero la energía no es exclusiva de ellos, sino que se manifiesta de numerosas formas y puede ser utilizada con diversos propósitos, viéndose obligada a encontrarse a sí misma para poder tomar parte en el conflicto. Será entonces cuando descubrirá que dicha energía no solo es utilizada para hacer el bien o el mal, sino que existen otras vertientes como la neutralidad, cuyos seres buscarán desesperadamente equilibrar la balanza sin importar nada más.
Los mundos de Dalia pretende ser una serie de novelas de fantasía donde La instrucción no es más que la introducción a ese mundo lleno de fuerzas donde nadie puede asegurar quién está dispuesto a luchar por el bien, por el mal o por otros propósitos impredecibles. 
¿Quiénes?
Tandaia es una editorial con voluntad de cambio, de dar la alternativa a autores que no la encuentran en otro lugar, con nuevas y refrescantes ideas como es el emplear una campaña preventa para valorar la aceptación y viabilidad de cada título.
De este modo eres tú, ahora que te estás planteando cómo colaborar, el que decide si la obra que te presentamos verá la luz pasando a formar parte de nuestro catálogo... porque consideramos al lector parte fundamental del proceso.
Hoy os presentamos a Juan Vicente Ruiz Blasco.
Nacido en Sevilla en agosto de 1984 crece en la localidad gaditana de Jerez de la Frontera. Afincado actualmente con su familia en Fuenlabrada, siempre tuvo inquietudes que lo llevaban a escribir casi desde que tiene uso de razón. Compaginando sus estudios y su variada vida laboral, continuaba escribiendo casi sin pausas. Pero fue en 2015 cuando su mujer y sus hijos lo animaron a escribir no solo para sí, sino para más público, cosechando así en su primer intento el premio al mejor relato corto de una pequeña localidad de la provincia madrileña. Fue desde este momento cuando se animó a escribir de manera más decidida, llegando a autopublicar en 2016 El duelo de los inocentes, drama que aborda la superación de una familia y amigos tras un triste accidente donde pierden a sus seres más queridos. 
Pero la pasión por las aventuras y, sobre todo, por ver disfrutar a sus hijos con la lectura, fue lo que le llevó a escribir Los mundos de Dalia y probar así con el género de fantasía y literatura juvenil. story:
The Story Behind My Book

My name is Morgan A. Wider and I am the author of The Worthy Wardrobe. As a wardrobe stylist, I’ve been in the closets of hundreds of women, and I know first hand that getting dressed each morning is never just about the clothes. How we choose to dress is a direct reflection of how we feel about ourselves: our bodies, our personality, our professional and personal goals, our place in society, and our budgets.

The Worthy Wardrobe explores these intersections and the complicated relationship women have with clothes. I wrote this book to help women learn to love themselves so that getting dressed each morning becomes a joyful experience. Part memoir, part style guide, The Worthy Wardrobe will help readers build a wardrobe and image that reflects their inherent Worthiness.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover a deeper appreciation for yourself and your wardrobe. In The Worthy Wardrobe, I hope to instill the same passion and excitement that I have for style and spirituality in you. Ultimately I want you to see this book as a tool to help you dress in a way that honors your soul and to find tangible tips on building a wardrobe that excites you.

In this book, you'll learn about Spirituality, Style, and Shopping:

Spirituality: Because how we think and feel about ourselves is the foundation for everything we do. Each of us first must learn to love the amazing, divine, spiritual beings that we are.

Style: Personal Style is a journey, not a destination. As our lives change, so do our bodies. As the way we see ourselves changes, so does the way others see us. A stylish wardrobe is about having clothes that honor the person we are at this point in our lives.

Shopping: By investing in a wardrobe we love, we communicate to the world that our ideas, our goals, our businesses are also worthy of investment. As a personal shopper, I provide my tried and true tactics for making a smart and stylish purchase.

You will love this book if you want to be empowered when shopping and getting dressed each morning.


The Worthy Wardrobe is a non-fiction book that speaks to women of all ages and professions who are looking to finally see themselves as the beautiful, powerful, and amazing women they were created to be.

 

About the Book 

The Worthy Wardrobe is written in 4 Parts: 

Part 1 contains the introduction and my personal style evolution. As a stylist, it’s assumed that I’ve always had a wonderful relationship with clothes — not true at all. As someone who didn’t always love how she looked, I first had to learn to love myself before I could dress myself, let alone teach anyone else how to dress. I hope that by sharing my story, you’ll see that great style is obtainable for everyone, including you.

Part 2 is about Perfection. The Universe created each one of us as whole and perfect beings. The faster we can accept that we are all worthy and that our bodies our perfect just as they are, the sooner clothes become enjoyable. In this section, I reference all kinds of spiritual concepts, from the Bible to Buddha, to establish our innate divinity. I then provide ways to find clothes to fit your unique and perfect shape and size.

Part 3 covers Purpose and Prettiness. All of us are here on Earth for a divine assignment. And whatever work we’re here to do requires that we look and feel our best. In these chapters, I discuss how so many women I've worked with used to play small with their image and how that decision impacted their professional and personal success. Backed by several studies, I make the case that owning your version of pretty actually helps your professional goals. I also explore how the attention of men impacts our wardrobe choices at work and social settings.

Part 4 is about Plenty. Because we live in an abundant universe, there’s no need to hold on to clothes that no longer serve us. Nor is is OK to opt out of investing in yourself. By letting go of the past and making wise shopping purchases, you’ll enjoy walking into your closet each morning.

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book.

Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in July 2020.
  • The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)
  • The Copyediting for My Book - to help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this summer

When I pre-sell 100 copies of my book, I will publish. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish an audiobook. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now.  

Depending on your level of participation, you will receive:

  • A personally signed copy of my book when I publish.
  • Early access to the Introduction of my Book and my entire manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback
  • The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover
  • Exclusive access to the Worthy Wardrobe Community, with access to style tips and content
  • Access to a live webinar with me to help you build a Worthy Wardrobe just in time for Spring & Summer
  • Tickets to my Atlanta book launch
  • A one-on-one virtual closet session with me to help you determine what stays, what goes and what needs to be purchased.
  • And more...

About Me

I've spent the past three years working as a wardrobe stylist and speaker. Through my company, Wider Style, I advise executives, entrepreneurs, and college students on how to build wardrobes that convey confidence and competence. I've worked with companies such as Google, Walmart, Mercedes-Benz, and Porsche to highlight how an improved image increases performance.

Before launching my business, I spent 10 years working at the corporate headquarters of some of the world’s largest clothing brands, growing several businesses with my knowledge of merchandising, apparel production, pricing strategy and international development.

While working with women across the country, I began to see how I wasn’t the only woman who didn’t like her hips, was scared to be noticed or who thought she was “too smart to be pretty.” After experiencing my own spiritual and style transformation, I wrote this book to help other women recognize their worthiness and prettiness. The Worthy Wardrobe is my love letter to any woman that ever felt like she didn’t belong, wasn’t good enough, pretty enough, or that the fashion world wasn’t for her.

For more information, you can connect with me at info@widerstyle and @MorganWiderStyle on Instagram and Facebook.

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Instagram and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #TheWorthyWardrobe and tag me (@MorganWiderStyle) as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page

Please share my book to 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.

Thank you so much of all of your love and support!

Yours in Style, Shopping and Soul,
Morgan

story:
Women want options

We have been fighting to pass a bill to license and legalize Certified Professional Midwives (CPMs) in Maryland for the past three years--and we are very close to a win! More women and families than ever came out in a massive show of grassroots support last year, letting legislators know they demand childbirth options and licensed home birth midwives.  This year, we have to make a huge push to make our voices heard, and we need $12,000 to make this happen.  

With a Maryland hospital c-section rate of 35.1% vs an average home birth c-section rate of 5.2%, families have a right to choose the type of care they want in pregnancy. 

Really? Midwives are illegal in Maryland?

Many people are surprised to learn that Certified Professional Midwives are illegal in Maryland. While there are a handful of legal Certified Nurse Midwives who can attend home births in Maryland, they cover only a small portion of the state and cannot meet the demands of women who want home births. Most women in the state have no access to a legal provider. This places a severe limitation on women’s ability to choose how, where and with whom they give birth, violating their rights to make reproductive decisions for themselves.


Where does the money go?

The money will go to help fund our campaign, including:
  • Flying in national midwifery experts to testify and meet with health officials
  • Campaign t-shirts, buttons, stickers, signs and more to make us visible
  • Printed materials for state legislators to explain our issue
  • Lobbying efforts including professional support to reach influential legislators
  • Media campaign to reach a wider audience of supporters and put the pressure on Annapolis to respond

Perks! What You Get

Who can resist these midwifery-themed goodies?!:

  • $25 Personal Thank You from the midwives
  • $50 Midwife Bumper Sticker--"I'm PUSHING for MIDWIVES"
  • $100 Midwife Magnet that says "Support Midwives, Make Love" and "I'm PUSHING for MIDWIVES" Bumper Sticker
  • $150 Midwife T-Shirt--custom men's and women's t-shirts that say "Support Midwives, Make Love"
  • $250 Two Midwife Pillowcases that say "Support Midwives, Make Love" 
  • $500 Ina May Birth Story Movie


About the Association of Independent Midwives of Maryland (AIMM)

AIMM is the professional organization of homebirth midwives in Maryland. Women turn to AIMM for support of their sovereignty over their own health care, including choice of care provider and birth site. AIMM advocates for the homebirth community with state legislative, regulatory, and government bodies, as well as the media and the public. See more about all our projects at www.aimmidwives.org


    Other Ways You Can Help

    There are other ways to get involved!

    • Share this campaign on Facebook, Twitter, or via email. Ask friends and family to contribute to a cause that is important to you! 
    • Write, call or email your legislators--they need to hear from you! See Guidelines for letters
    • Join the Maryland Families for Safe Birth Facebook page for up-to-date information on actions.
    • Volunteer at www.marylandfamiliesforsafebirth.org 

    Your help will make a big difference!

     Contributions or gifts to the Association of Independent Midwives of Maryland are not tax deductible as charitable contributions.
